runners.name: Chemistry
runners.owner: James Paul Services To Industry Ltd

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Left Aidan O'Brien for 30,000gns; he gallops on as if he could be an out-and-out stayer
runners.spotlight: Two wins from five races for Aidan O'Brien, awarded a Listed contest at Leopardstown (1m6f, good) as he was battling back strongly when bumped in the closing stages; good second of 22 in major 1m5f handicap there next time but ended on a poor note; blinkered all starts but now visored and also gelded, following his 30,000gns sale in October; needs improvement but he gallops on as if he could be an out-and-out stayer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Vinnie Roe Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Obviously it's not really the way you like to get them, in the stewards' room, but unfortunately that's the way it worked out. Chemistry is a big, scopey horse and has just taken a bit of time to fill his frame. Aidan [O'Brien] thought it was a nice race to start him back in. He's a horse that will go as far as you want, he's very genuine. Declan gave him a very positive ride. He felt there's plenty more in there and he'll come on a lot fitness-wise. There is no immediate plan for him, we'll just find a Group race and step him up. We probably won't see the best of him until next year - Chris Armstrong, Ballydoyle representative.

runners.name: Dawn Rising

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Effective in top, big-field handicaps but wide draw may play against him
runners.spotlight: Won 2m5f Queen Alexandra at Royal Ascot in 2023 and 2m Curragh Group 3 last November; also effective in top, big-field handicaps, having been seriously involved in the Cesarewitch and Irish Cesarewitch; return to his peak (after an easy-to-forgive reappearance) would see him on the premises but wide draw may play against that.

quotes.quote: Dawn Rising came on the bridle with me from about halfway and he was loving it. I was able to mooch away down the centre in the straight. It took him a while to get to Gavin but he was finding plenty for me and I knew I was always going to get there - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider

Joseph had Dawn Rising beautifully prepared for today. He has been jumping and won a graded race over jumps during the winter, and today he just got himself into a nice spot and I just gradually built along. I hadn't really asked him for everything and he was always finding plenty. Joseph's horses can do that - Ryan Moore, rider, speaking to ITV Racing.

Dawn Rising learned a bit from Galway and came on plenty for the run. It was a good performance. He bumped into a good horse in Galway but came forward plenty. He's taken to hurdling well. We'll go down the novice route I'd imagine and see how we go - Frank Berry, racing manager to owner JP McManus.

He's a lovely, big, staying horse who had a very good run at the Curragh the last day. He was very idle in front and I know we won by 12 lengths, but you never know when there's something coming from behind you and the way he was rolling around, I just wanted to keep the revs up. He won with plenty in hand at the end. He looked at the stalls in the straight, they were pulled in and he copped them and ran out in the middle - Wayne Lordan, rider of Dawn Rising

stable_tour.quote: He won the Queen Alexandra two years ago and ran another good race in it when third last year. It makes sense to aim for the race again and he'll probably go to the Vintage Crop and the Saval Beg on the road like he did last year. 24-04-25
He had a nice run at Leopardstown in the Saval Beg and wasn't beaten far, so hopefully he'll run a nice race in the Queen Alexandra Stakes. 16-06-23

runners.name: Divine Comedy
runners.comment: Fine record over the last two years; needs better still but respected on first run here
runners.spotlight: Improved in handicaps in 2023 and 2024, for instance going close at Royal Ascot (2m4f, good to firm) last term, and she's reappeared with creditable runs in four-runner Listed and Group 3 races this season; usually ridden by Kaiya Fraser; needs better still but she's respected on first run here.

quotes.quote: I hadn't thought beyond today because two miles on this ground is a very different kettle of fish to two miles at Kempton but Divine Comedy loved the ground and the trip. The Ascot Stakes came to mind, black type will come into it at some point and the handicapper will have his say. Something like the Doncaster Cup could be a race for her down the line - Harry Eustace, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's been an absolute star but only once this year has she had her ground. She's in the Old Borough Cup and her main aim is the Irish Cesarewitch - on soft ground she could be very effective there. We thought about the Doncaster Cup but that's a bit too close to the Irish Cesarewitch. 11-09-24

She didn't run as a juvenile and has had three unplaced runs this season. I thought I would start off in modest company but the three maidens we have run in, at Wetherby, Newmarket and Yarmouth, proved to be hot races. She has been given a mark of 66, which I think is fair, and she'll be well suited to 1m2f and 1m4f. She's a big filly with scope to progress through the second half of the season. She'll act on quicker ground but would prefer some juice. 30-06-21

runners.name: Duke Of Oxford
runners.owner: A Cope, B Roberts And J Biggane
runners.comment: Always behind in major races in his only three turf starts, 11th in this (12-1) last year
runners.spotlight: 6-16 on AW and shaped as if better than ever 12 days ago when making up plenty of late ground in a warm but steadily run 2m race won by Caballo De Mar at Southwell; return to turf poses the big question as he's been always behind in major races in his only three turf starts, 11th of 16 in this (12-1) last year.

runners.name: Whos Glen
runners.comment: Won here (1m6f, heavy) last September; second at Kempton (upped to 2m, AW) six weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin win here (1m6f, heavy) last September and second of nine in useful handicap at Kempton (upped to 2m, AW) six weeks ago; his only two turf runs were in the mud; that poses a question but he's steadily progressive.

runners.name: Charging Thunder
runners.comment: Doing well for new yard; there's a good chance this trip will suit if he adapts to Chester
runners.spotlight: Joined this yard last September and has done well for them on the Flat and over hurdles; ran creditably, almost alongside Duke Of Oxford, in steadily run race won by Caballo De Mar at Southwell 12 days ago and there's a good chance this trip will suit if he adapts to the track and wide draw.

quotes.quote: I bought Charging Thunder on spec and sold him about an hour before the race, so it's all gone well. He was a good horse back in his day and has slipped into the lowest grade he's run in for a while. We've schooled him and he's taken to that quite well. He was going to go hurdling next, but after today we might change our mind, although he'll see a hurdle at some point - trainer James Owen speaking on Sky Sports Racing.
It's tough over and mile and six for these horses but Charging Thunder has toughed it out - William Buick, rider.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Bet 10Get20 Promo Code Chepstow Novice Median Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Charging Thunder was fit and well coming into today so David was pretty hopeful having brought him all the way down. His form has been pretty consistent and he's got a big stride on him so I've allowed him to get into his rhythm and he's galloped all the way to the line. It was a good effort - David Probert, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He might have been a bit mentally immature for Dubai. A half-brother to Makawee and Prince Of Arran, who both got better with age, he could make the jump up to Pattern company once he grows up and stops hanging and getting hot. He wants top of the ground and could start off in a handicap at York. 04-05-23

runners.name: Hot Fuss
runners.comment: Upped to 2m at Southwell (AW) in February for latest Flat run and won it in clearcut style
runners.spotlight: On Flat turf his sole win was a 2yo novice and peak results have been on soft or heavy; he's also acquitted himself with credit on good and good to soft over hurdles, though, and his latest Flat run was his best, when upped to 2m at Southwell (AW) in February and winning in clearcut style; bold show over hurdles at Cheltenham Festival since; case can be made.

runners.name: Zoffee
runners.comment: Nearly won this in 2023; did so in it last year (good to firm) off 1lb lower than today
runners.spotlight: Very nearly won the 2023 Chester Cup and everything fell right for him in last year's renewal (good to firm) when going one better off a 1lb lower mark than he has today; the lack of a race this year is the same as 2023 and, for the third time in this, he has a very low draw; he's now a 9yo and 3lb claimer is recruited, but no imagination is required to see him bang there.

quotes.race: Duke Of Westminster Supporting The Chester Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: We were a good second last year, and had the third with Rajinsky the year before, so it's great to have the winner. Harry gave Zoffee a great ride and I'm delighted to win this big race with him - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

The question mark was the ground, Zoffee has now proved he's totally versatile. He's still not there in his coat, we've been waiting for him to come and maybe if we'd got a run into him three weeks ago - Ben said he just took a slight blow with 100 yards to go. He'll come forwards and the Ascot Stakes or the Northumberland Plate would be possible races for him - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Northumberland Vase Handicap (Consolation Race For The Northumberland Plate)
quotes.quote: Zoffee did everything right today. He has plenty of ability and he was turned out in great shape. Hugo said he had flourished since Carlisle, he couldn't be happier with him - Ben Curtis, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a year older but looks as good as ever. He's where he should be at the moment and I'm just as happy with him as I was last year. His first runs of the year have definitely been his best in the last two seasons, so we'll go to the Chester Cup without a prep run. He's rated 1lb higher than when he won it last season and 2lb lower than when he was a close second in 2023. 09-04-25

He's had a great year with Hugo Palmer on the Flat and hopefully he's got a workable mark back over hurdles. The Peterson family are keen to have a go jumping this season, so he'll have a little break and maybe run around Christmas. If he can show his Flat ability over hurdles then he could have a nice mark. 26-10-23

He has had a great year with Hugo Palmer on the Flat and hopefully he has got a workable mark back over hurdles. The Peterson family are keen to have a go jumping this season, so he'll have a little break and maybe run around Christmas. If he can show his Flat ability over hurdles, then he could have a nice mark. 01-11-23

runners.name: Vaguely Royal
runners.comment: Peak form gives him a shout but others are more persuasive; tongue tied first time
runners.spotlight: Peak form for the Gosdens (registered at 1m6f on good or 1m4f/2m on AW) gives him a shout and he's shown some fair form over hurdles for new yard, albeit with a last of three on AW Flat on penultimate outing as well; tongue tied first time; others are more persuasive.

quotes.race: Five-Rivers Fostering Doncaster Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I rode Vaguely Royal at Chepstow last time, we made the running and a combination of him still being green and getting lonely in front cost us the race. We were very confident coming here today, I just wanted to make sure I got a lead. William was going pretty steady in front, I wound him up in plenty of time but he won cosily. He's not a slow horse and I wouldn't see him getting much further than a mile and a half - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

runners.name: Spirit Mixer
runners.comment: No show from wide draw in this race last year but he returned to Chester for two 2m wins
runners.spotlight: No show in this race last year but he returned to Chester for 2m wins last August and September, and his last three wins have now been at this track; not disgraced on reappearance four weeks ago but his 2024 campaign suggests this race might be a bit too competitive and, although not drawn as wide as last year, stall 13 might still not be ideal.

quotes.race: Newmarket Academy Godolphin Beacon Project Handicap
quotes.quote: Spirit Mixer is very well bred and did that very nicely. I waited for the gap to appear up the rail but I reckon she would have won anywhere across the track - Hayley Turner, jockey.

runners.name: Emiyn
runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs Et Al
runners.comment: Second in this last year (good to firm) and is 2lb lower today but slow starts are a worry
runners.spotlight: Often ridden by Zak Wheatley; would-be front-runner but slow starts have been interfering with that, including when he nevertheless managed second in this last year (good to firm; 2lb lower today); best known for exploits at Chester, admittedly last winning in July 2023 but his recent creditable reappearance should have brought him on; drawn low but the slow starts are a worry.

quotes.race: Duke Of Westminster Supporting The Chester Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Emiyn ran a cracking race. Turning in he was travelling well and he was probably looking for a gap. He likes it round here and we'll see what there is for him back here - Declan Carroll, trainer.

Emiyn is a nice horse who always runs well in nice races round here and we knew there was a big race in him. He got a drop of rain and that played a big part of it. The softer the better for him and if it was soft ground we'd have to consider the Cesarewitch. He's had a tough race there and we'd have to see how he comes out of it - Declan Carroll, trainer.

runners.name: Leinster
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: 4 runs; 270 days off when making all in 18-runner Curragh handicap (1m4f, soft; favourite)
runners.spotlight: Has had only four races; won a maiden at Down Royal (1m2f, good) last May; returned from 270 days off to make all in 18-runner handicap at the Curragh (1m4f, soft; favourite) six weeks ago and trainer expressed confidence that day that this Camelot 4yo has strength in stamina; he could not have been raised much further in trip than this but has to be respected.

quotes.quote: Leinster had a real nice run at Roscommon and had a setback so it was unfortunate he missed the rest of the season. Hopefully he can be a progressive stayer. He looked at Roscommon as if the trip was a bit short for him so we were looking forward to stepping him up and I don't think stamina will be any issue to him going forward. The form of the Roscommon race was strong and he handles soft ground well - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He improved for stepping up to a mile and a half at the Curragh last month, when winning a handicap in good style, and he could go for the Chester Cup or the Vintage Crop. He's hopefully going to be a progressive stayer this season. 24-04-25

runners.name: East India Dock
runners.comment: Progressive at up to 2m on the Flat last year and one of the top juvenile hurdlers since
runners.spotlight: Progressive at up to 2m on the Flat last year for James Fanshawe; there were suggestions in that campaign that he could do better still and they can only be strengthened by what he's done since as one of the top juvenile hurdlers; below form last April/June on his only two starts on good to firm but excuses can be made; big shout, surely, if the ground is okay.

quotes.quote: East India Rock ran a cracker and he has done nothing wrong. I thought he had won jumping the last. He jumped well enough, and although he made one little mistake, he was quick over them. It is not easy to win here as we are finding out, but we will keep coming. I think we will mix and match between the jumps and the Flat as he has an attractive handicap mark - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Finesse) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: East India Dock had a busy campaign on the Flat and I learned a bit with Burdett Road last season. We wanted to come back here on the New course and he's got two wins at the track now. He jumped so economically and quick, he doesn't need to lead but Sam [Twiston-Davies] wanted to control the race. He handled the ground fine and he's an exciting horse. I wouldn't swap him for any other horse [in the Triumph]. Burdett Road is a better horse but this one has only run three times and he could go by him. What I like about him is he stays well and he's uncomplicated. He's got a huge future - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Registered As The Prestbury Juvenile Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've no plans for where East India Dock will next run, but all roads lead to the Triumph now. He just relaxes more than Burdett Road and I think the New course will suit him better. He's run twice over hurdles now and hasn't made a mistake. We'll have one more run then go straight to the Triumph. We've got a few nice ones [juvenile hurdlers] so we should be able to have a good crack at it in March. We feel this horse is a bit more straightforward. We can ride him how we want to, we know he's going to stay and settle. He's taken to it really well but Burdett took a bit of time. I'd say Burdett is a better horse than him but we'll see what happens - James Owen, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's in great form and I'm really excited for the Triumph. He was progressive on the Flat and has taken to jumping really well. He's quick from one side to the other, is uncomplicated and goes on any ground. 18-2-25

He was trained on the Flat by James Fanshawe and switched to me to go hurdling. He took to it straight away. He won at Wincanton, where he beat a subsequent winner in Hot Fuss. At Cheltenham last time it was a great performance - he jumped very well, travelled lovely and won with plenty in hand. He's had a little bit of a freshen-up. He's been back working strongly and will run on Cheltenham's Trials day at the end of January. He's favourite for the Triumph and, from what we've seen, it's probably justified. But we had the favourite for it last year and the wheels came off just beforehand, so we won't count our chickens. 01-01-25

runners.name: Caballo De Mar
runners.comment: Spectacular improver on AW, upped to 2m last time; well handicapped with 3lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with two wins and has started this campaign with three more; the first win was on good ground and those since all on Southwell AW; withdrawn (upset in the stalls) once last month; dictated a slow pace in a warm race nine days later on first crack at 2m, which played against two of today's rivals for a start, but he nevertheless impressed in finishing firmly in charge; with 3lb penalty there's no doubt he's well handicapped.

quotes.race: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Caballo De Mar has been a slow burner but has been well placed by George (Scott, trainer). He's uncomplicated and stayed on really well. He should stay further again - Daniel Muscutt, jockey.

runners.name: Morning Air
runners.owner: Lady Price, C Shaw, C Boylan & I Tagg
runners.comment: 1-6 in France, the win over 1m2f on heavy as 2yo; won hurdle debut before two modest runs
runners.spotlight: 1-6 in France, the win over 1m2f on heavy as 2yo; comfortably won a juvenile maiden on her hurdle and stable debut at Leicester (1m7f, heavy) in December but well below that level on both attempts since, falling on latest; lots to prove even though stamina should be a strength.

runners.name: Bashful Boy
runners.breeder: Lynn Lodge Stud & Pier House Stud
runners.comment: 4th and respectable 9th in last two editions of 2m2f Cesarewitch at Newmarket in October
runners.spotlight: Won twice on good to firm in 2023; fourth and a respectable ninth in last two editions of the 2m2f Cesarewitch at Newmarket (soft) in October; while he's not done much over hurdles for a long while now and has been absent since November, those Newmarket runs mean he's not totally dismissed.

quotes.race: Christmas Party Nights At Dundalk Stadium Maiden
quotes.quote: Bashful Boy showed a good turn of foot and saw out the trip well after running a cracker here last time. He was genuine and hit the line well - John Feane, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a good summer on the Flat and over hurdles and he ran above expectations on soft ground when fourth in the Cesarewitch. However, the ground was probably too bad for him at Cheltenham on Saturday, when he was pulled up. I'd been hoping that stepping up in trip would eke out a little more improvement and I'd like to try three miles again when we can. 31-10-23

runners.name: Liam Swagger
runners.comment: Useful hurdler; never-nearer third at Chelmsford (1m6f, AW) was not backed up on Sunday
runners.spotlight: Useful juvenile hurdler, staying on well for third of 22 in handicap at Cheltenham Festival; close, never-nearer third of 14 at Chelmsford (1m6f, AW) next time was improved Flat form and also gave this trip some appeal, but he did not back up that performance when favourite at Newmarket (1m6f, good to firm) on Sunday and now has the widest draw.

quotes.race: Hallgarten And Novum Wines Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (Registered As Fred Winter) (Premier Hcap) (GBB)
quotes.quote: It would have been nice if he'd had a smoother passage, but it's a rough race; four-year-old handicappers who have only run in small fields, but Liam Swagger is a brave horse and I'm really pleased with him. He'll have a Flat campaign now. Chester Cup - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Wensleydale Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Liam Swagger enjoys his jumping and he relaxed better today than he did last time. His only mistake was the last down the back but he was fantastic three down and two down and very brave at the last. It was good to get his head in front again, he'll have learned a lot more and I hope he'll keep progressing - Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He definitely runs in the Boodles and will have a prep run on the Flat at Southwell on Friday. He's done well over hurdles, but struggled to carry the second penalty at Newbury. He's been freshened up since and hopefully Friday's prep will put him spot on for Cheltenham. 18-2-25

It was a good run when he was second at Newbury last time under his big weight. I think the winner's not a bad horse and we got stuck in the mud a bit. He's got a nice mark. He's currently on a break at the stud and will come back in the second week of January. He'll be prepared for the Boodles at Cheltenham and hopefully it'll be good to soft ground, which will really suit him. He'll probably have a Flat run as a prep. 01-01-25

2:35.race_name: Ire-Incentive, It Pays To Buy Irish Huxley Stakes (Group 2)

runners.name: Bolster
runners.comment: Listed win last November when last seen; in the mix on best form but might want slow going
runners.spotlight: Has a very healthy 6-11 strike-rate, including three 1m2f handicap wins last year (soft/good to soft) and a Listed triumph at Newmarket (1m2f, soft) in November when last seen; in the mix on his best form but his peak efforts have come on slow ground and he's unlikely to have such a surface today.

quotes.quote: The ground is key with Bolster. He's probably pounds ahead of himself on soft, even heavy ground. It makes such a difference. He stays so well. When he runs on good ground the speed horses just have that extra gear, but from three out today he was away and there was no stopping him. We'll speak to connections but it'll be likely one more or no more runs for him this year - James Cowley, trainer's assistant.
I'd say Bolster is a Group 3 horse - that's where we'll go, but he wouldn't want fast ground. We'll have a good look at an autumn campaign for him - Karl Burke, trainer.

runners.name: Cairo

prev_owners.owner: D Smith, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, Westerberg

runners.comment: Runner-up in two Group races at Meydan in the winter but has something to find today
runners.spotlight: Group 3 and Listed winner for Aidan O'Brien earlier in his career; runner-up in two Group races at Meydan in the winter but that form still leaves him with something to find in today's company.

quotes.race: UAE Derby sponsored by Atlantis The Royal (Group 2) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: It was Cairo's first run on dirt and he just didn't enjoy himself - Ryan Moore, jockey.

It was a nice even gallop from the word go which suited Cairo. He's a lovely horse physically and he's done everything right so far. He's in the Group 1 in France next weekend but that will probably come too soon - Chris Armstrong, stable representative.

quotes.race: Manguard Plus Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Cairo could drop back to seven, he has that bit of class - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was disappointing at Meydan, but we feel he just didn't face the kickback on the dirt. We are happy to forgive him the run. 06-04-23

runners.name: Certain Lad
runners.comment: Group 3 winner at Longchamp last September and he's firmly in calculations
runners.spotlight: 9yo who was better than ever last year, winning a Group 3 at Longchamp (1m2f, soft) in September; reappeared with creditable third of five in hot Group 2 there (1m2f, good) last month; has run well in defeat on both previous visits here (including this race in 2022) and firmly in calculations.

quotes.quote: Certain Lad was always a good horse, he won the Strensall as a four-year-old but had a couple of nasty injuries at five and six. This is the first year he's come into a season with no injury. He's sound and well, and a happy horse. He's got a great mind and is easy to train because he wants to do it. The two races for him are the Preis von Europa over a mile and a half or the Prix Dollar. I think I'll probably lean towards the Prix Dollar, but I'd love to run him in a Group 1 at some stage. He'll stay in training at nine and we'll see if he retains the same zest. We might have a look at something like the Prix Ganay at the start of the year. He's an eight-year-old and I won't have too much longer with him, so we won't mess around, we'll run him in some nice races - Jack Channon, trainer.

quotes.race: Red Rock Partnership Recruitment Solutions Handicap
quotes.quote: Certain Lad was rated 112, he's come back down to 100 (before York) and he's back to a mark he can win off, it's as simple as that really. He's still a very good horse, even at seven. He was a Listed winner as a two-year-old, he was third in the Railway Stakes and has won in Dubai. The handicapping system is there for a reason, he's come down and won two very nice races now. It has been discussed in the office a few times, whether we missed this and went straight to the November Handicap. Let's see how he comes out of this as he's had a couple of quick runs there. If he's bouncing, which I'm sure he will be knowing him, we might have a little look at it, if not we'll keep a mile and a half up our sleeve for next year because he loves racing and he's as good an advocate as you could have for racing, so he'll be carrying on next year as well - Jack Channon, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet And Symphony Group Strensall Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Certain Lad gave me a great ride. He was stepping down in trip and he settled really well. He hit a bit of a flat spot three and a half down but we came across to the stands' side and he was very tough, once I got daylight he really ran to the line for me. The further I went the better and he thrived on the ground - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Zabeel Turf Sponsored By Riviera 1 (Listed Handicap) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Certain Lad is improving with every run. He does everything a horse should do to get himself beat, but he keeps winning. In the prelims he gets very warm and is notorious for it. He gets hot and sweaty, but it doesn't seem to bother him in the race. He ran a bit fresh and keen the first two furlongs, but once he got into a rhythm, I was delighted. He picked them up well and kept going all the way to the line - Ben Curtis, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He had a great season last year, winning a Listed race and a Group 3 in France. He had a very small setback after his Group win, which prevented us from having a crack at some of the big ones, but he'll be campaigned at the top level. There's no point running him with penalties in Group 3s this year. We're going to take a punt to see if we can land a big one. He'll go for the Prix d'Harcourt at Longchamp on Sunday, all being well, with a view to then going for the Prix Ganay. He'll have entries in the Prince of Wales's and all those other races, and if one cuts up he's that high-level horse who could pick up the pieces. He seems to be training well and he's our flagbearer, and we hope he can win some more stakes races this year. 02-04-25

runners.name: Deepone
runners.comment: 2yo Group 2 winner in September 2023; just one run since, when well beaten in April 2024
runners.spotlight: Made it 3-5 in his 2023 2yo campaign when winning the Group 2 Beresford Stakes at the Curragh (1m); has raced just once since, when well beaten in Leopardstown Group 3 in April 2024; returns with Irish yard in good form and he's a contender if retaining his old promise, but that's the big question.

quotes.quote: Deepone is a nice horse and a horse whose been progressive all year. Things just didn't go right for him last time at Leopardstown, but he came out of the race very well. He's a strong traveller and he finds plenty. I think he'll be a mile-and-a-quarter to a mile-and-a-half horse next year. I hope for his owner Vimal Khosla that he has a Derby horse for next year and that will be it for this year. We had dropped him in on turning tracks the last twice, but I said to Billy, no nonsense today. Let's go and see if he's good enough and he put them to the sword. I think he's a good horse - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Deepone was well in himself and we wanted to educate him today. He ran from the front today having come from further back last day. He would have been better with a lead today. Hopefully he's a nice horse and I think he will stay - Paddy Twomey, trainer.
Deepone is a nice colt and was ready to start. I thought he would have to be good to win from his draw and it's great that he did - Paddy Twomey, trainer

runners.name: Liberty Lane
runners.comment: Group 3 runner-up last October; may have needed comeback run; key player if back on song
runners.spotlight: Defied top weight in the Cambridgeshire (1m1f, soft) last September and Group 3 runner-up over same C&D (good to soft) in October; also effective on good ground and went close over 1m2f last year; below par on reappearance in March but may have needed the run; key player if back on song.

quotes.quote: I was a bit worried at halfway as they looked like they had it on the stands' side, but I had walked the course yesterday and I was convinced that's not where you wanted to be. The ground was 100 per cent the reason Liberty Lane didn't perform in the race last year, as he wants a bit of juice in the ground to be able to get into a rhythm. I ran him in the Dante as a three-year-old and he was always running a bit free as a younger horse but he's always been a good horse - Karl Burke, trainer.

Liberty Lane was sick after the Lincoln and scoped very dirty. The only reasons I ran him today were because I knew Sheikh Obaid would be here and it was a hundred grand race that we had entered early in. He had been coming back to himself in recent days but I didn't expect that. He's learning to relax in his races now as he was always very keen. Clifford gave him a lovely ride today and he will improve for that - Karl Burke, trainer.
All Liberty Lane does is gallop. I always thought soft ground and a mile is what he wants - Clifford Lee, jockey.

quotes.race: British EBF Future Stayers Oath Novice Stakes (Sire And Dam Restricted Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That felt very good, Liberty Lane travelled well throughout and relished the ease in the ground. He's a lovely horse, tries hard and had been working really well at home. He's a big colt but he's so chilled out and relaxes really nicely. Lucy (Burke) has been riding him a lot at home and I'd galloped him a few times; he's progressed really nicely - Clifford Lee, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I don't think my runners at the Lincoln meeting were as fit as I thought they were and he probably wants a furlong further as well. He could go for the Earl of Sefton over nine furlongs next week if the ground is right. He's another one who is up in the handicap this year and we'll have to place him where we can, but he'd probably get ten furlongs as well and wants some cut in the ground. 11-04-25

A beautiful colt and, after winning his only start last year at Nottingham by five lengths, we put him away for the winter. On his return at Newmarket earlier this month I thought he would take some beating, but it could be that trying to concede 7lb to Waipiro will look to have been some task as I thought the winner looked smart on the day. I had wanted to run him at Newbury later that week as I felt the course would suit him more but I saw Sheikh Obaid had two other entries so I opted for Newmarket, although I know the Sheikh would not have minded where I ran him. We will look for a Derby trial if we can get some ground on the easy side. 07-05-23

runners.name: Space Legend
runners.comment: Ran well in defeat in Group 2s last year; lightly raced & could go to new level this term
runners.spotlight: Ran well in defeat last season in Group 2s at Royal Ascot (1m4f, good to firm) and at York's Ebor meeting (1m4f, good to firm); this lightly raced 4yo is in top hands and, having been gelded in the off-season, he could be the type to go to a new level this year; respected on his reappearance.

quotes.quote: I'm really pleased. The winner's pretty special, isn't he? He quickened up well, but Space Legend kept galloping so he'll stay. In time he'll get a bit further as well - James Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: The Foxes
runners.comment: Strong form in Group races in Hong Kong and Qatar the last twice; leading player
runners.spotlight: Won the Dante in 2023 and tapped back into that promise with easy Listed win at Newcastle (1m2f, AW) last November; has subsequently shown very strong form in defeat in Hong Kong Group 1 and Qatar Group 3, and he's a leading player this afternoon.

quotes.quote: The Foxes has run a career best to finish second to Rebel's Romance. I'm very pleased - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

That was a good performance as many people were writing The Foxes off. But he suffered a bad injury at Newmarket in April and was only 80 per cent fit last time out. Oisin gave him an inspired ride from the front and now we know he acts on the all-weather, we'll have to have a chat about whether we stick to that for the Winter Derby or head to Hong Kong next month - Alastair Donald, owners' spokesman.

He stood to jump and was a little slowly away. I followed the winner but I wanted to sit closer in the run. The winner got first run on me as we turned into the straight and The Foxes picked up brilliantly, but I'd loved to have been more forward in the run - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

The Foxes travelled brilliantly behind Auguste Rodin. At the bottom of the straight I switched out and I thought I had a chance to win but a mile and a half is a little bit too far for him. We will come back to a mile and a quarter - Oisin Murphy, rider.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Dante Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I was more relieved than impressed. The Foxes meandered across the course a little bit but he was the best horse in the race. We're thrilled, it's just what we wanted to see, to win the race and hopefully go on to better things. We always had a doubt whether he would stay a mile and a half but I think on today's evidence an extra couple of furlongs won't go amiss. He looks a likely candidate - Andrew Balding, trainer.

It was a tactical race. We thought they would go a stronger gallop than that but he has done very well to come from that position to get the job done. I love the way The Foxes galloped out head down. I would think that would be it (for the year). He has (got an entry in the Vertem Futurity Trophy) but I think he is a horse that will go on next year. I think he wants this sort of ground and I'd prefer to wait to next year - Andrew Balding, trainer.

quotes.race: British European Breeders Fund EBF Maiden Stakes (Colts & Geldings) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I was crestfallen when The Foxes was beaten at Ascot, but he ran no race. I've always thought a lot of him and seven furlongs is the bare minimum; he should stay a lot further. In terms of ability, he's up there with Bangkok, but is more relaxed, forward and switched on. I think we'll go for a Stakes race next - Andrew Balding, trainer.

4:45.race_name: Ladbrokes Get Rewarded With Ladbucks Chester Plate Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Artisan Dancer
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras Du Cadran Et Al
runners.comment: Dug deep to beat Surrey Belle by a head at Ripon; solid contender under a 3lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Went close on reappearance at Kempton (2m, AW) last month and got off the mark on turf at Ripon (2m, good) a fortnight ago, digging deep to repel Surrey Belle by a head; solid contender under a 3lb penalty.

runners.name: Zealandia
runners.breeder: S A S Elevage Du Haras De Bourgeauville
runners.comment: Continues to drop down the weights but for a reason; this is his first run since January
runners.spotlight: Continues to drop down the weights and perhaps the return of cheekpieces will be a plus (replacing a visor), but this 8yo failed to shine from last June onwards and this is his first run since January; something to prove.

runners.name: Gibside
runners.comment: Disappointing at Southwell just 12 days ago but a good case can be made on previous form
runners.spotlight: Disappointing at Southwell just 12 days ago; however, a good case can be made on his previous form as he won easily at York last October when back up to 2m (soft), and stayed on well for second over 1m6f at Southwell (AW) on his reappearance; versatile ground-wise; could bounce back with big run.

runners.name: Zimmerman
runners.comment: Won competitive handicap at York last July but hasn't posed a threat since
runners.spotlight: Won at York (2m, good to soft) last July and just 2lb higher today; could improve for recent return at Ripon but good performances were scarce last season and slow ground, which seems preferable, is unlikely to prevail.

quotes.quote: I wasn't worried about losing it in the stewards' room as the second bumped him too. I thought he'd go well but I don't know what happened at Newcastle. Zimmerman loves soft ground and stays two miles, so we'll find something for him if it stays wet - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Stayers Handicap
quotes.quote: Zimmerman did very well, he loves this ground and was very hardy at the finish there. He switched off and I was happy with his position - James Sullivan, rider.
Zimmerman ran well on his last two runs as well and is an improving horse. He should handle a step up in trip again and is a nice staying prospect - James Sullivan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well all last year and is another who's in the Chester Cup, and he'll be entered for the Northumberland Plate too. He's an improving staying horse and he runs at Ripon first. 23-04-24

runners.name: Law Of The Sea
runners.breeder: Miss K Rausing & Hascombe & Valiant Ltd

prev_owners.owner: S Beetham And DPL Fab Ltd

runners.comment: Majority of last year was disappointing but he was 3rd in this and is on a dangerous mark
runners.spotlight: The vast majority of last year was disappointing; however, perhaps first time up will be the time to catch him as he reappeared with a good third in this 12 months ago; now 12lb lower; could be dangerous.

runners.name: Surrey Belle
runners.comment: Head second to Artisan Dancer at Ripon and today's longer distance could be a plus
runners.spotlight: Progressive on the Flat last year and won twice over hurdles this February (2m/2m4f); reverted to the Flat with head second to Artisan Dancer at Ripon (2m, good) a fortnight ago and she's 3lb better off with the penalised winner; today's longer distance could be a plus and she's a leading player.

quotes.race: High Gosforth Park Golf Club Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Surrey Belle is a good filly, she's got a great cruising speed and loads of scope. When I bought her I had fences in mind.   She'll probably end up a 130-rated filly over hurdles and she'll be a really exciting novice chaser for next season.   We'll keep an eye on the weather at Cheltenham, when you go up into that type of class give in the ground would help her a lot, but she's also in the Herring Queen Series final at Kelso, that's a £100,000 race and gives me a bit more time after today so that's probably where she'll go next - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's a big, galloping filly by Golden Horn. She  won at Wolverhampton in November and then was third first time out back there. I suppose we were slightly disappointed but she ran a bit fresh. We've always thought she was better than she'd shown. She ran well on Sunday when third at Nottingham - sadly the jockey on a late Sunday afternoon, after an excellent debrief, got distracted and failed to weigh in. 06-06-24

runners.name: Dreams Adozen
runners.breeder: S A R L Al Shahania Stud France
runners.comment: Claims not pressing judged on recent form but she has a good record here; not written off
runners.spotlight: Her claims aren't pressing on her form this spring; however, she won off this mark at Newcastle (2m, AW) in January and has a good record here (two wins and five second placings from 12 runs); not written off back here.

quotes.quote: Dreams Adozen handled the ground. It's absolutely bottomless but she ploughed through it, maybe the others didn't go in the ground - Joe Fanning, jockey.

runners.name: Simiyann
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Two AW wins last October but merely mid-division at Chelmsford (1m6f, AW) three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins last October but merely mid-division at Chelmsford (1m6f, AW) three weeks ago when back from a 70-day break and he struggled when tackling turf last season; others make greater appeal.

runners.name: Dance Time

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late L R Owen

runners.comment: Three AW wins since last November; maybe did too much in front last time; not discounted
runners.spotlight: Three wins on AW since last November (2m/1m5f), the latest at Lingfield last month; well beaten there last time but maybe did too much in front; showed some promise on turf last summer and is not discounted.

stable_tour.quote: She's done extremely well, putting on a serious amount of weight. I think she's put on 85kg since last season. She's a bull of a filly. How she did as well as she did at two and three is amazing really - she's a bit of an enigma. She has a super attitude. She's probably two or three weeks away from a run and I think we'll have some fun with her as she's very well-handicapped off 67. 30-05-24

runners.name: Tailorman
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Logis Et Al
runners.comment: Two wins last August/September and promising third on recent return; he's one to consider
runners.spotlight: Two wins last August/September (2m, good to firm/AW) and denied a clear run when close third on reappearance at Nottingham (1m6f, good to firm) ten days ago; has run well on both previous visits here and he could be suited by today's step up in trip; he's one to consider.

runners.name: Royal Deeside
runners.comment: Soundly beaten second of five at Pontefract last month and remains a maiden in both codes
runners.spotlight: Fit from the jumps when reverting to the Flat with a soundly beaten second of five at Pontefract (2m2f, good) last month; remains a maiden in both codes and needs something extra today in the first-time cheekpieces.

stable_tour.quote: He was placed nearly every run over hurdles last season, he's strengthened over the summer and, although I was rather disappointed with him at Plumpton two runs ago he did run much better at Warwick on Tuesday. His trip is 2m, to start with at least. 07-11-24

runners.name: Flight Leader

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.comment: 4-10 in France for Andre Fabre; 100,000gns buy in October; gelded; looks on a testing mark
runners.spotlight: 4-10 in France for Andre Fabre, untried beyond 10.5f; sold for 100,000gns in October and gelded; looks on a testing mark for British debut.

runners.name: Take Heart
runners.comment: Won a valuable 1m2f handicap at Glorious Goodwood (good) last summer off 3lb lower
runners.spotlight: Won a valuable 1m2f handicap at Glorious Goodwood (good) last summer off 3lb lower; that's clearly his best form but he's race-fit and not dismissed.

quotes.quote: Take Heart has been training very well. Going to York, I thought he had a big chance but he was drawn on the outside which made things difficult. So, when he was drawn 18 today, I thought 'What did I do wrong to get these bad draws?'. He was only beaten by four and a half lengths at York and he had a lot of ground to make up in the straight, so Ben [Coen, jockey] said he would be a little closer today. They went so slow that he was controlling the race at all times. This trip is probably ideal. I haven't spoke to Barry [Irwin, founding member] and Team Valor yet, but there's the big handicap on Irish Champions Weekend that he ran very well in last year so he could go there. He's probably a Stakes horse and he might make it up to there one day - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: TRM Speedxcell Multi Vitamin And Mineral Tonic Handicap
quotes.quote: Take Heart is a fine big horse that does not do much at home, but you cannot fault his form when he gets to the track. He's one of those slow developers but he could be a premier handicap horse if he keeps improving - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

runners.name: Penzance
runners.comment: Needs to be in peak form but he's never quite delivered that on turf and is 0-7 on grass
runners.spotlight: 5-14 on AW, with all the wins over 1m2f, and versatile tactically; needs to be in peak form but he's never quite delivered that on turf and is 0-7 on grass following his respectable fifth in last Saturday's Thirsk Hunt Cup.

stable_tour.quote: He's been one of our big success stories over the last 12 months. We bought him when he was rated 74 and he won four of his first five starts for us and went up to a career-high mark of 100 by the end of the all-weather season. It took him a while to get into gear on the turf but he ran his best race yet on the grass at Doncaster this month. That showed us he can compete in good races on the turf as well. He's going to go for the Cambridgeshire on Saturday. He's in good form and hasn't had a busy summer and it's brilliant prize-money and a fantastic race to have a runner in. It's a bit of a free hit. Away from that, he'll be working back from the Easter Classic, in which he was second last season. We'll be looking at some of the better all-weather prizes that will get him qualified for finals day. Hopefully he can go one better this time. 26-09-24

runners.name: Grey Cuban
runners.comment: Won twice over C&D last July; much more to prove if the ground is good to firm
runners.spotlight: Usually front-runs or races very prominently but has the widest draw today; won twice over C&D last July (also scored elsewhere last April and September) and not disgraced on reappearance six weeks ago; respected back here but he'd have much more to prove if the ground is good to firm.

quotes.quote: Grey Cuban is an honest, straightforward horse. He needs to be ridden up with the pace. He's an amazing horse for the syndicate. He continues to improve and this ground suited him - Mike Edwards, head of Roudee Racing.

stable_tour.quote: I was hopeful he'd stay a mile and three furlongs in the Rosebery but he just didn't appear to. He loomed large in the straight looking like he was going to do something but his run flattened out. We'll be dropping back to a mile and two. He'll go for a 0-105 handicap at Chester, where he's won twice, and he should be a fun handicapper at that sort of level this summer. He likes a bit of cut in the ground. He's almost rated 100 now and the air gets a bit thinner up there, so he'll have to improve again. 09-04-25

By the sire of the moment Havana Grey, this colt made a very satisfactory debut when second to Les Bleus at Newmarket last month and then was runner-up again at Nottingham last week. It's not often I'm happy finishing second but I had to be pleased with the way he ran at Nottingham. He finished like the proverbial train and in another dozen strides would have won. That was over 6f again but having witnessed that effort you'd be stunned if he didn't get further as he looked to be crying out for a longer trip. It was an eyecatching run and hopefully his turn is very close. He's a smashing colt who was a Goffs UK purchase and we've been kind of targeting him at the sales race at York next week. He's also in the 6½f sales race at Doncaster's St Leger meeting next month. In time I see him doing well over a mile. He was bought very cheaply as he was a very big horse. Basically, he looked like a giant but he isn't at all and I think his owners have bought very well. I liked him from the word go and would be very disappointed if he didn't win this year. 17-08-23

runners.name: Auld Toon Loon
runners.comment: Relished return to Flat for new yard last term; 2023 saw a win on only visit to this track
runners.spotlight: Relished return to Flat for new yard when bolting up at Bath (1m2f, soft) in October before a close fourth in the November Handicap (1m4f, soft); third at Lingfield (AW) on New Year's Eve was creditable, seeing as it was a Listed race, and he did win at a lower level on good to firm in 2023; that year also saw him win on his only visit to this track; considered.

runners.name: Mustazeed
runners.comment: Unraced on firmer than good since 2021; Newbury suits him particularly well; unraced here
runners.spotlight: Unraced on firmer than good since 2021; Newbury suits him particularly well, given he won there on his first two starts of 2023 and also once last September; this track is new to him but he needs a second look.

stable_tour.quote: He was with the Crisfords last season and put up a couple of moderate unplaced efforts. We started him off over 7f and he didn't show much, but when we tried him over 1m½f at Wolverhampton he put up a much better show to be a half-length third. It was when we stepped him up to 1m2f last time at Yarmouth that he showed his true colours when comfortably winning by three and a half lengths. It certainly didn't look as if that would be the case at the start as he fluffed it completely, which was a surprise as he had never shown that trait before. I thought the ground might be too quick for him as he has a round action but he was fine and, having given them a fair head start, he ran on very strongly and looked impressive. I think that trip is ideal for him now and despite an 8lb hike in the handicap I think he'll remain very competitive. 30-06-21

runners.name: Andaleep
runners.comment: Unraced here; has a highly competitive mark if the two runs this spring have put him right
runners.spotlight: 12 wins in all, the latest at Windsor (1m2f, good to firm) last July; unraced here but he has a highly competitive mark if the two runs this spring have put him right.

quotes.race: BetUK. Home Of The Acca-Fenwa Handicap
quotes.quote: Andaleep was a pleasure to ride. The idea was to sit handy and tough it out, and he was a very game performer - Callum Hutchinson, jockey.

I thought a mile and a half would be his trip but I was wrong! Andaleep likes proper quick ground and a mile and a quarter suits him really well. We'll look for another similar race on a stiff track - Graeme McPherson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: When he was sent to us, we thought he'd win a couple because he was well handicapped, but not eight! He just keeps finding more, but this winter I think we've learned more too. Before, he was bullying lesser horses, but he's now at a level where we've had to work out exactly how to ride him, while there's a style of race that suits. He likes to come through horses, but seems suited to 1m2f and 1m4f races, where they don't go hard and it's a sprint. I think that's why he did well on the all-weather over the winter because they seem to walk in plenty of those races. He's won of turf, though, and should be out again in May. 02-05-24

runners.name: Warda Jamila
runners.comment: Close 4th of six at Epsom (1m2f, good) when outsider of the party was a promising return
runners.spotlight: Had 1m2f wins last May and September, latterly having to bide her time when she scored in last-gasp fashion at Haydock (good to soft; acts on good to firm); needs to improve but that's possible in this second season handicapping and her close fourth of six at Epsom (1m2f, good) 17 days ago, when outsider of the party, looked a promising first step; major player.

quotes.race: British EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Warda Jamila has done nothing wrong there and was professional on her second start. She has a great mind and it will be interesting to see where she ends up distance-wise as she is related to Coltrane and by Calyx. She's a nice type - Jason Watson, jockey.

runners.name: Rathgar
runners.comment: Reliable sort (close 2nd at Epsom latest) and firmly in the mix if he adapts to this track
runners.spotlight: Versatile with ground and trip and he can make the running if necessary; unraced here but this reliable sort went close at Epsom on latest start (Warda Jamila close up) and looks firmly in the mix if he adapts to this track.

quotes.race: Weekly Rewards With tote Stayers Club Racing League Race 7 Handicap (Trainers Reg' To Racing League)
quotes.quote: It took us a while to really figure Rathgar out. I think his future lies over this kind of trip. He was relentless really, he jumped a lot better and he was able to keep the revs up from a long way out and responded well for pressure - David Probert, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Qitaal

prev_owners.owner: Johnston Racing Ltd & King For A Day

runners.comment: 8l C&D win last September (8lb higher today); below form twice since a good reappearance
runners.spotlight: Can front-run; sometimes hangs; scored by 8l over C&D last September (8lb higher today) and good third of 16 at Doncaster this March; two of his lesser shows since but he's bounced back here before.

quotes.quote: We trained Qitaal as a two-year-old but sadly at the time Shadwell were cutting back and sold all of our horses. I made as strong a case as I could that this was one they didn't want to be letting go of and when Robert Ng bought him I contacted them and asked if there was any chance this horse could stay with us. We think a lot of him. He went to Ireland and was only seen once in two years and when I saw his name in the Tattersalls August catalogue I thought I had to see him. He was a bit of a shell of the horse who left us but when he was making 4,000gns I couldn't leave him behind so I bought him back and threw him to the field for the rest of last year.  We've been bringing him back this spring, his work had been good and that wasn't a surprise, although I worried the ground might find him out after two years off. He's a horse we liked three years ago and now he's finally fulfilling that potential - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

runners.name: Lets Dream
runners.comment: Lightly raced; needs to step up from 3yo runs and plenty to prove away from soft ground
runners.spotlight: 1m2f Goodwood maiden win (soft) was one of his four 2yo races; only three runs last year, two of them respectable in handicaps and they were also on soft; needs to step up from that and plenty to prove if rain stays away.

runners.name: Tarkhan
runners.owner: R A Pegum And P A Henry
runners.comment: Third in Italian Group 2 last November but very lofty mark to defy on British/stable debut
runners.spotlight: Previously trained in Germany, where he won a Listed race last October (6.5f, soft), and he was a close third in an Italian Group 2 next time (1m, heavy); those were career-best efforts from this 6yo but he has a very lofty mark to defy on this British and stable debut; may be best watched.

runners.name: Never So Brave
runners.comment: Won over C&D 12 months ago and new trainer has a good record in this race; has been gelded
runners.spotlight: Drawn wide today and below par last October on final run for Sir Michael Stoute, but gelded since and showed strong form otherwise last season, including when winning over C&D (good) 12 months ago; new trainer has won three of the last ten runnings, including in 2021 and 2022; on the shortlist.

quotes.quote: Never So Brave showed some nice form last year and he's come out this year and practically won as he liked at Thirsk. He's just kept progressing and this was a step up to find out whether we're still going in the right direction and he's done everything he was asked to do. It's difficult to say how high he'll go but he did that quite nicely and if he got the mile, you'd like to think he'd be a Britannia horse - Philip Robinson, racing manager to Saeed Suhail, owner.

runners.name: Gorak
runners.owner: D Macauliffe, Anoj Don & First Tuesday
runners.comment: Close second at Haydock on reappearance and ran really well over C&D last August
runners.spotlight: Losing run goes back 14 races to May 2023 but he reappeared with a close second at Haydock (7f, good) a fortnight ago and ran really well over this C&D (good) last August; every chance he'll be bang there.

quotes.quote: Gorak has the action to suggest the ground would suit him. He enjoyed the track and the ground and he's pretty progressive - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He has been a star and it was great to see him get his head in front again at Doncaster in April when bolting up over 7f by five and a half lengths off a mark of 73. I know some people felt we have probably blown our handicap chances for a while, but the handicapper was fair in putting him up 5lb. Despite finishing second in his last two races, I feel he is still on an attractive mark. At Chester last time he just got caught for a turn of foot as they turned for home, but I was greatly encouraged by how he stayed on when they straightened up. He is consistent and, if the ground remains on the soft side, then he will be a fun little horse who can add more wins to our tally for the year. 28-05-23

runners.name: Two Tempting
runners.comment: Won over C&D last August and ran well at Newbury last time; has a big shout from stall 1
runners.spotlight: Made it five wins for 2024 when scoring over C&D (good) last August on sole previous course visit; returned to form with creditable fourth at Newbury (1m, good) four weeks ago and he has a big shout from stall 1.

quotes.race: Listen To BetMGM On talkSPORT Handicap
quotes.quote: Two Tempting never ceases to amaze me, he's just a very tough horse. He goes on any ground but I didn't want too much rain. It was on the easy side at Epsom and definitely on the easy side here, and he's shown he goes on any ground - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

I didn't think we'd got it on the line but I'd have been happy with second. I thought Two Tempting ran a blinder. He ran well here last year but we didn't expect to win. The jockey had him in the right place at the right time. He's not in the Hunt Cup - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

runners.name: Divine Libra
runners.comment: Two-time course winner; today's draw could have been better but respected nevertheless
runners.spotlight: Two-time course winner, the latest at this meeting 12 months ago, and good second from wide draw over C&D (good) last August; denied clear run when close sixth on recent reappearance at Haydock; today's draw could have been better but Ryan Moore rides and he's respected nevertheless.

stable_tour.quote: He did well from three to four and has been in good form this season, winning at Chester's May meeting and beaten no distance at Newmarket last time. He's got an entry in the Wokingham but the Buckingham Palace over seven furlongs looks tailor-made for him. He wouldn't want it too firm and if he could just get his toe in, that should be fine. 13-06-24

He's a lightly raced colt who won over 7f first time out at Catterick this season. It was a rare runner for me there but it was the right race for him and he won like a nice horse. I didn't want to go to a big track and pick up a lofty handicap mark and that suited perfectly. I've given him an entry for the Jersey Stakes on Saturday, but he had a dirty scope last week and I‘ll have to speak to his owners before we decide whether to go. 21-06-23

runners.name: Cracking Gold
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo who won at Southwell (AW) in March but below par at Newcastle (AW) since
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who won at Southwell (1m, AW) in March on first run since wind surgery; has shown some promise on turf (three starts) but his best results have come on AW and he needs to bounce back from a below-par run at Newcastle (1m, AW) three weeks ago.

runners.name: Yanifer
runners.comment: Slow ground may be preferable but he has a good record here and is a possible player
runners.spotlight: Slow ground may be preferable and this is his first run since last September, but he ran really well first time up last season and his course form figures read 182315 (including a good-ground win in 2022); possible player.

runners.name: Transcending Glory

prev_owners.owner: Kildare Racing Syndicate & Kilmichael Racing Syndicate

runners.comment: Drawn wide but lightly raced and could still have more to offer for in-form Irish trainer
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has a tough draw in stall 14 and he wasn't at his best on his final two runs last year; however, he won a good handicap at Leopardstown (7f, good) last July and this lightly raced 4yo could still have more to offer for his in-form Irish trainer.

runners.name: Persuasion
runners.comment: Won at Musselburgh latest; a long time since he won off a mark this high but not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Having dropped back down to his last winning mark he scored at Musselburgh (7f, good to soft) three weeks ago on his second start of the season; has been effective on good/good to firm in the past; it's a long time since this 8yo won off a mark this high (up 4lb) but he's not ruled out.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Silver Arrow Handicap
quotes.quote: We had the perfect trip, a good draw and a nice position. Persuasion went well throughout the race and toughed it out all the way to the line. He's been a consistent horse in defeat and he'd won off this mark at Haydock last year and we were fairly hopeful -  Callum Rodriguez, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He really pleased me on his only start this season when beating stablemate Dulas at Haydock over seven furlongs. The form of that race is working out well and on a new mark of 96 he should have a nice weight in the Buckingham Palace. I'd like to think he has a very good chance. - 10-06-21

runners.name: Kindest Nation
runners.comment: C&D winner on heavy ground last September but faces different conditions on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Drawn well today and she made it 2-2 in this visor when winning here (7f, heavy) last September; respectable Listed efforts the next twice (7f, soft/heavy) but her mark shot up as a result and the forecast good ground may not be ideal on her return to action.

stable_tour.quote: She really surprised me last year, not only by how much she grew given she was a small two-year-old but how she improved through the year. She likes give in the ground and we'll try to get some black type with her. She's done well from three to four, so I'm also hopeful she can win a handicap or two along the way. 09-04-25

runners.name: Pearl Eye
runners.comment: Went close over C&D last September and kept on well for fifth over 7f here on Wednesday
runners.spotlight: Can be slowly away, which was costly here on Wednesday when he ran on well for fifth of 13 (7f, good); seems to like it here and today's extra yardage should be a plus; went close over C&D (soft) last September; contender.

quotes.race: William Hill Bet £10 Get £10 Spring Mile Handicap
quotes.quote: I've only seen the side on and they both went for the same gap. The crucial part of it was that it was a short head. Did the interference cost Pearl Eye the race? The stewards deemed it did so that's why they've overturned it. He's done well regardless and I'd have taken second. He's run super from that low draw. He was a big price but I really liked him. He had a run the other day with cheekpieces on and that put him spot on, he's quite stuffy. He was unlucky at Chester last year and that's where he'll go next - Darryll Holland, trainer.

Pearl Eye should have won here last year, he was unlucky under Patrick Cosgrave, but he's made amends now and it's nice to win first up. He won four for us last year and was only out of the first four once. He's an improving horse and he goes to Chester now for a mile-and-a-quarter handicap. He was second off his highest mark there last year - Darryll Holland, trainer.

runners.name: Spirit Genie
runners.comment: Course winner; ran okay here on Wednesday but needs to raise his game today
runners.spotlight: Three wins last year (1m/7f), including here, and he runs off his last winning mark; ran okay when seventh of 13 here (7f, good) on Wednesday but needs to raise his game if he's to return to winning ways today.

stable_tour.quote: The plan is to start him off in a mile handicap at Naas on Monday. He's doing things nicely at home. A mile or even 1m2f will suit him well. 21-04-23

runners.name: Cheshire Dancer
runners.comment: Some good form last term; further improvement is possible but she may want a stiffer test
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who won at Newcastle (1m, AW) last June and was second at Sandown (1m2f, good) in August; further improvement is possible this term but the drop back in trip could be a negative at this tight track.

stable_tour.quote: The plan last year was to try to get her into the Sandringham, which we failed to do, as she went to Kempton and ran the only bad race of her life. This year the plan would be to head to the Kensington Palace Stakes, so she'll probably have one run before she goes there. She's a good-looking filly with a lovely pedigree, so I'd be hopeful we can get some black type with her. 09-04-25

This lovely filly, who runs in the colours of the Manor House Stables Syndicate, made a great start to her career last weekend at Haydock when she was third over 7f. She showed her inexperience at the start when ducking out to the right but warmed to her task as the race went on and finished well. She should be a little more streetwise next time. 17-08-23

runners.name: Yermanthere
runners.comment: Won off similar mark at Carlisle last August but that was a rare high point last season
runners.spotlight: Could improve for reappearance sixth at Ripon (slipped badly early on) and he's just 1lb higher than for Carlisle win (7f, good) last August; however, that was a rare high point last term and his claims aren't compelling.

quotes.quote: Yermanthere had his conditions today and he had been working very well at home - Andrew Kinirons, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's another who has had a good break since joining us. We decided to wait for the summer with horses like him who look to be well handicapped; that's where the money and the races are. It looks as though he's a seven-furlong horse. 23-04-24

runners.name: Partisan Hero
runners.comment: Progressive this year but winning run halted last time and he's up in grade today
runners.spotlight: Made all at Kempton (1m, AW) and Pontefract (1m, good) before creditable second at Pontefract (1m, good) nine days ago; however, he's 3lb out of the handicap now up in grade and his wide draw could prove tricky.

quotes.race: Societies Welcome At Gowran Park Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't use my whip much as I was fairly confident Partisan Hero was doing enough the whole way up the straight. His last furlong was probably his best so he will be able to go up in trip. There should be improvement in him - Jake Coen, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: A horse I bought out of Dermot Weld's, he had his first start for us at Windsor this month and just got done in second when he was probably unlucky. He was an expensive horse [72,000gns] for what he's rated [68], but I like him a lot and think he'll be a lovely horse. We got him in October and he's taken time to get right. It was quick enough at Windsor and he probably wants a bit of cut in the ground. I hope he could end up being a Saturday horse. 30-05-24

2:05.race_name: Boodles Darley EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Al Wasl Storm
runners.comment: Runner-up at Lingfield (1m4f, AW) last month on second start and could have a big say
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on debut on April 12 (1m3f, good) but left that run behind to finish second at Lingfield (1m4f, AW) 11 days later; open to further improvement and could have a big say if the return to turf isn't an issue.

runners.name: Ammes
runners.comment: Runner-up at Kempton recently; pedigree suggests the longer trip will suit; leading claims
runners.spotlight: Built upon the promise of last November's debut fourth at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) when second of 14 at Kempton (1m2f, AW) recently; his brother and dam won at up to 1m4f/12.5f respectively and he holds leading claims now up in trip, provided he copes with the switch to turf.

runners.name: Pole Star
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
runners.comment: Brother to 1m AW winner Tribal Moon (RPR 72); needs to be very useful to win this on debut
runners.spotlight: Third foal; Teofilo brother to 1m AW winner Tribal Moon (RPR 72); dam 1m winner (including German Listed); there's every chance he has a future but he'll need to be very useful to win this on debut.

runners.name: The Pouncing Lion
runners.comment: Improvement needed on second start but Ryan Moore booked and stable in fine form
runners.spotlight: Backed into 15-2 when 11l third of seven on debut at Goodwood (1m1f, heavy) last October; absent since and plenty of improvement is needed today, but Ryan Moore has been booked for this 140,000gns yearling and his trainer is enjoying an excellent spring; interesting contender.

runners.name: Wise Counsellor
runners.comment: Runner-up the last twice and is in good hands to continue to progress; respected
runners.spotlight: Went close at Wolverhampton (1m4f, AW) in March on second start and also runner-up at Musselburgh (12.4f, good to soft) last month; he was no match for the winner in Scotland but that was Caspi Star, who was third in Wednesday's Cheshire Oaks; wears first-time cheekpieces and is in good hands to continue to progress; respected.

runners.name: Orionis
runners.comment: Third over 1m2f at Wetherby and pedigree provides optimism the step up in trip will suit
runners.spotlight: Fair sixth last November on sole 2yo start (8.6f, AW) and showed improvement when third at Wetherby (1m2f, good to firm) 12 days ago; now takes on males but she's with a top yard and her pedigree provides optimism the step up in trip will suit; possible player.

runners.name: Sportingsilvermine
runners.comment: 0-18 in Ireland but he's won both his starts (1m3f/1m4f handicaps) for James Owen
runners.spotlight: 0-18 in Ireland (close second on good to firm) but he's won both his starts for James Owen in handicaps at Southwell (1m3f, AW) and Musselburgh (1m4f, good); up another 5lb but 7lb claimer is recruited and it's hard to back against further improvement.

runners.name: Small Fry
runners.comment: Has won here; the recent satisfactory return to the Flat may bring him back to his best
runners.spotlight: Flourished last July-October with three wins and three seconds in space of six races, with the third win over 1m6f here; more to prove on good or good to firm but he made a satisfactory return to the Flat under Ashley Lewis at Epsom (1m4f, good) 17 days ago and that may bring him back to his best.

quotes.race: Get The Inside Track With raceday-ready.com Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a slow pace and I was held hostage to that slow running of the race. At halfway I was locked away and I had a look up and Callum was getting a freebie. It's always worrying when you see that but luckily I was able to get myself out of that position. Small Fry seemed more comfortable today and the step up in trip seemed to help - Tom Queally, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Marhaba Million
runners.comment: Tailed off on final start for Owen Burrows; changed hands for 50,000gns last July; gelded
runners.spotlight: Fair form twice (1m3f/1m4f) last spring for Owen Burrows but tailed off when visored on handicap debut in June (1m4f, good to firm) and changed hands for 50,000gns in July; gelded since; questions to answer.

runners.name: Reel Rosie
runners.comment: 2023 win here; mixed for new yard; cheekpieces (absent for over two years) return
runners.spotlight: 1m2f winner on heavy going in 2023 on sole run at this track, when trained by Hugo Palmer; 2lb lower today, having missed 312 days before a mixed Flat/hurdles campaign for new yard, which included one hurdles win; cheekpieces (absent over two years) return and she did win in them once in 2022.

stable_tour.quote: She won a mares' novice hurdle at Sedgefield in mid-November and we're looking to find a similar race in the next two weeks, in which she can maybe defy a penalty and then go down the handicap route. She's owned by a great little syndicate and hopefully she's lucky for them. Her best trip appears to be 2m4f. 05-12-24

runners.name: Miaswell
runners.comment: Won twice (1m, soft) last May/July for David O'Meara but modest in four hurdle races since
runners.spotlight: Won twice (1m, soft) last May/July for David O'Meara but modest in four hurdle races for new connections.

runners.name: Shahbaz
runners.comment: Both wins were on AW, including penultimate start; old turf form was better than this mark
runners.spotlight: Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) early last month saw his first win since 2022 and only his second overall from 29 races; ran respectably in a competitive race at Lingfield three weeks ago; rarely seen on turf in 2024 and not in 2025 but his old turf form was better than this mark.

stable_tour.quote: He progressed as the season went on last year culminating with victory over 1m1f in a Newmarket nursery off a mark of 82. This season he has had two runs, not troubling the judge on either occasion, and he was a bit disappointing last time out at Ascot over 1m2f, where they went no gallop which did not suit him. I am still not convinced he gets 1m2f as if you watch a replay of that race he is weakening as they approach the line. I did put him in the London Gold Cup last Saturday, but it was too dry to run him. I will give him another try over 1m2f and see, but I would not be surprised if we drop him back to a milen. The key to him is the race must be run at proper pace. 28-05-23

runners.name: Obsidian Knight
runners.comment: 0-11 on turf; however, going well on Lingfield AW recently and now bids for a hat-trick
runners.spotlight: 0-11 on turf and his 2024 turf record does not inspire; however, he's been going well on Lingfield AW recently as now bids for a hat-trick.

quotes.race: Huge Daily Boosts Only At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Obsidian Knight has won round here three times now but I wouldn't say he has to come here. What he needs is a proper gallop, and he got one today. We're looking forward to running him on the turf, but whether we give him a break or go for one of the bonuses, I'll speak to the owners and see what they want to do. He seems to handle the track lovely and Tom gave him an absolutely perfect ride - Terry Kent, trainer.

runners.name: Woodstock City

prev_owners.owner: Gl Racing, Ecurie Normandy Spirit & J-P-J Dubois
O Gonzalez Lozano, Ecurie Normandy Spirit & J-P-J Dubois

runners.comment: Third at this meeting last year and back to form to win at Ripon (1m2f) last August
runners.spotlight: Creditable third at this meeting last year but went downhill in two further runs at this track; back to form off this mark under Andrew Breslin at Ripon (1m2f, good to firm) last August, his only British win, and has a run under his belt this term; more to prove, however, over this trip.

runners.name: Oman
runners.comment: 9lb higher than when winning a division of this race last year; also scored in October
runners.spotlight: Won a division of this race (good to firm) last year under Zac Wheatley on stable/seasonal debut and returned to form with a win at Yarmouth (1m2f, soft) in October; 9lb higher than last year but needs a second look.

stable_tour.quote: He was a useful Flat horse for Ralph Beckett, who thought he was a bit quirky and may be sweetened up by hurdling. He's schooling now and I'm not sure if he'll want two miles or two and a half, we'll feel our way with him. 07-11-22

runners.name: Lusaka
runners.comment: Out of form for all of 2024 except for when he won at Nottingham (1m6f, good) in August
runners.spotlight: Out of form for all of 2024 except for when he won by 7l at Nottingham (1m6f, good) in August; 6lb higher today and first time out has not previously been the time to latch on to him.

quotes.race: Thorn Baker Allianz Xenia Bath Summer Stayers' Series Final Handicap
quotes.quote: It was brilliant as we thought the ground may have gone slightly against us but I suppose Lusaka missing the start helped him a little bit to get into the race - John Flint, trainer.

runners.name: Tokyo Bay
runners.comment: Won Ripon maiden (1m4f, heavy) in April on 2024 return but has lost his form in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Won maiden at Ripon (1m4f, heavy) in April on 2024 return but has lost his form in handicaps; remains lightly raced and has had only one race since February wind operation but he was eighth to Sportingsilvermine that day.

runners.name: Model Approach
runners.comment: Fair maiden (0-5) in Ireland; won twice over hurdles but below form in that sphere lately
runners.spotlight: Fair maiden (0-5) in Ireland who scored twice over hurdles for new stable last October; however, he fell next time and has been well beaten on both starts since; perhaps the return to Flat will help.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Today Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
