quotes.quote: Mr [Jim] Bolger told me he'd win the Triumph Hurdle after I bought him. He could go for something at Cheltenham in November - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

runners.name: The Dancing Poet
runners.comment: 6-18 at Catterick, unraced here; well beaten at three other tracks this term
runners.spotlight: The last three of his ten wins were last May-September (two over 1m4f then one at 1m6f) and he's 6-18 at Catterick, unraced here; well beaten at three other tracks this term but now 1lb above his last winning mark.

quotes.race: National Racehorse Week Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: He's fantastic, he loves it round here. This is his level; perfect. The Dancing Poet is nine years old now but he seems to be getting better with age - Matt Brown, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

The Dancing Poet is a big galloping horse but he likes sharp tracks. He's one-paced but he felt unreal today. He quickened up really well off a steady pace. I was always in the driving seat to kick on and he won nicely in the end - Ben Robinson, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Giselles Defence
runners.comment: Three wins last May-July (1m2f; twice claimer ridden); 1lb below his last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Three wins last May-July (1m2f; twice claimer ridden) and he's now 1lb below his last winning mark, having been out of form since; recent last of seven at Haydock may have helped his fitness after a layoff.

1:50.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: Straight 7.1, Round 6.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Columnist
runners.comment: Coventry third; outstayed in sole 7f attempt but may see out the trip better this year
runners.spotlight: Useful sort whose 6f form last year comprised an easy win on debut and two creditable efforts at Group level, notably a close third in the Coventry; outstayed in sole 7f attempt but may see out this trip better now he's older; gelded over the winter; class-dropper on handicap debut.

runners.name: Star Anthem
runners.comment: Ran well in the Mill Reef and Horris Hill at Newbury; has progressive RPRs; hood applied
runners.spotlight: Ties in with Columnist on Coventry running; subsequently ran well in the Mill Reef and Horris Hill at Newbury, latter upped to 7f; drops back in grade on handicap debut and while this mark doesn't look easy, he brings progressive RPRs; wears first-time hood.

quotes.race: Reduce Household Bills With The Eco Scheme EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Star Anthem ran super for the first time at Newbury and the form of that race has worked out really well and he took a nice step forward there. He was very at home on the track and the ground and we like the way he's progressing. He's a really strong, well-grown colt and I'm pleased we've managed to get two positive runs into him. We'll let him keep his strength now and hopefully he'll be good enough to go to Ascot. At the moment five furlongs is far enough, he hits the line well, so I'd be looking at the Windsor Castle or the Norfolk - Clive Cox, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Bath last season and ran well when eighth in the Coventry Stakes, considering it was good to firm ground and he'd prefer it softer. He came back in the autumn and made the frame in a couple of Group races. He's strengthened up a lot since then and I'd hope he could be one to follow. 17-04-25

runners.name: Shout
runners.comment: Ran well at Newbury on reappearance; possibilities, provided he takes well to headgear
runners.spotlight: Scored twice over 6f last term, including comfortably at Doncaster (handicap debut) final start; gelded prior to running well over 7f at Newbury on reappearance and looks open to further improvement; possibilities, provided he takes well to first-time headgear.

runners.name: Brave Mission
runners.comment: Well bred; scored nicely in final 2yo start; highly likely to improve further this term
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt whose dam's siblings include Grade 1 and Group 3 winners; produced form figures of 521 in 2yo novice events, scoring nicely at Kempton (7f, AW) the final time; highly likely to improve further this term and opening mark looks attractive in view of his pedigree; respected.

stable_tour.quote: Hopefully, he's a candidate for the Britannia. He's in good form and could start in a mile handicap at Newmarket on Friday. 28-04-25

runners.name: Humam
runners.comment: Fairly useful on AW this year; latest effort suggests this step back up to 7f will suit
runners.spotlight: Campaigned on AW this year, reaching a fairly useful standard; ran respectably over 6f at Newcastle on Good Friday, shaping as if this return to 7f will suit; successful in last attempt at this trip and has shown clear promise on turf; interesting.

runners.name: Philanthropist
runners.comment: Recorded AW wins the last twice; this Fanshawe runner is the type to progress further
runners.spotlight: Successful in Newcastle maiden and Southwell handicap since switched to AW, taking form figures (all over 7f) to 8211; posted a solid effort when last seen on turf; Jack Doughty's useful claim nearly offsets 4lb rise; this Fanshawe runner looks the type to progress further.

runners.name: Victory Sound
runners.comment: Now back in deeper waters and takes on some progressive types
runners.spotlight: Faced a couple of tough tasks after winning his maiden (7f) and ran creditably when back down in grade on final 2yo start (1m, AW); gelded since; now back in deeper waters and takes on some progressive types, so doesn't look the percentage call.

runners.name: Power Fizz
runners.comment: Clear second at Goodwood last Saturday when bidding for hat-trick; future mark 4lb higher
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 112 (all over 7f) since having wind surgery, most recently going very close and clear of remainder at Goodwood last Saturday; solid winner (beat a subsequent scorer) at Newmarket the time before; due to go up 4lb from tomorrow; leading player.

runners.name: Master Technician
runners.comment: Rallied over 6f last time; record over 7f reads 31131; steadily improving; solid claims
runners.spotlight: Good second over 6f at Newcastle on AW finals day, rallying late on; record of 31131 over 7f includes a maiden success when last seen on turf; steadily improving colt who holds solid claims back up in distance and returned to this sphere.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice two-year-old who came from the breeze-ups.  He could be a nice horse later on. He'd be my dark horse. 11-07-24

runners.name: Kameel
runners.comment: Remains open to progress but appears to have a stiff assignment on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Failed to get home over 1m in latest AW start; 2-2 previously, both wins over 7f at Newcastle; remains open to progress back down in trip but appears to have a stiff assignment on turf debut, being 3lb out of the weights upped two grades.

2:20.race_name: Juddmonte British EBF Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands B-D) (EBF Restricted Qual') (GBB)
2:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: Straight 7.1, Round 6.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Harlequin Angel
runners.comment: 40,000gns yearling; tenth foal; half-sister to six winners; dam was Listed level
runners.spotlight: April foal; 40,000gns yearling; tenth foal; half-sister to six winners including Internationalangel (7f; RPR 109), Farook (5f/6f; 97), Politics (5f-7f; 86) and Noble Star (7f; 84); dam 5f 2yo winner and up to Listed level; stable's second 2yo runner of the season.

runners.name: Marylene Du Serre
runners.comment: 40,000euros yearling; may need further but Jim Crowley is a positive jockey booking
runners.spotlight: February foal; 40,000euros yearling; first foal out of a German maiden and half-sister to German 1m3f Group 3 winner Walkaway; may need further but Jim Crowley is a positive jockey booking.

runners.name: Rubys Angel
runners.comment: Probably beaten by a good filly when made favourite at Newmarket's Craven meeting
runners.spotlight: January foal; 40,000gns yearling out of Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner; probably beaten by a good filly when made favourite at Newmarket's Craven meeting and the third and fourth horses didn't disgrace that form last week; every chance.

runners.name: Sayidah Hard Spun
runners.comment: 62,000gns yearling; first foal out of a 7f AW winner (RPR 68); market support welcomed
runners.spotlight: March foal; 62,000gns yearling; first foal out of a 7f AW winner (RPR 68) and half-sister to Australian 7.5f Group 2 winner Yonkers; market support would be welcomed.

runners.name: Sioux Perfect
runners.comment: Went off 5-4 favourite at Beverley but was far too green to do herself justice
runners.spotlight: March foal; cost 55,000gns as a yearling and bred to be precocious; went off 5-4 favourite at Beverley but was far too green to do herself justice; must have shown plenty at home and could easily be seen in a different light here.

runners.name: Sipi
runners.breeder: S D Knipe And S Davies
runners.comment: £38,000 2yo; stable in form and had a 2yo win on debut last week at Newmarket
runners.spotlight: March foal; £38,000 2yo breeze-ups; fourth foal; half-sister to winners King Cuan (6f/7f 2yo; RPR 96), Ernest Rutherford (5f 2yo; 86) and Enta Omry (Italian 5f/6f); dam 7f AW/7.5f turf winner (85); stable in form and had a 2yo win on debut last week at Newmarket.

runners.name: Society Kiss
runners.comment: Bred to be sharp and bought for 55,000gns at last month's Craven breeze-up sale
runners.spotlight: February foal; bought for 55,000gns at last month's Craven breeze-up sale; half-sister to winners Just A Spark (5f/6f; RPR 92), Heart Of Darkness (6f; 80) and Forever My Prince (6f 2yo; 72); dam 7.3f 2yo winner (67); interesting newcomer for strong stable.

runners.name: Stardinia
runners.comment: 11-4 at Leicester (5f, good) and a late bump was no help when going down narrowly
runners.spotlight: April foal; second foal of a 5f 2yo Listed winner (RPR 92); 11-4 at Leicester (5f, good) and a late bump was no help when going down narrowly to a Cox newcomer; the third Logi Bear was second at Goodwood last weekend; must have every chance.

runners.name: Supreme Diamond
runners.owner: Angelica Spence, A D Spence & I Madueke
runners.comment: 45,000euros yearling; stable won this with a newcomer in 2018 and 2021
runners.spotlight: March foal; 45,000euros yearling; third foal; half-sister to 6f AW winner Sayidah Dariyan (RPR 101); dam French 7f winner, sister to 5f Group 2 winner Finsbury Square; trainer won this with a newcomer in 2018 and 2021, and he will have an idea as to where he stands with Stardinia.

runners.name: Southern Spirit
runners.comment: £9,000 yearling; related to sharp types and stable sent out the Brocklesby second
runners.spotlight: March foal; £9,000 yearling; third foal; half-sister to winners Forager (5f 2yo; RPR 72) and Sioux Sweet (Italian 5f-7f); dam 5f/6f winner (79), closely related to winners Global Acclaim (6f-1m) and Expert Agent (6f); stable sent out the Brocklesby second.

runners.name: Storm Flag
runners.comment: 15-2 at Newmarket (5f, good to soft) and was never dangerous after starting slowly
runners.spotlight: February foal; 15-2 at Newmarket (5f, good to soft) and was never dangerous after starting slowly, finishing behind Ruby's Angel; should be all the wiser this time.

runners.name: Canyouhearthedrums
runners.comment: Strong favourite when second at Bath and the winner has since defied a penalty
runners.spotlight: March foal; made her debut at Bath in a race the yard has done well in and the winner defied a penalty at Salisbury last weekend; this filly was a strong favourite that day and improvement looks on the cards.

runners.name: Justice Twice
runners.comment: Ran better at Yarmouth (5f) but the winner is now 1-5 and this looks a stronger race
runners.spotlight: March foal; ran better at Yarmouth (5f, good to firm) but the winner is now 1-5 and this looks a stronger race.

3:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: Straight 7.1, Round 6.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Woolhampton
runners.comment: Fine record here but she's best at 5f and could prove vulnerable to stronger stayers
runners.spotlight: Has a good record at the track, winning three times and placed twice from her eight visits; those wins, and all of her best form, have come over 5f though and she may prove vulnerable to stronger stayers in this field.

stable_tour.quote: She seems to be an Ascot specialist- she loves the place and goes there again for the big £100,000 handicap this week. After that, all being well, she'll go- like Amazonian Dream- for the sprint final at Windsor on August 12. She's done very well over 5f (and won a qualifier over 5f at Windsor), but for £75,000 we'll have a crack over 6f. 11-07-24

runners.name: Get It
runners.comment: Won last year's Stewards' Cup off a 5lb higher mark; fair form in Bahrain this year
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who enjoyed a renaissance last summer, winning three 6f handicaps, notably the Stewards' Cup off a 5lb higher mark; looked to retain ability in Bahrain earlier in the year and he made a winning return from similar travels last June; might not have to work too hard to lead here and he's not discounted.

quotes.quote: My very clever daughter Tallulah drew 28 when it came out of the hat and we wanted to be this side. Get It has been a real legend for us in Bahrain but he's won a Stewards' Cup for us now so nothing else matters. He'll go back to Bahrain this winter - George Baker, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's all speed. He showed ability at two when he was fourth in the Windsor Castle, but he wasn't straightforward last year, hence the gelding operation. I hope he can enjoy a productive campaign and we'll be able to manage him better now. 21-04-22

He had some good form asajuvenile, notably when fourth in the Windsor Castle, but he was quite excitable, so we had him gelded over the winter. It has certainly calmed him down and he has won two of his three runs this year. I was very pleased with his win off a mark of 90 last week at Windsor, where he came out a comfortable winner in a decent field. The ground was good there but he's even better in top-of-the-ground conditions. He has a good level of experience and he'll be contesting the big handicaps now. I feel he should be very competitive as his confidence is so high. 09-06-22

runners.name: Over The Blues
runners.comment: Had excuses at Bath on her stable debut; improvement needed to defy this mark though
runners.spotlight: 6f maiden winner for Patrick Foley in Ireland last year; well beaten in a Bath Listed event on her stable debut 19 days ago but she was shuffled back early and saw no daylight through the race so it is probably safe to put a line through the run; needs a personal best to defy this mark though.

quotes.quote: Over The Blues did that pretty well. She was green at the Curragh and she was keen after that. She gets six well and might even be good over five. With a bit of luck all she will do is improve. We might come back here next month for a Listed race - Pat Foley, trainer

runners.name: Dorney Lake
runners.comment: 2-2 for new yard and picked up well to beat Kodi Lion at Doncaster; solid claims
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress for the Gosdens but he's on the up for his new yard, winning 6f handicaps at Yarmouth and Doncaster last month (good and good to firm); another 4lb higher in his hat-trick bid but he's high on the list.

runners.name: Akkadian Thunder
runners.comment: Suffered a torrid passage at Leicester on his return; 6f on fast ground remains a query
runners.spotlight: Dropped to 6f for his seasonal return at Leicester 13 days ago and may well have gone close had he seen any daylight; faster ground no problem and has course form; not dismissed.

stable_tour.quote: A good horse last year, he'll start off in the Victoria Cup. I thought he wanted only fast ground and then he ran a stormer on soft when second at Ascot in September. He's got plenty of ability and a lot of speed, and straight tracks suit him well. 14-04-25

runners.name: Warm Spell
runners.comment: Promising stable debut (7f) in March and could have more to offer back sprinting
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced for Roger Varian, winning a 7f Newbury novice as a 2yo; hugely encouraging stable debut at Doncaster in March (7f, good; tongue tied first time), surging to the front inside the final furlong before hanging left and picked off by an even stronger finisher; the manner of his move through the field offers plenty of encouragement for 6f and he's respected despite a 2lb rise.

stable_tour.quote: This lovely son of Mehmas finished a very good second on his debut at Goodwood before winning a 7f novice at Newbury last month. He has some nice entries and the first one he's likely to take up is the Weatherbys Scientific £300,000 2-Y-O Stakes at Doncaster on September 14. 25-08-23

runners.name: Kodi Lion
runners.owner: Mrs J M Hadley & Mrs E Cash Racing
runners.comment: Two promising runs for new yard this year; unexposed as a sprinter; course winner; solid
runners.spotlight: 7f win here last summer when trained by Charlie Fellowes and also had some strong handicap form afterwards; two promising runs for Mick Appleby, picked off late by Dorney Lake at Doncaster 13 days ago; 2lb higher but unexposed as a sprinter and he's a strong candidate.

stable_tour.quote: He's the most progressive horse in our yard. He won at Ascot and ran really well at two Racing League meetings recently. We'll aim for a nice handicap on a straight track over a mile and I'd be disappointed if he didn't win again. He's got a lot more left in front of him. 11-09-24

runners.name: Photosynthesis
runners.comment: Promising stable debut last month after a long absence; more needed to take this
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins in early 2024 when trained by Tom Clover; pleasing start for new yard (after 406 days off) when third at Newbury four weeks ago; likely more will be needed in this field.

quotes.race: Arkle Bar Median Auction Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: When we bought Photosynthesis he was tiny, he looked like a little ball of a two-year-old but he just kept going through growth spurts. We gave him time and that patience has paid off. They think a lot of the runner-up so I'm delighted. If we still have him, there is a Listed race in Newbury in a month's time. He's not flash. He's so laid back and just keeps finding, so you probably wouldn't know where the bottom of him is - Chris Timmons, trainer

runners.name: Rohaan

prev_owners.owner: Chris Kiely Racing Ltd & J Tomkins

runners.comment: This C&D brings out the best in him; not as good as he was but handicapped accordingly
runners.spotlight: Five of his last six wins have come over C&D, including a couple of Wokinghams and two Group 3s; not as good as he was but that is reflected in his mark and he went close off this rating at Southwell 12 days ago; losing run stands at 20 but expect him to be popular once again.

quotes.quote: It's great to get Rohaan back. I was under a bit of pressure today because I told his owners he was on his way back and they've come over from Ireland, so it's great. He's a horse of a lifetime for me and he'll come back here for the Group 1 on Champions Day. He finished fourth last year so we might as well have a go - David Evans, trainer.
Rohaan loves Ascot and loves cut in the ground and I hope he'll come back for Champions Day - Adam Kirby, rider.

Rohaan fell on the gallops and we thought his career was over. He bombed out at York but David got him back to his best. This horse was done in March but he has just won on the bridle - Chris Kelly, joint-owner.

Rohaan is a serious horse, but now he's being taken seriously. He's so easy to train and it's great having a nice horse. I was confident, but you never know what the draw is going to do and where the action will be. It wasn't the ideal race for him, but it's worked out well - David Evans, trainer.  It took Rohaan a while to warm up and get going and I was a little bit worried initially but the further he went the better he was and he won well in the end - Shane Kelly, jockey.

I don't know why Rohaan was such a big price as the form was there. He's a class horse but nobody seems to realise it, though, and he goes on any ground. As a gelding he's not qualified for the Commonwealth Cup. He'll get a penalty for the Wokingham and there's the Jersey over seven furlongs, but I don't really know. - David Evans, trainer

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Series horseracinghof.com Pavilion Stakes (Commonwealth Cup Trial) (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Rohaan is a nice horse and Dave has done very well with him. I think a level track helps him. He's been in great form all year and has a super attitude. He's a very honest horse with a good turn of foot. Fair play to Dave and the owners for putting him in here and they got their just rewards - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Watch Racing Online For Free Handicap
quotes.quote: Rohaan has done well to win from his draw but I got a nice tow into the race and he finished off well in the straight - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Get Your Ladbrokes Daily Odds Boost Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I was at the sales and had a look at Rohaan because I trained his half-brother Dougan. He's got size and scope and you can't fault him really. I've heard he had wind issues but I haven't found a problem and he's now won on three different tracks, one straight and stiff, one right handed and now one left handed. I'm pretty sure he'll go on improving for a while, and I think he'll be fine on grass, but I'm going to take it steady - David Evans, trainer.

runners.name: Eminency
runners.comment: Infrequent winner but on a lowly mark and his reappearance run is easy enough to forgive
runners.spotlight: Remains with just a 2yo novice win to his name but the pick of last season's efforts would give him good claims off his reduced mark; had a wide trip on his Kempton return last month and that isn't the run to judge him on; eligible for weaker races than this though.

stable_tour.quote: He's always been a laid-back character and I'm really pleased with how he's done over the winter. He had nowhere to go on his comeback at Kempton and hopefully he can move forward from that run and have better luck next time. He wouldn't want it too soft, is versatile at six or seven furlongs and I hope he can keep progressing. 02-05-23

He has only won the once but he has run consistently well in defeat apart from last time at Newmarket where he got a bit behind the pace and that cost him any chance. His penultimate run behind Quinault at York reads well and I'm looking at going back to the July course if conditions are in his favour and it dries out as he is not far off winning again. He may even run in the Stewards' Cup on Saturday. 02-08-23

5:10.race_name: Peroni Nastro Azzurro 0.0% Apprentice Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
5:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: Straight 7.1, Round 6.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Rogue Tornado
runners.comment: Consistent on turf/AW; getting no respite from the assessor but looks a solid contender
runners.spotlight: Consistent on turf/AW; went close in Vase race at Lingfield (2m) on Good Friday most recently; getting no respite from the assessor but is a solid type who should go well again.

stable_tour.quote: Another we acquired from Sheikh Hamdan's dispersal. This colt has a beautiful pedigree and is a fine, big specimen. He has done so well since we got him and is a beautiful mover. I'd imagine he will not be out until the second half of the season, but with that pedigree it will be next year when he will come into his own. I like him a lot. 30-03-22

runners.name: Lunar Power
runners.comment: Ex-Irish 7yo who is far from solid on his form for current stable
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 7yo who is far from solid on his form (Flat/hurdles) for current stable; absent for seven months; best watched unless the market suggests otherwise.

quotes.quote: Lunar Power was very consistent last year on the Flat and over hurdles. He is just a very likeable horse. He bounced back today after a bit of a disappointing run last time. All he does is gallop and stay - Colin Keane, rider.

quotes.race: BetVictor Proud To Support Irish Racing 3yo Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lunar Power got a fright at the first at Down Royal and it got worse from there, but he was not at his best. He was a different horse the last day on the Flat. He jumps well and there is no reason why he can't compete in the good juvenile hurdles - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: Orchestra
runners.breeder: S C Ecurie Ades-Hazan & Pvp Racing
runners.comment: Gamely made all in AW contest last time; still favourably treated on historical turf data
runners.spotlight: Scored over hurdles in November and gamely made all in AW Flat event at Kempton (2m) most recently; still favourably treated on historical turf data; enters calculations.

runners.name: Poncho
runners.comment: Ties in with Rogue Tornado on latest effort; place claims back on turf
runners.spotlight: Successful over hurdles and on AW; creditable third at Lingfield (2m) on Good Friday most recently and ties in with Rogue Tornado on that effort; place claims back on turf.

runners.name: Little Peter
runners.comment: Perhaps unsuited by Ripon last time; may fare better at this venue
runners.spotlight: Bumper/AW scorer over 2m; below form at Ripon most recently but perhaps wasn't suited by the track and may fare better at this venue.

runners.name: Russian Rumour
runners.comment: Has made a winning reappearance twice but looks out of her depth in this grade
runners.spotlight: Seasonal debutante; has made a winning reappearance on two occasions but looks a little out of her depth in this grade, having gained all Flat wins at a lower level.

quotes.quote: Russian Rumour stayed really well. She kept going strongly, handles the surface and the race worked out well - Simon Walker, jockey.

runners.name: Golden Flame

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Formerly useful; close third in the 2022 Shergar Cup Stayers over C&D; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Campaigned on AW for current yard, clear second off this mark over 2m last time; on a very long losing spell but is attractively treated, being 22lb lower than last turf appearance; formerly useful and was a close third in the 2022 Shergar Cup Stayers over C&D; possibilities.

quotes.quote: It's pretty fast out there. The first two winners made all, it's suiting the front runners and Joe Fanning is the master of it - though, to be fair to Golden Flame, he looked as though he was the last off the bridle there - Jock Bennett, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Toby Tops
runners.comment: Upped further in grade but won his last two attempts over 2m; still unexposed at the trip
runners.spotlight: Won well at Nottingham when completing a 2m double (maiden previously) and was unsuited by steadily run race over 1m6f since; upped further in grade but remains unexposed at this trip; shortlisted.

4:35.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: Straight 7.1, Round 6.1) (Watered)

runners.name: The Trickster
runners.comment: Two from two last term; good second at Newmarket on reappearance; solid claims
runners.spotlight: Two from two last term, namely novice wins in the north; good second in Newmarket handicap (1m2f) on reappearance despite being free to post and in the race; could well settle better and improve further back down in trip; solid.

quotes.quote: We didn't race The Trickster through the summer as we felt he needed a bit of time. He battled well at Beverley from an outside draw, and today he put his head down again. He should make into a nice staying horse - John Quinn, joint-trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Fearnot
runners.comment: Good third upped to 1m at Newmarket last time; still open to further progress
runners.spotlight: Good third upped to 1m in handicap at the Newmarket Craven meeting when switched to turf from AW, taking form figures to 123; still open to further progress and has possibilities off unaltered mark.

stable_tour.quote: He won first time out at Wolverhampton last month in a fast-run race. He sadly didn't quite get his head in front under a penalty at Kempton last time, but he's come out of it well and hopefully with more experience he can continue on an upward trend at Newmarket on Thursday. 17-04-25

runners.name: Tremolo
runners.comment: Progressive novice form at two; spoiled chance with tardy start on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Steady progress in 2yo novice events over 7f culminated in Southwell AW win; spoiled chance with tardy start in Haydock handicap (1m) on reappearance; could go well granted a cleaner break.

runners.name: I Am Me
runners.comment: Off the mark at Musselburgh on stable/seasonal debut; may well improve further
runners.spotlight: Placed twice last year for Donnacha O'Brien; off the mark in Musselburgh handicap (1m1f) on stable/seasonal debut; may well build on that win and show further improvement; one to consider.

runners.name: Bulletin
runners.comment: Transferred his AW progress to turf with good effort at Epsom last time
runners.spotlight: Transferred his AW progress to turf with good effort at Epsom (8.5f) last time, taking overall form figures to 42312; hit with another rise in the weights but may not have reached his ceiling yet.

runners.name: Niminy Piminy
runners.owner: Mrs Simon Marsh & Hon Mrs Peter Stanley
runners.comment: Two from two, namely AW novice wins; has a turf pedigree; brings potential
runners.spotlight: Two from two, namely AW novice wins at Lingfield (1m) and Southwell (7f); now goes into deeper waters but has a turf pedigree and brings potential to this handicap assignment; interesting.

runners.name: Troy Story
runners.comment: Moved in the right direction (9432) last season; gelded since; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Moved in the right direction (form figures 9432) over 7f last season, close second in Kempton AW handicap the final time; gelded since; first win looks possible, provided the new trip suits.

runners.name: Panama Black
runners.comment: Failed to transfer his AW progress back to turf last time; opposed
runners.spotlight: Solid record in AW handicaps this year, opening his account at Southwell (1m) in February; failed to transfer that form back to turf last time; not the percentage call.

runners.name: Arcturus Flame
runners.comment: Took well to cheekpieces at Nottingham on handicap debut; may progress further
runners.spotlight: Took well to first-time cheekpieces at Nottingham (1m) on handicap/seasonal debut; stiffer task upped in grade but may build on that win and improve further in the retained headgear.

quotes.quote: Arcturus Flame was 10-1, then 14s. I didn't care what price he was, I thought he'd win. He went for a gallop with Dutch Kingdom and he came out and won a 0-90  - Darryll Holland, trainer.

runners.name: Simply Blue
runners.comment: Has enough to prove upped further in distance; hood applied
runners.spotlight: Runner-up twice over sprint trips last term; failed to convince over 7f at Newmarket on reappearance and has enough to prove upped further in distance; hood applied.

stable_tour.quote: We've loved this horse since we saw him and he's ticked every box twice at home. He's got a big engine and a lot of ability. He made his debut at Chester but wasn't able to show what he's about. He missed the break and got stuck out the back -  it can happen round there. He then went for a Leicester novice where he ran a belter to be denied on the line. I'm seriously considering Royal Ascot for him, either the Windsor Castle or the Norfolk. He's probably more of a 6f horse but I wouldn't be afraid of a stiffer five either. He's got an exceptional mind and is everywhere you need him to be in his work. I think a lot of him. 30-05-24

4:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: Straight 7.1, Round 6.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Wheels Of Fire
runners.comment: Two solid efforts in AW handicaps this year; needs more to defy top weight here though
runners.spotlight: Two solid efforts in AW handicaps this year, midfield at Kempton before finishing best of the rest behind an emphatic winner at Southwell 12 days ago; needs a bit more to defy top weight in this field but he did shape well on fast turf as a 2yo.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well at Kempton on his reappearance, just getting tired late on. He'll be a useful sprint handicapper this year, with all roads hopefully leading to Ascot. 22-04-25

runners.name: Corolla Point
runners.comment: Strong form in two novice runs; opening mark looks fair; more to come & he's a key player
runners.spotlight: Overcame his inexperience to win a 5f novice at Yarmouth last October (soft ground); it was almost certainly a hot Doncaster novice in which he finished fourth on his reappearance two weeks ago (6f, good to firm) and his opening mark looks manageable; yard can do little wrong and he's a leading contender.

runners.name: Mollie Foster
runners.comment: Useful 6f form as a 2yo but absent for seven months and others look better treated
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut at Goodwood last June before easily landing the odds at Haydock one month later (6f, good); no progress afterwards but still ran to a useful level; others perhaps better treated in today's field.

stable_tour.quote: She's a sweet filly who hasn't grown a great deal but what she lacks in size she makes up for in heart. She's really gutsy, very honest and versatile - she ran well every time last year bar when I tried her over too sharp a trip at Deauville. 16-04-25

runners.name: Hucklesbrook
runners.comment: A 6lb rise for his Kempton win last October looks stiff; gelded over the winter; no hood
runners.spotlight: Improved with each of his 2yo starts, getting off the mark in a 6f nursery at Kempton when last seen in October (hooded for the first time but still over raced); a 6lb rise looks quite stiff though and he'll need to have done well for a gelding operation over the winter; hood absent this time.

runners.name: I Maximus
runners.owner: G Doyle, K Lawrence, P Merritt & F Young
runners.comment: No progress upped to 7f and handicapping latest; new blinkers need to give him a lift
runners.spotlight: Dead-heated in a 6f Chelmsford maiden on his seasonal return (gelded after 2yo campaign); latest Newbury fourth (7f, good) doesn't suggest he's ahead of his mark though and he'll need to be in this field; returning to 6f and the fitting of headgear could help.

stable_tour.quote: We love him. He was coming to win at Kempton last time and jumped where the stalls were for the 1m4f race just as they quickened. Oisin Murphy said he was half a length down and he ended up being two lengths behind the winner. I didn't think he'd win on the night but Oisin is adamant he would have. He'll go to Newbury on Friday for a 6f maiden. 18-09-24

runners.name: Kiniro
runners.comment: Beaten in both handicaps while leaving impression there's more in the tank; interesting
runners.spotlight: Raced only on AW to date, winning a 6f maiden at Lingfield in January and running two solid races in handicaps since (behind Vocal Legend latest); improvement is needed to defy this mark but a more thorough test at the trip should suit and the stable are having a hot spell; hasn't hit his ceiling yet.

runners.name: Tuco Salamanca
runners.comment: Suffered a desperate run at Newcastle on Good Friday; unexposed at 6f; fast ground a query
runners.spotlight: The winner of his first three starts this year, all over further, and showed there was still some mileage in his handicap mark when an unlucky fourth at Newcastle on Good Friday (6f), seeing no daylight and powering home when a gap finally appeared; unexposed as a sprinter but fast turf will be a new experience.

runners.name: Morte Point
runners.comment: 6f win on debut but no progress in two runs after; has been gelded; improvement a must
runners.spotlight: Rare winning newcomer for the yard at Salisbury last summer (6f, good to firm); disappointed in a Kempton nursery when last seen in December, after which he was gelded; improvement required.

runners.name: Coul Angel
runners.comment: Two 6f AW wins this year; not at best latest but can rebound; should be fine on fast turf
runners.spotlight: Two 6f wins on AW this year; below par at Lingfield on Good Friday (behind Vocal Legend and Kiniro) but he's better than that; this is his turf debut but his brother Coulthard handles fast ground well.

runners.name: South Shore Island
runners.comment: Promise in Ireland for M D O'Callaghan at 2; low-key stable debut; big step forward needed
runners.spotlight: Promise for Michael O'Callaghan in Ireland as a 2yo; not so good on stable debut ten days ago (absent 199 days beforehand); could be sharper today but he'll need to be.

runners.name: Priapos
runners.comment: Didn't really kick on from his winning 2yo debut; return to faster ground may help
runners.spotlight: He made a winning debut in a 6f Windsor maiden (good to firm) last summer but there wasn't significant progress in four further 2yo starts; getting back on faster ground may help but others bring greater potential.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Newcomers' Maiden Stakes (Horses Which Have Never Run) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Priapos is a big boy, he's got plenty of stomach on him. He was just gearing down the whole way in front, just looking at the rail and waiting and I had to be a little harsher on him than I wanted to but he knuckled down well in the end - Hector Crouch, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Vocal Legend
runners.comment: 2-2 since dropped to 6f, notably a Lingfield handicap on Good Friday; not fully exposed
runners.spotlight: 2-2 since dropped to 6f, notably when pouncing late in a Lingfield handicap on Good Friday (Kiniro third); 3lb rise not excessive and his stable have some useful 3yo sprinters this year; high on the list.

runners.name: Up The Pace
runners.comment: Best 2yo runs came over 7f on slower ground; vulnerable back from a six-month absence
runners.spotlight: His best efforts as a 2yo came over 7f on ground slower than good; likely quick enough to cope with 6f but this is a warm race and he might prefer slower going.

runners.name: Iconic Times
runners.comment: Improved when making all at Kempton (6f) in November but that was a poor race
runners.spotlight: Much improved when making all in a 6f Kempton novice in November but the form is weak and he'll need another surge of improvement to defy this opening mark in such a competitive handicap.

runners.name: Letsbeatsepsis
runners.comment: Not built on debut promise and he finished remote having pulled hard on his reappearance
runners.spotlight: Showed ability here on debut last July but he hasn't built on it yet, including when pulling hard and finishing remote in a 7f Newmarket handicap three weeks ago; plenty to prove.

runners.name: Azuinthejungle
runners.owner: D P Van Der Hoeven & D G Pryde
runners.comment: Runner-up in both starts this year; this is much tougher though
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in both starts this year, chasing home a well-treated opponent at Musselburgh last week (5f, good); 1lb wrong today and this is a much stronger contest.

2:55.race_name: Palmer & Co. Champagne Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
2:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: Straight 7.1, Round 6.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Berezka
runners.comment: Nathaniel half-sister to two winners; one of several interesting debutantes in the field
runners.spotlight: Nathaniel half-sister to two winners, notably Acanella (1m/1m1f including Listed; RPR 107); dam unplaced 1m 2yo, half-sister to 1m2f-1m4f Group 1 scorer Flintshire; one of several interesting debutantes in the field.

runners.name: Cape Flora
runners.comment: Too free in 8.5f AW maiden; may settle better and improve with hood now applied
runners.spotlight: Spoiled her chance by going too freely in 8.5f AW maiden won by a promising filly who followed up in Listed grade last weekend; may settle better and show improvement with hood now applied.

runners.name: El Budoor
runners.comment: Attractively bred, by Kingman and first foal of a multiple G2 scorer for her connections
runners.spotlight: Attractively bred newcomer, by Kingman and the first foal of her connections' multiple Group 2 winner (1m4f-1m6f) Enbihaar; potentially well above average and warrants respect.

runners.name: Good Old Days
runners.comment: Sister to Group 1 winner Nations Pride; helps to give the Gosden yard an interesting hand
runners.spotlight: Sister to 1m-1m4f winner Nations Pride (including Group/Grade 1; RPR 124), half-sister to two winners; dam German Listed winner, out of 1m2f Group 1 scorer; helps to give the Gosden yard an interesting hand.

runners.name: Honour Whim
runners.comment: Failed to back up her Newbury effort when well held in Wolverhampton AW event
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to a 1m winner for her stable; failed to back up her Newbury effort (third over 1m) when well held in Wolverhampton AW event; may do better returned to turf.

runners.name: Koko Blue
runners.comment: Seemed to run well here on second start but has failed to back up that form
runners.spotlight: Bucked and unseated rider soon after start on debut; seemed to run well at Ascot (1m) next time but failed to back up that form in two subsequent races; not a solid option.

runners.name: Little Dorrit
runners.comment: Camelot filly; wears hood on debut; market helpful
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to 5f/6f 2yo winner Noble Style (including Group 2; RPR 116), out of 6f winner (including Listed; 102); could get stamina from her sire Camelot; wears hood on debut; market helpful.

runners.name: Nuptown Girl
runners.comment: Modest chance on her AW efforts
runners.spotlight: Holds a modest chance on her Kempton AW efforts over 6f/1m; needs major improvement upped further in distance.

runners.name: Spirited Style
runners.comment: Sea The Stars filly; dam triple G1 winner; represents powerful stable; respected newcomer
runners.spotlight: Sea The Stars filly; dam 1m/1m2f winner (including three Group 1s; RPR 116), sister to winners Breeders' Cup Turf winner Yibir; scores highly on breeding and represents powerful stable; respected debutante.

runners.name: Wonder Star
runners.comment: Seemed to need the experience in sole 2yo run; open to improvement this year
runners.spotlight: Sea The Stars filly who ran to an ordinary RPR at Doncaster in sole 2yo outing but seemed to need the experience; open to improvement this year and is a similar type to Cape Flora.

4:55.race_name: DragonBet Supporting British Racing Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
4:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places on Chase course (GoingStick: Chase 8.2; Hurdle 8.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Williethebuilder
runners.comment: Disappointed over C&D on chasing debut but has since run quite well over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Useful handicap hurdler; jumped left and was a well-beaten favourite over C&D on chasing debut in March but rebounded with perfectly respectable run in competitive Cheltenham hurdle last month and could still have a good future over fences.

stable_tour.quote: He wandered around late on when winning at Wetherby. He wants a race run for him, rather than making his own running, but it was effective on the day. He could run in the Greatwood at Cheltenham on November 17 if it doesn't rain. 12-11-24

runners.name: Centara
runners.comment: Made encouraging chase debut in March but latest run was a backward step
runners.spotlight: Began last season with two disappointing hurdle runs; seemingly back in good nick when encouraging third on chasing debut at Wincanton (1m7f, good to soft) in March, after a break, but could not land a blow from off the pace at Plumpton last month and now has questions to answer again; hood removed; tongue-tie added.

stable_tour.quote: A big, backward horse who got too lit up and left his race at the start in the Grade 2 bumper at Aintree. We've been concentrating on keeping him nice and chilled at home and he could make his hurdling debut at Exeter on Friday. He's a promising individual. 05-11-23

runners.name: Chestnut Pete
runners.breeder: Messrs M E & A D I Harris
runners.comment: C&D winner in March and also ran well over 2m5f here last month; respected
runners.spotlight: Came good for Katy Price at fourth attempt, with clearcut C&D (good) win in March, and again ran well when third over 2m5f here last month; competes from 2lb out of the weights today but is the one with least to prove.

6:40.race_name: DragonBet The Independent Bookmaker Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
6:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places on Chase course (GoingStick: Chase 8.2; Hurdle 8.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Lieutenant Command
runners.comment: Regressive and inconsistent 11yo; ran well on only one of five starts last season
runners.spotlight: Regressive and inconsistent 11yo; belied triple-digit odds when runner-up in gruelling race at Carlisle (2m5f, soft) in December, his second start for Tim Reed, but the rest of last season's form was disappointing; now back with Tim Reed after two runs for Tristan Davidson; not an easy one to predict.

quotes.quote: Lieutenant Command just seems to be a different horse on that ground. The good news is that he stays in training this year and long term he could be a Galway Plate horse - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Jim Ryan Racecourse Services Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Lieutenant Command was brilliant from the start when we schooled him. We always thought a lot of him. Hopefully he can step up in grade, he's a grand big horse - Noel Meade, trainer.

Lieutenant Command is a huge horse and he only started to come late last season. He's getting there now. Sean said he found it very hard to get him into a rhythm but he was very impressed with him considering. We hope he keeps improving and we'll stay at this trip for now - Noel Meade, trainer

runners.name: Do Your Job
runners.comment: Made all off much reduced mark two starts ago but safely held since; not the force of old
runners.spotlight: Exploited some considerable help from the handicapper when making all for clearcut success at Wetherby (2m3f, good) in March but was safely held on his latest outing and is nothing like the force of old.

quotes.quote: Do Your Job has fallen a long way down the handicap. He had wind issues and problems, so it's nice to see him win again. He got a nice lead and the better ground helped - he was a very good horse on his day. Things haven't been straightforward, but it's nice to get him a win. He could win another race while the ground is quick - Charlie Longsdon, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Places Every Day Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Do Your Job lost his confidence a bit so we dropped him in class and he's come good - Peter Scudamore, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Jewson Stan Mellor Memorial Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It is hard to know quite what to make of it but I'm really pleased with Do Your Job. I thought he jumped well enough and his jumping got better as he warmed up through the race. He hadn't had the cleanest run coming into today and I think he will come on a lot for it. I suppose in an ideal world we will look for something similar next time and if he is good enough then start to get a bit more excited around Christmas. Two miles is his trip - Michael Scudamore, trainer.

I thought Do Your Job would outrun his price and he's run an absolute blinder. For a second I thought I was going to win my first Grade 1, but he was beaten by a better horse on the day - Brendan Powell, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's one of Michael [Scudamore]'s charges and I thought he ran a good race in the Old Roan. We'll probably drop back to two miles now. He could run at Cheltenham next or at Newbury, and that drop in trip should be within his remit as he's a great jumper. 15-11-23

He is a real superstar for us and enjoyed a terrific campaign last season with novice chase wins at Warwick and Newcastle before going on to win the Grade 2 Future Champion Novices' Chase at Ayr on Scottish National day by five lengths. He enjoyed a nice break over the summer and I was keen to see how he would get on when he returned at Aintree last month. Everything was going nicely and according to Luca [Morgan] he was travelling beautifully and just getting into it when he made a howling mistake four out which put paid to his chances. It really knocked the stuffing out of him and Luca allowed him to come back in his own time. The most important thing is he has come back in one piece and seems none the worse for his exertions. I would love to step him up from 2m4f to 3m as he looks to me as if he is crying out for further. We have a couple of options, including a handicap at Ascot on Friday, although we may wait and give him an entry in the Rehearsal the following week. The handicapper dropped him a pound to 145 for his last run. I hope he can keep climbing the chasing ladder and contest some nice Grade races in the spring. He saves his best form for the spring and hopefully we can build on things over the winter and find another 10lb by then. 21-11-22

runners.name: The Gypsy Davey
runners.comment: Just held on to make all in three-runner C&D race last month; nudged up only 2lb for that
runners.spotlight: Opened account over fences at ninth attempt, just holding on to make all in three-runner C&D (good) contest last month; nudged up only 2lb for that and seems likely to make another bid today.

stable_tour.quote: He's tough and genuine and, although he beat absolutely nothing in winning a maiden hurdle at Taunton and a novice at Hereford, I loved the way he went about it. He could give us some sport on spring ground, although he doesn't want it too deep. I'd say his next race will be a handicap off 112 and he'll be smashing over a fence next season. 28-02-24

runners.name: The Dream Goes On
runners.breeder: Dr Rdp Newland & Mr G Farmiloe

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Kate Farmiloe And Mrs L J Newland

runners.comment: Hurdle/chase winner towards end of last season; could still have a lot more to offer
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage mare who won here over hurdles in March, after a break, and kept on too strongly for odds-on favourite on chasing debut at Plumpton (2m3f, good) last month; in contention before falling in home straight at Market Rasen (3m, good) on latest outing and remains of strong interest.

6:05.race_name: DragonBet Oncourse Values Online Mares' Handicap Hurdle
6:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places on Chase course (GoingStick: Chase 8.2; Hurdle 8.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Musique De Fee
runners.comment: Ended last season in excellent form in cheekpieces (C&D winner) and commands respect
runners.spotlight: Ended last season in excellent form in cheekpieces, winning twice on good ground (once over C&D) before a clear second at Newton Abbot (3m2f, good); raised another 4lb since last time but still commands respect.

quotes.race: DragonBet: Oncourse And Online Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I must say a big thank-you to Sean Bowen, who rode Musique De Fee six days ago. I rang him this morning and all he said was to kick on with her and he was right - Finn Lambert, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Could Be Trouble
runners.comment: Made all at Haydock in March and was not discredited at Cheltenham last month
runners.spotlight: Reportedly benefited from change of headgear when making all in first-time visor at Haydock (2m5f, good) last month, her seventh hurdling success; didn't run badly in competitive Cheltenham handicap last month (2m4f) and is still unexposed over staying trips; could be dangerous if allowed to dictate from the front.

quotes.race: William Hill Double Your Odds Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Mares' Hurdle Qualifier)

stable_tour.quote: It took a few runs to get her head in front when racing in Ireland, but she managed to break her duck at Gowran Park in March. She was bought after that and sent to us and has proved a cracking buy for the lads (Kc Sofas) whose first horse she is. I have nothing but good things to say as she won mares' novice hurdles at Ayr and Uttoxeter before a summer break. She returned at Bangor last month and completed her hat-trick in determined fashion by a half a length. We might look for a mares' race next before going chasing, but I'm keen to get her over fences sooner rather than later as she could be even better over the larger obstacles. 10-11-21

runners.name: Kazontherazz
runners.breeder: Mrs S C Welch & Mr R Phillips
runners.comment: Ended last season with two fairly respectable thirds but has not won since 2021
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with two fairly respectable thirds (one behind Could Be Trouble) under Daire McConville (2m5f/3m1f, good) and remains on a good mark but her last win was in 2021 and she's not very reliable.

quotes.race: Follow At The Races On Twitter Mares' Maiden Hurdle (Arc Summer Novices' Brush Hurdle Series)
quotes.quote: That was good. It didn't go to plan last time. We bought Kazontherazz as she's a half-sister to Back On The Lash. She's not the biggest but she'll stay further, she was going away to the line. She looked super today and she jumped great - Martin Keighley, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She is a half-sister to Back On The Lash and opened her account at Worcester in the summer when successful in a mares' maiden hurdle over 2m. She needed her first run of the season at Chepstow last month where the ground was possibly a little too soft. I would be very disappointed if she could not win again this season - she's entered at Hereford on Wednesday. 24-11-21

runners.name: Shorten Sassy
runners.comment: Had jumping issues and showed only minor promise in her qualifying runs; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Had some jumping issues and showed only minor promise in her three qualifying runs last season; needs to improve to make a winning handicap debut here but her pedigree suggest the move up in trip will suit.

7:15.race_name: DragonBet Real People, Real Bookmakers Handicap Hurdle
7:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places on Chase course (GoingStick: Chase 8.2; Hurdle 8.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Damarta
runners.comment: Became rather disappointing for Olly Murphy last season; first run since 3,400gns sale
runners.spotlight: Began 2024 with quite stylish win for Olly Murphy at Southwell (2m, good to soft) but became rather disappointing during light campaign last season and was sold for 3,400gns in February; needs to have been revitalised by subsequent change of scenery.

runners.name: Moonshine Man
runners.comment: Placed in two maidens last season; stopped quickly and was pulled up on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 6yo who was placed in two 2m Southwell maidens last season (good to soft/good); stopped quickly and was pulled up on recent handicap debut (first run after a wind op) but might be aided by new tongue-tie here and could still have potential.

runners.name: French Symphony
runners.comment: Soundly beaten in first two handicaps but subsequent maiden fourth was more encouraging
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles; soundly beaten in two soft-ground handicaps at start of this year (both 2m4f) but subsequent fourth in Fontwell maiden (2m1f, good; first-time tongue-tie) was much more encouraging; can feature here if he builds on that effort.

runners.name: Captain Attridge
runners.comment: 2m course winner last spring and ran well in defeat here last month; tries new trip today
runners.spotlight: Just 1-12 over hurdles but the win was at this track (2m, good) and he ran well in defeat here last month, after a break; on workable mark if stamina holds out over this new trip; must be considered.

runners.name: Jokers N Clowns
runners.comment: Second in two maidens last month; may need extra on this handicap return/stable debut
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare; came second in two good-ground maidens (2m5f/2m) for Billy Aprahamian last month but probably needs a better performance on this handicap return/stable debut; refitted hood added to cheekpieces.

runners.name: Mactavish
runners.comment: Dual course winner; ended 2024 in good form and ran well when fresh a year ago; a player
runners.spotlight: Good-ground specialist who gained two of his three hurdling wins at this track; ended 2024 in good form and ran well when fresh a year ago; can make his presence felt.

quotes.race: Racing Specials Every Day At PlanetSportBet Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mactavish pricked his ears halfway up the run-in but he does stay three miles so you never really want to hang around on them too much. He's done it well again and he's definitely going in the right direction  - Stan Sheppard, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He prefers a sound surface and will run at Hereford on Wednesday. He's probably at the top end of his mark but he won twice at this time of the year last season. That said, I think with the recent rain the ground might have gone against us now. 28-11-24

5:30.race_name: DragonBet Born From The Betting Ring Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
5:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places on Chase course (GoingStick: Chase 8.2; Hurdle 8.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Bara Tara
runners.comment: Well beaten in a bumper and two hurdles last season; tongue-tie added today
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred 5yo who was well beaten in a bumper and two hurdles (1m7f/2m3f) last season; needs addition of tongue-tie to make a massive difference.

runners.name: Don Virginia
runners.comment: Found one just too strong when odds-on over C&D last month but can play another big role
runners.spotlight: Placed on four of his six hurdling starts; found one just too strong when odds-on for good-ground C&D maiden four weeks ago and does not appear to be making any progress but has a big role to play nevertheless.

stable_tour.quote: He was second to Listed bumper winner Kel Du Large on his debut over hurdles at Hereford in February and should have won at Warwick two runs ago when he was impeded after the last. He stayed on well at the finish on his latest run at Carlisle and is probably still a little bit weak. He'll appreciate a step up in trip and we'll look for a suitable handicap. He's only four and should improve as he strengthens up. 06-11-24

runners.name: Golden De Coeur
runners.breeder: O Burlot, N Burlot & M Burlot
runners.comment: Went close over 2m here last month and will be suited by this move back up in trip
runners.spotlight: 0-16 under rules but has consistent record over hurdles; lost out only by a neck when clear second here (2m, good) last month and will be suited by today's move back up in trip; leading contender.

stable_tour.quote: Every time bar one he's been in the first four for us. We didn't pay a lot when we bought him. He's not the most unsound horse, but he's quite awkward looking. I think he just struggles jumping fences, so the plan is probably to go back over hurdles and see if that reaps any rewards. He was second to The Jukebox Man over hurdles and showed some good form. I think he was unlucky when third at Wetherby last time. The first two were very well handicapped, but he's just so consistent. He's a dream to train. 05-03-25

runners.name: Chanelle Noir
runners.comment: Displayed promise over 2m on recent hurdle debut and should improve over this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Displayed minor promise in both bumpers last season and also when fifth of nine on recent hurdling debut at Chepstow (2m, good); has quite a bit to find on the figures with a couple of these but her pedigree strongly suggests the step up in trip will suit; not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: She's a really nice filly. Chloe Emsley, who works for me, rode her at Ascot on her debut last month, so that was nice. I said to ride her to come home strongly and she did. She was full of running at the end. She'll probably run in another bumper and then we'll see where we are with her. She'll run over hurdles before the end of the season but she needs a decent surface. She'll run deep into the spring. 12-03-25

runners.name: Gillys Lass
runners.comment: Made low-key debut in run-of-the-mill Chepstow maiden last month
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 22l when sixth of nine in run-of-the-mill Chepstow maiden (2m, good) on last month's belated debut; entitled to have learnt from that outing but needs significant improvement here.

7:50.race_name: Green Dragon Hotel Hereford Handicap Hurdle
7:50.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places on Chase course (GoingStick: Chase 8.2; Hurdle 8.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Rascallion
runners.comment: Enthusiastic sort; good start over hurdles; enters handicaps at a track that should suit
runners.spotlight: Made a bright start over hurdles and it was his stable debut when making all for a narrow success at Wincanton (1m7f, good) in March; those tactics could only bring an 11l-second at Taunton (about 2m, good to firm) nine days later but he impressed with some good leaps on the way round and the winner is promising; now makes handicap debut and this track should suit.

runners.name: Magic Seven
runners.comment: Twice a winner over hurdles here and could be all the better for recent return from break
runners.spotlight: Triple course winner, including maiden/novice hurdles (around 2m3f, good) in 2023; won off a reduced mark at Exeter (2m, good) in November but wasn't as good when third at Huntingdon and then finished tailed off at Cheltenham in December; ran as though his return from a break was needed when sixth over C&D 17 days ago and he should do much better this time.

quotes.race: Get Emma's Offers At planetsportbet.com Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Magic Seven loves it around here, that's his third win at Hereford. I think he likes that good ground as well. He won well but it wasn't a great race. His jumping is getting a little bit better and he seems to be going the right way. We'll look for something stronger next - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

quotes.race: Cazoo Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Magic Seven looked good there, he's come on a lot from his first run and I think he learnt a lot. How good the race was remains to be seen but he couldn't have done it any nicer. We're very happy with him and he looks a horse for the future. We'll have a look at the Listed bumper at Ascot and then we'll see how good we are - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won his bumper at Hereford last season and made a winning return over hurdles back at the same track this month. It wasn't a deep race but he couldn't have done it much easier and stepping up in trip did him no harm. We'll probably run under a penalty next time and go from there. 14-11-23

runners.name: Rewired
runners.comment: Won over 2m1f (good) in March; similar form off 4lb higher since; chance off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Returned to form and exploited a reduced mark at Newcastle (2m1f, good) in March and similar form off 4lb higher when third at Hexham (2m, good to soft) since; enters calculations from the same mark.

quotes.quote: It was nice that Rewired had one to aim at down the back straight and he deserved to get his head in front - Luke Scott, rider.

stable_tour.quote: Was precocious enough to win as a two-year-old over a mile. He needed his first run this year at Lingfield to blow the cobwebs away and I thought he would go well at Salisbury last time, but he just did not see out the trip. It was my mistake and we will go back to 1m2f and see what happens. Soft ground is preferred and I would be disappointed if we could not at some point this season. 02-06-21

runners.name: Man Of The Sea
runners.comment: Prolific sort who was a solid second (2m3f, good to firm) last time; in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Prolific performer, mainly in Jersey, who knows how to get the job done in Britain too; running well this spring since coming back from a break, following up a Bath success on the Flat with a solid second over hurdles at Taunton (2m3f, good to firm) 16 days ago; likeable 9yo who'll appreciate the likely decent gallop.

quotes.quote: Man Of The Sea won well. Mr Mulholland said before the race he was in great form. He was a bit outpaced the last day at Windsor but he stays all day. He pinged the gates, I kept hold of him and he ran all the way to the line - George Rooke, rider.

quotes.race: Come Racing 11th November Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Man Of The Sea jumped and travelled, I was able to sit off the good pace and when I got stuck into him he saw it out to the line. He has plenty of experience and it stood to him. He did it well and hopefully there's another day in him - Billy Lee, rider

3:50.race_name: Chris Coley BEM Celebration Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Choosethenews
runners.comment: Bit disappointing last time but very capable of having a say if back on song
runners.spotlight: 1-9 over fences; last three runs all at Newcastle, finishing second in January (2m7f, soft; effective on good) before failing to stay 4m1f in the Eider; again favourite back there over 2m4f a month ago and offered little resistance to the principals; capable of having a say if back on song.

runners.name: Hidden Heroics
runners.comment: Should be well handicapped but he's not offered a great deal in three runs after a break
runners.spotlight: Should be well handicapped but he's not offered a great deal in three runs after a break, in handicap chases from 2m4f to 3m1f; bit to prove right now.

quotes.race: Cheltenham & South-West Racing Club Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hidden Heroics jumped nicely, although he was a little bit out to his right. I ran him at Aintree at the start of the season and we dropped him in and he ran like a hippo with a hernia. It was awful. We said we will make the running over fences now and he is 2-2 and hasn't come off the bridle twice. We will find some more novice handicaps. I'm not going to step up dramatically in grade at the moment but come the spring time we might look at something like a Scottish Grand National - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.name: Ajp Kingdom
runners.comment: Same mark as when third in a well-contested staying chase at Cheltenham
runners.spotlight: Seems all the better for cheekpieces; won by 15l at Uttoxeter (3m2f, good) in November and back from a break to finish third in a well-contested handicap at Cheltenham (3m4f, good); same mark here as last time; firmly enters the reckoning.

quotes.race: Download Fitzdares For Free Race Streaming Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: AJP Kingdom has improved with every run. He loves that good ground and can hopefully go on improving - Connor Brace, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Portal Construction Open Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (Category 3 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ajp Kingdom is a lovely horse. This was the plan and we got him in early and he's used his fitness there. He showed his ability and will go hurdling next - Sally Randell, assistant trainer.

runners.name: A Definite Getaway
runners.comment: Finished a long last of three finishers at Newton Abbot on Wednesday
runners.spotlight: Back from a break to win back-to-back small-field staying chases on good ground at Exeter and Hereford, but finished a long last of three finishers at Newton Abbot (3m2f, good) on Wednesday.

stable_tour.quote: His form has actually turned out quite well and he's been a proper, consistent horse. He won at Exeter in October and was second at Doncaster last time out behind The Kniphand. He doesn't like it soft but I'm sure he'll win his fair share later this year. 26-03-25

runners.name: Cant Beat History
runners.comment: Has won his last five completed starts, three chases and two hurdles; up in the weights
runners.spotlight: Has won his last five completed starts, three chases and two hurdles; it was over hurdles when doing it readily on his return from a break at Warwick (3m1f, good) but this lightly raced 9yo has never been in better form; 9lb higher for this.

runners.name: Giovanni Change
runners.breeder: Sarl Elevage Du Haras De Bourgeauville
runners.owner: Readers & Wiggy, The 8 Amigos & J Burns
runners.comment: Loves it here and a game winner at the track 19 days ago; won't go down without a fight
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner here over hurdles and gamely got off the mark over fences here 19 days ago (3m, good); beat only two other finishers but he's up just the 1lb (3lb claimer rode last time); won't go down without a fight.

quotes.quote: Giovanni Change is just the most genuine horse you are ever going to see. He has only got one eye, that is his fifth win now, his fourth at Market Rasen. He just won on the Flat at Ponterfract, what more can you ask for- Neil Readman, co-owner, speaking to Racing TV.

Giovanni Change has run some very good races in defeat in novices and a nice break has worked a treat with him. We've always thought he's a really nice horse, he has some good novice hurdle form that stacks up and hopefully we can pick up a nice race with him - Mark Walford, trainer.

quotes.race: Europe Hotel Killarney INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: We have actually had Giovanni Change a while but he's been a bit of a slow burner. He definitely wouldn't like it any quicker. I'm surprised by that and he will be a nice horse going forward for the future. The further he goes the better I'd say, and he might even make into a winter horse. I wouldn't be afraid of slower ground as he has a fair knee action - trainer Emmet Mullins.

runners.name: Billy Boi Blue
runners.comment: Dug deep to win at Ayr and essentially 2lb lower given Nick Slatter's claim
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo; had his off days last season but won two 3m handicaps, last time at Ayr digging deepest in a Class 3 (good to soft); essentially 2lb lower given Nick Slatter's claim.

runners.name: Scrum Diddly
runners.comment: In good form last summer (chasing) and fitness might not be an issue given connections
runners.spotlight: Chasing when last seen in June of last year, winning a four-runner handicap at Southwell before a close third off this mark at Worcester (2m7f, good); dual winning hurdler who has his ground and fitness might not be an issue given connections.

runners.name: Willaston
runners.comment: 2m3f winner last time; has won over 3m off a higher mark so has to be of interest
runners.spotlight: Got up in the nick of time to beat an in-form mare over Carlisle's extended 2m3f in April (good); has won over 3m off a higher mark so has to be of interest after that return to form.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Long Distance Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were surprised at Cheltenham. We thought Willaston might get a place there if we were lucky, but he finished like a train and I think this is what he wants - three miles on good ground. Jamie (Hamilton) thinks he may be a Pertemps horse. In the long-term he's a chaser. I know he fell on his chasing debut, but we can put that behind us. But what's the point at the moment when he can win hurdles like that? - Tim Walford, trainer's father.

We knew Willaston was in good form coming into it and his first run of the season was great. I thought we might nick a place but I'd be lying if I thought we'd win. He's a lovely horse, his owner bought him for £11,000 and he's been great. He will be a chaser but whether we'll go jumping fences in the new season I'm not sure. This has topped off a wonderful season for the team - Mark Walford, trainer.

runners.name: Hardy Boy
runners.comment: Soft ground was no good to him on final appearance; nothing wrong with his mark
runners.spotlight: C&D winner last August and his close fourth at Cheltenham three runs back was his best form yet; soft ground was no good to him on final appearance; nothing wrong with his mark.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hardy Boy got a lovely tow into the race and finished off his race strongly. He loved this goodish ground - Luca Morgan, jockey.

runners.name: Fils De Roi

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Michael Rizieri, Y Fouin & Ecurie Thomas Sivadier

runners.comment: Has the form to feature off this mark but stamina for this far is unproven
runners.spotlight: Won hurdle races on very soft ground in France and a 3yo race on good at Huntingdon; ran moderately back from a break last time but did go close at Uttoxeter the time before (2m4f); could go well, though stamina for this far is unproven.

runners.name: Bethpage
runners.comment: Up 5lb for Cheltenham second but finished well over 2m4f and she stays this far
runners.spotlight: Back from wind surgery to win a three-runner race at Wincanton (3m, good) and finished well for second in a Class 2 at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) after not getting the best of runs; lots to like, despite the 5lb rise for last time.

quotes.race: Happy Birthday Sheila James Mares' Handicap Hurdle (J Morgan & R Stevens Mem)(Challenger Mares' Hdl)
quotes.quote: Bethpage loves this ground. She had a winter break and the idea was to come here and then to Cheltenham where she's qualified for the mares' final - Emma Lavelle, trainer talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Letterston Lady
runners.owner: S Williams, J Brace & A Davies
runners.comment: Close third, and closing, after a mammoth absence at Ffos Las three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Has won two bumpers, a novice hurdle and a 2m4f handicap (on good); close third, and closing, after a mammoth absence at Ffos Las three weeks ago (2m4f, soft); needs to avoid the 'bounce' but every chance otherwise.

runners.name: Uokhun
runners.comment: Won easily at Southwell latest; up 8lb but William Maggs takes away 5lb of that
runners.spotlight: Contested a competitive Class 2 on penultimate start and that was only eight days after winning at Hexham; did it comfortably last time at Southwell (3m, good) and she looks progressive all of a sudden; up 8lb but William Maggs takes away 5lb of that.

runners.name: Accidental Legend
runners.comment: Should appreciate this return to hurdling but he'd prefer softer ground
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in his only attempts at chasing the last twice; five-time winning hurdler who's not on an impossible mark but would prefer softer ground.

runners.name: Kayce Dutton

prev_owners.owner: F W Healy & K Leavy & M McDermott & Ms M Mullins

runners.comment: Has finished second in four of his last six races and ran in a higher grade last time
runners.spotlight: Has finished second in four of his last six races and it was in a higher grade when beaten about 13l last time at Warwick (2m4f, good; 3-1f); respected at this level and cheekpieces are given a go.

runners.name: Topofthecotswolds
runners.comment: On a losing run and ran no more than okay in the first-time visor at Kelso 17 days ago
runners.spotlight: Once useful for Nigel Twiston-Davies but his long losing run has continued for current yard and ran no more than okay in the first-time visor at Kelso 17 days ago; others appeal more.

runners.name: Cloudy Wednesday
runners.comment: Likes Fakenham but has won this way round and he arrives here on a high
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who likes Fakenham, with three of his four wins at that venue; only 3lb higher than for the latest when never in that much danger; has won going right-handed.

quotes.quote: Cloudy Wednesday likes this ground and it's done nothing but rain until now. He's had a busy time so I might give him a break after that - Caroline Fryer, trainer.

runners.name: Beat The Edge
runners.comment: Has continued to run well since doubling his tally over fences at Catterick in January
runners.spotlight: Has continued to run well since doubling his tally over fences (2-30) at Catterick in January and the favourite beat him last time at Sedgefield (2m5f, good); races prominently and looks sure to give another good account.

runners.name: King Of The Hill
runners.comment: Good second before falling early at Southwell; respected despite being 3lb wrong
runners.spotlight: 0-10 as a chaser but ran a good race in defeat at Warwick (2m4f, good) before falling early at Southwell; being 3lb out of the weights is not ideal but hard to rule out.

runners.name: Onenightintown
runners.comment: Hard to envisage a return to form from so far out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Patchy profile since last win over a year ago and hard to envisage a return to form from so far out of the weights.

runners.name: Robbers Bridge
runners.comment: Recent course winner now on a career-high mark; still looks sure to be involved
runners.spotlight: Back from a break for stable debut here 19 days ago and he did it well (2m2f, good); that was off a career-high mark and now has another 6lb to contend with, but he's consistent and looks sure to be involved.

runners.name: Iron Heart
runners.comment: 9lb lower when an easy winner of this 12 months ago but he can deal with this mark
runners.spotlight: 9lb lower when an easy winner of this 12 months ago but he can deal with this mark and latest close third at Ffos Las (good to soft) was commendable given he likes good ground; could very easily win this again.

quotes.race: Kevin Hall & Pat Boakes Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Iron Heart has worked smartly and ran good at Newmarket last time behind a progressive sort. Hopefully he'll go on to better things - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

runners.name: Whispering Royal
runners.comment: Bit to prove but may appreciate this longer trip given he stayed well on the Flat
runners.spotlight: Competitive under both codes for Alan King; second run for this yard was better than the first but was still only a remote fourth of six at Kempton (2m, good); may appreciate this longer trip given he stayed well on the Flat.

quotes.race: bet365 Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Whispering Royal got an easy lead and put his experience from Wincanton to good use. I'm not sure how much depth there was to the race, we'll find out in a few weeks' time, but he didn't do anything wrong - Tom Cannon, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running with promise on the Flat and I was keen to get him started over hurdles earlier this month at Chepstow until all the rain came. Soft ground will be fine but I didn't want to start him on heavy. He's a straightforward horse and we should have a lot of fun with him. He may make his hurdling debut at Wincanton on Sunday. 25-10-23
I hope we'll have some fun with him over hurdles as he's shown promise on the Flat, and he started by finishing third at Wincanton last month. That experience will bring him on plenty. 10-11-23

runners.name: Roi De Baviere
runners.comment: Has disappointed in both his handicaps over hurdles; slower ground would be preferred
runners.spotlight: Best maiden efforts over hurdles came on slow ground and has disappointed in both his handicaps; the tongue-tie was removed for a Flat run two weeks ago but ran no better.

runners.name: Knacker Trapper
runners.comment: Would have a shout on last year's peak form and this looks his trip; headgear tried
runners.spotlight: Would have a shout on last year's peak form and this looks his trip; however, will need to step up on his recent efforts and trainer turns to headgear.
