runners.name: Milan Milos
runners.comment: Poor so far and due to make handicap debut over 2m6f at Stratford on Thursday (6.30)
runners.spotlight: Bumper runs weren't devoid of promise but nothing positive to take from his three runs over hurdles at about 2m; due to make handicap debut over 2m6f at Stratford on Thursday (6.30).

runners.name: Matoury
runners.comment: 80-1 for his two handicaps after a break and performed accordingly
runners.spotlight: Ran okay in non-handicaps here in 2023 but uncompetitive in two handicaps after a break, over 3m (good to soft) and 2m3f (soft); went off at 80-1 on both those occasions.

2:45.race_name: Every Race Live On Racing TV Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: All Well And Good
runners.comment: Bumper winner; jumped better in his second hurdle when chasing home the favourite
runners.spotlight: Form figures of 212 in bumpers; jumped poorly on hurdling debut but was better when second to a Skelton favourite at Ffos Las (good to soft); the one they all have to beat.

runners.name: Chantilly Moon
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D Futter & Mrs R Patterson
runners.owner: Mrs M Rooke And Hard Held Partnership

prev_owners.owner: Clova Farms And P D Niven

runners.comment: Pulled up on three previous attempts at hurdling and recent Flat form is pretty poor
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on three previous attempts at hurdling and recent Flat form is pretty poor.

runners.name: Howth
runners.comment: Dual Flat winner and ability much respected should he take to hurdling
runners.spotlight: Won handicaps (1m/1m6f) for Aidan O'Brien and Michael Appleby and placed over 1m6f on the AW on final run for latter yard (rated 82); ability much respected should he take to hurdling.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Supporting Irish Champions Weekend Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Howth is a fine, big horse and looked capable of winning a maiden. It's nice to win one with him - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: We might look at the Dee Stakes for him. He has a lot of experience but hasn't gone beyond a mile yet. I think after his first run of the season, which was over seven furlongs, he definitely needs to go up in trip, so Chester could help to tell us where he fits in. 19-04-22

He was among the Ballydoyle team last year and looks a lovely addition to the team. I managed to get a couple of runs into him at the back end, finishing off with a very encouraging second at Chelmsford. He didn't get a clear run and yet was beaten only half a length. We'll bring him back on the grass this year and hopefully he should be ready to run in May. He has improvement in him and his mark of 92 looks very workable. He's decent over a mile but I feel 1m2f will be his forte. 22-03-23

runners.name: Terrorise
runners.comment: 1m2f winner at Class 6 level; out of his depth in a Grade 1 on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: 1m2f winner, though inferior to Howth in that scene; unsurprisingly he offered little when 150-1 for a Grade 1 on hurdling debut at Aintree.

stable_tour.quote: He's done well from two to three. His first run last year was good as he finished third at Newcastle, one place behind a smart horse of Adrian Keatley's [Ballymount Boy]. He then went downhill because he was too weak, but he didn't run badly at Newcastle on Tuesday on his return. 03-04-24

runners.name: Veer
runners.comment: No wins in ten on the Flat despite competing at a modest level at up to 2m
runners.spotlight: No wins in ten on the Flat despite competing at a modest level at up to 2m; wouldn't be the obvious answer on this switch to hurdling; first-time tongue-tie.

runners.name: Icecap
runners.comment: A low-grade maiden off the Flat who has shown zilch in her two runs over hurdles
runners.spotlight: A low-grade maiden off the Flat who has shown zilch in her two runs over hurdles.

2:10.race_name: 100% RacingTV Profits Back To Racing Conditional Jockeys' Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Party Moon
runners.comment: Two hurdle runs last season were well short of his best; not easily recommended
runners.spotlight: Two hurdle runs last season were well short of his best, including when 50-1 for his stable debut at Perth two weeks ago; lots to prove.

runners.name: Gms Prince
runners.comment: 19-race maiden but he has finished third here twice this year (2m4f); each-way claims
runners.spotlight: 19-race maiden but he has finished third here twice this year (2m4f); each-way claims in a weak race.

runners.name: Remarkable Flight
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: 2m win at Fakenham in March; quiet since but winning hurdle form is scarce in this field
runners.spotlight: Won a low-grade mares' handicap at Fakenham in March (2m, good to soft); gone quiet over hurdles and on the Flat since; the fact she has actually won a race over hurdles puts her in a minority here and she's considered.

runners.name: Rukaana
runners.comment: Modest hurdler but blinkers are given a go and they could spark something extra
runners.spotlight: Some promise over hurdles without looking ahead of his mark; this is weak and blinkers could help so too soon to give up on.

quotes.race: Conferencing And Events At Nottingham Racecourse Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Mile Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I had no plan. Rukaana was a little bit slow away but he's still learning but when the penny dropped he quickened nicely. He should get plenty of confidence from coming through them like that and he's hit the line strongly. He's a big horse but coming here onto good ground suited him and I'd be confident he'd get a mile and a quarter - Christian Howarth, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca With BetMGM Nursery Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Rukaana is a big lad and, once I got the position I wanted to be in, I was hoping I could set sail early enough because I think he'll stay further. He showed a nice attitude going to the line.  - Ben Curtis, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He came from Charlie Hills on the Flat and will be going juvenile hurdling this season. He's got a really nice attitude to jumping and hopefully he can pick up a couple of nice juvenile races. 06-11-24

runners.name: Popa Rich
runners.comment: Makes handicap debut in a weak race and could have a bit more to offer after just 4 runs
runners.spotlight: Has shown some ability in four hurdle runs, including C&D, and he makes his handicap debut at a low level; not fully exposed and that's a positive in this field.

runners.name: Pacific
runners.comment: No improvement for handicapping in late 2024; cheekpieces tried on her reappearance
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden; no improvement for handicapping over hurdles in late 2024; this is weak though and new cheekpieces could help.

runners.name: Bluenose Belle

prev_owners.owner: Middleham Park Racing CXXVI & Les Boyer

runners.comment: Fontwell win on h'cap debut last month; tried to throw it away but going right handed a +
runners.spotlight: Twice a winner on the Flat and she made a successful handicap debut over hurdles at Fontwell four weeks ago (2m1f, good), albeit she did her best to throw it away after the last when hanging sharply to her right; moved through the race like one who was ahead of her mark though and going this way round may help.

stable_tour.quote: I think she is quite nice and I was delighted with her first run of the year when successful over 1m2f at Newcastle. She went off at 25-1 but was not a complete surprise to us as she had always looked decent at home, although she did carry a bit of condition on the day and I thought she would come on a lot for that run. PJ [McDonald] said they went a nice pace and when taking it up 2f out she kept finding more which is always an encouraging sign. Unfortunately, she had a little setback after that win and we have had to give her some time off. We had hoped to go for an Oaks Trial but that was scuppered and I she is still about six weeks off a return to the track. She is by a good sire and has a nice pedigree, so we are keen to try and get her up to Black Type level, which she has the potential for. She has won over 1m2f which is ideal for her but who knows she could get further. 07-07-21

runners.name: Thunder Gap
runners.comment: Low-grade maiden but this represents his first realistic opportunity over hurdles
runners.spotlight: 15-race maiden; faced with his first realistic chance over hurdles and a bigger effort could be forthcoming.

runners.name: Raincloud
runners.comment: Exposed 26-race maiden; this more suitable than recent tasks; opposable on balance
runners.spotlight: Exposed 26-race maiden but she has run the odd good race at massive odds; has a more realistic task in this low-grade handicap but others are more persuasive.

runners.name: Woodys Boy
runners.comment: Lightly raced and offered hope of better at Carlisle last month; worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Little solid form but he didn't run badly on his handicap debut at Carlisle three weeks ago; this is weak and he's worth a market check.

7:00.race_name: Oddschecker Fillies' Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Middle Distance Series Qualifier)
7:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering) (Outer track)

runners.name: La Fleur Petrus
runners.owner: Chris Wright & The Grand Crus Lovers
runners.comment: Has usually pulled hard, which is a concern in a small field going up in distance
runners.spotlight: Often pulled hard when with Charlie Johnston, from whom she was picked up for 20,000gns, and has repeated the dose in two runs for this yard, including without the hood back at 1m latest; that would be a concern in a small field going up in distance.

runners.name: Ravishing Beauty
runners.comment: Regressive maiden who's found her level now; 1m2f is far from certain to suit on pedigree
runners.spotlight: Regressive maiden who's found her level now, shaping nicely in a race that didn't pan out her way on comeback 17 days ago; this longer trip is far from certain to suit on pedigree (dam was a sprinter who's produced a winning sprinter) but has claims if stamina holds.

runners.name: Jet Black
runners.breeder: Team Valor, Cayton Park Stud, Cad Racing
runners.owner: Team Valor, Cayton Park Stud, A Singh
runners.comment: Half-sister to the yard's useful 1m2f winner T'Challa; one to consider now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Well held in two runs last backend but offered more on her Tapeta comeback five weeks ago, when staying on nicely over 1m; this half-sister to the yard's useful 1m2f winner T'Challa looks to start handicap life at a sensible level.

runners.name: Gigi Bliss
runners.comment: Better on her handicap debut; will be 2lb higher from tomorrow and is open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to a 1m4f heavy-ground winner; fared better on her handicap debut at Yarmouth last Thursday, upped to this trip; will be 2lb higher from tomorrow and remains open to improvement.

runners.name: Phaedra
runners.comment: Shapes as though worth a try over this trip but Gigi Bliss looks her stable's best chance
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to a 1m4f Polytrack winner; shaped as though tonight's longer trip would suit on her Bath comeback (1m) but that effort wasn't much of a step up on what she'd achieved last backend and Gigi Bliss looks her stable's best chance.

7:35.race_name: Bet Smarter With Oddschecker+ Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
7:35.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering) (Outer track)

runners.name: Boatswain
runners.comment: 240,000gns yearling; won easily on Polytrack debut four months ago; open to improvement
runners.spotlight: 240,000gns yearling; was heavily supported when easily winning a Polytrack novice (1m2f) on his debut four months ago (runner-up, a stablemate of Falmouth Lad's, successful since); improvement can be expected.

runners.name: Chess Dad
runners.comment: Under penalty when came away with the three market leaders at Newmarket; sets the standard
runners.spotlight: Stamina carried the day when beating an odds-on favourite on his 1m Tapeta debut in January; improved a good deal when coming away under a penalty with the three market leaders at Newmarket since and sets the standard in a first-time tongue-tie.

runners.name: Masai Moon
runners.comment: Eased off on comeback (Listed); interesting to see how he goes in the market
runners.spotlight: Took a while for the penny to drop when winning at 2-5 on AW (1m) last autumn but that was still promising; easy to back on his Newmarket comeback (Listed), when eased off in the closing stages and it will be interesting to see how he goes in the market this time.

quotes.race: Unibet Zero% Mission/EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: It's a learning curve, so he should learn plenty. Once the penny dropped Masai Moon really picked up well. It was a nice performance and he's a horse who is going to progress lovely into next year - William Buick, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Falmouth Lad
runners.comment: Gelded 70,000gns yearling who's a half-brother to six winners; big ask on debut
runners.spotlight: Gelded 70,000gns yearling who's a half-brother to six winners, notably Meliora (Listed, 1m2f) and Monadee (2yo 6f, Polytrack); has been found a decent-looking novice for his debut.

runners.name: Rogue Millions
runners.comment: Seems sure to appreciate the longer trip in receipt of weight from three previous winners
runners.spotlight: 130,000gns yearling; plenty to like about his opening Southwell third (1m) last month and seems sure to appreciate the longer trip in receipt of weight from the three previous winners; Derby entry who comes here instead of the Lingfield Derby Trial tomorrow.

6:25.race_name: Oddschecker Free Bets Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
6:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering) (Outer track)

runners.name: Booming
runners.comment: Beaten 23l on his debut (1m, AW) a month ago; now hooded switched to turf; best watched
runners.spotlight: Beaten 23l at Kempton (1m, AW; 20-1) on his debut one month ago and now tries a hood on this switch to turf; best watched.

runners.name: Brave Emerald
runners.comment: Better run on his second start (1m4f) but takes a sharp drop in trip; one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Plenty of stamina in pedigree; beaten a long way at Redcar (1m2f, good) on his debut one month ago but took a firm step forward upped to 1m4f when third at Catterick (good to firm) next time; drops sharply in trip this time and his future almost certainly lies in staying handicaps.

runners.name: Excellent Believe
runners.comment: Green but ran well on AW debut (7f; 5-4); player up in trip on turf debut for in-form yard
runners.spotlight: 55,000euros yearling from the family of Mohaather; 5-4 favourite for his debut at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) in March and he made good late headway to finish second despite looking green; the winner has run well since and this one's open to progress for his in-form yard, while the step up in trip should suit; player on his turf debut.

stable_tour.quote: He put in a really good debut performance a fortnight ago when second at Wolverhampton. He was green as grass and got beat by what looks a high-quality horse of Sir Mark Prescott's [Warrior Mode]. He's well bred and should be winning his maiden before going into the handicap division. 02-04-25

runners.name: Flame Of Forest
runners.comment: Promising debut when 7th (7f, good to firm; 33-1); should do better; up in trip
runners.spotlight: 105,000gns yearling from the family of outstanding 1m-1m2f winner Dubai Millennium; fairly encouraging headway from the rear when a 33-1 seventh of 12 at Doncaster (7f, good to firm; River King third) on his debut a fortnight ago; was second home of the newcomers and he can likely do better, while this extra furlong may help too.

runners.name: For What Its Worth
runners.comment: Well held at big prices in two 7f AW maidens; up in trip for turf debut; readily dismissed
runners.spotlight: Well held at big prices in two 7f AW maidens; up in trip for turf debut and others are much more likely.

runners.name: Jackchester
runners.comment: Down the field at big prices in two 7f AW novices; up in trip for turf debut; passed over
runners.spotlight: Way down the field in two 7f AW novices, big prices on both occasions; now goes up in trip for his turf debut; readily passed over.

runners.name: King Of The Sea
runners.comment: Always behind on 1m debut (33-1); should do better in time but best watched now; hood on
runners.spotlight: Useful pedigree; 33-1, slowly away and always behind on debut at Newbury (1m, good; Lola Moon fifth) last month; subsequently gelded and should do better in time but can only be watched for now; hooded.

runners.name: Lola Moon
runners.comment: Good debut fifth in a potentially warm maiden (1m, good) last month; gelded; big player.
runners.spotlight: Made encouraging debut when fifth of 12, beaten just under 2l, in what could turn out a warm maiden at Newbury (1m, good; 33-1) last month; big player after that; has been gelded.

runners.name: Pakal
runners.comment: Strong support on AW debut (1m) but not much went right; watch market on turf return
runners.spotlight: Attracted strong support on his debut but beat only one home in a valuable novice at Kempton (1m, AW) in October; not much went right that day and it would be folly to write him off after one run; switched to turf for this reappearance.

runners.name: River King
runners.comment: Sets the standard on his recent third (7f, good to firm); good chance if new trip suits
runners.spotlight: Sent off 40-1 but was an eyecatching fourth at Kempton (AW) on debut last August and built on that when third at Doncaster (also 7f, good to firm) on his return a fortnight ago; the latter run sets the standard and he has a good chance if this new trip suits.

stable_tour.quote: He ran just once last year but has been showing up well at home and will be out in the next fortnight or so. 22-04-25

runners.name: Typhoon Dancer
runners.comment: Good start when fourth (1m, AW); turf debut and normal progress should see him in the mix.
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to four winners from 5f to 1m; made a good start when fourth at Southwell (1m, AW) 19 days ago, in an above-average novice for the track; now tries turf and normal progress ought to see him in the mix.

runners.name: Soul Dance
runners.comment: 13l fourth at Beverley (about 1m, good) last month; now hooded and is one for handicaps.
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way on her debut (1m, AW; 40-1) in November and finished 13l behind at Beverley (about 1m, good) last month; now hooded; looks one for handicaps.

runners.name: Tempting Fate
runners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen
runners.comment: Just a fair debut (7f, AW) but should do better now up in trip on turf; Buick takes over.
runners.spotlight: Only limited promise on her debut when sixth of ten at Southwell (7f, AW) in November but she goes up in trip for her turf debut/reappearance and is bred to do better; William Buick 2-7 for yard in the last five years.

5:50.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering) (Outer track)

runners.name: Payment Plan
runners.comment: Lost some zip on AW and handicapper may have caught up; nothing to show for two turf runs
runners.spotlight: Did well on AW around 2m over the winter, finishing first post the post on four occasions, but he's lost his zip of late and there's a suspicion his handicap mark may have his measure; bred for turf but he was soundly beaten in both runs on it last term (1m2f on softer than good).

runners.name: Young Endless
runners.comment: Good stable debut (1m6f, AW; cheekpieces) but needs to prove he's as effective on turf
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins (1m6f to 2m) last spring, latterly off today's mark; back to life when second on his stable debut at Wolverhampton (1m6f, AW) in cheekpieces last week; yet to shine in two turf runs and was poor here (1m6f, good) last June, but it's probably too soon to write him off on this surface.

runners.name: Fashionelle
runners.comment: Respectable second on turf debut here (2m, good) and that form looks okay; chance
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut for this yard when bagging a weak AW novice (9.4f) in January and she made a respectable Flat turf debut when second to an in-form winner here (2m, good) last month; third and fourth have run well since and she goes off the same mark; respected.

runners.name: Tara Iti
runners.comment: Doing well over hurdles this spring and looks interesting on this return to the Flat
runners.spotlight: Running well over hurdles on a sound surface this spring, winning twice and firmly in contention when tipping up two out at Huntingdon (2m, good) 20 days ago; has not had many chances on Flat turf (1-3) and looks interesting back in this sphere.

quotes.quote: Tara Iti is bred to go on this testing ground. He travelled well despite being a little keen early. I took it up early enough, but he kept it up all the way to the line - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

runners.name: Somebodycomegether
runners.comment: Best run came at 2m (soft); not disgraced at 1m4f (good to firm) last time; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Second at Catterick (2m, soft; first-time cheekpieces) in October but hasn't matched that form in her three subsequent runs; made late gains over 1m4f (good to firm) last month, however, when sporting a first-time visor (retained) and she's not totally ruled out back up to this trip.

runners.name: Vitruvian Dawn
runners.comment: Yet to make an impact on AW and now tries turf up in trip; tongue-tie added to her hood
runners.spotlight: Not much to show for six AW runs and this switch to turf and step up to 2m will need to spark a turnaround; tongue-tie added to her hood.

runners.name: Queen Of Steel
runners.comment: 2-3 over hurdles since joining this yard; probable improver now returned to this sphere
runners.spotlight: 2-3 over hurdles since joining this yard, cheekpieces enlisted when off the mark at Ffos Las (2m4f) and following up at Wetherby (3m, good) one week later in March; 0-11 on Flat turf but she's a probable improver now returned to this sphere.

8:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering) (Outer track)

runners.name: Highland Olly
runners.comment: Didn't look to see it out on his first run at beyond 7f last time; stamina the concern
runners.spotlight: Solid comeback at Redcar a month ago but didn't look to see it out on his first run at beyond 7f last time; stamina would have to be the concern under a big weight.

runners.name: Misemerald
runners.comment: Bit more on her comeback and this is easier but needs to improve for tonight's longer trip
runners.spotlight: Fair 2yo who proved difficult to place last season, coming 10lb down the weights; offered a bit more on her comeback and this is easier than she's used to but needs to improve for tonight's longer trip.

runners.name: Beltane
runners.comment: Winless in almost two years but is well handicapped now; longer trip fine if more amenable
runners.spotlight: Winless in almost two years but well handicapped now and he showed much more in a second-time visor (off here) over 7f at Doncaster last time; typically pulled hard in front that day, also for Rhys Elliott, but tonight's longer trip will be fine if more amenable.

runners.name: Russian Virtue
runners.comment: Regressed under both codes; whether he'll have the toe over an easy course is the question
runners.spotlight: Seven wins in 2023 but has regressed under both codes since then and it's been a while since he ran over this short a trip; whether he'll have the toe required round an easy course is the question.

quotes.race: Top Odds Every Day With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: They put this extra meeting on and Russian Virtue has been a bit unlucky for us on the Flat, being placed plenty of times. So while the weather is not great for going hurdling we thought we'd give him a spin on the Flat and it's great that he's won a third race in a row. I hope he'll be one for the two-mile hurdle at the Northern Lights finals at Musselburgh. He may run at Sedgefield on Sunday and get him qualified - Rebecca Menzies, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A fun dual-purpose horse who's won eight times for us, with six coming over hurdles and two on the Flat. He thrives on racing and his work at home, and he hasn't finished winning yet. We're keen to keep his mark similar to where it is now so he has a nice weight for the Go North two-mile hurdle series final, which he finished fourth in last year. He'll be lightly raced before that and we might even go back on the all-weather. 24-01-24

runners.name: Harry Magnus
runners.comment: Undergone three rounds of wind surgery in the past year and has regressed; needs to settle
runners.spotlight: Undergone three rounds of wind surgery in the past year and has regressed; pulled hard on his first crack at 1m last Friday (Tapeta) and will need to settle better if he's to take advantage of a sliding mark (comes down another 2lb tomorrow).

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: I think that was the ride of the meeting. Harry Magnus was drawn one at Goodwood first time out and he jumped right away from the field and he was then in no man's land. Seven furlongs suits him well but he has got a bit of speed. We could drop him back in trip as he might get quicker. He has been a bit green learning his job and he is not fully there yet - Charles Hills, trainer.

runners.name: Little Ted
runners.comment: The return of the usual cheekpieces is a plus point; should fare better
runners.spotlight: Done most of his winning in the summer but has gone in second time out in the past and the return of the usual cheekpieces is a plus point having missed the break on his recent comeback; should fare better.

runners.name: Saved Lizzie
runners.comment: Achieved little on turf but holds each-way claims if ready to go after four months off
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who was compettiive at this level on the AW last autumn; achieved little under both codes on turf but holds each-way claims if ready to go again after four months off.

runners.name: Sunday Belle
runners.comment: The market will be the best guide, going without the usual hood, back from 16 months off
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two runs for this yard as a 2yo and in one run at Meydan early last year; the market will be the ultimate guide, going without the hood for the first time, back from 16 months off.

5:15.race_name: Get The Best Odds With Oddschecker Handicap
5:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering) (Outer track)

runners.name: Zuffolo
runners.owner: R R D Saunders And Partner
runners.comment: Unplaced in two runs this season but down in class and on a good mark; contender
runners.spotlight: Of interest on last season's best form and he should be at his peak following two runs back from a break; drops in class and he's a solid candidate.

runners.name: Glory Fighter
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs P Hopper & Mr & Mrs M Morris
runners.comment: Below par last time but in good order beforehand and on his lowest ever mark
runners.spotlight: Slightly disappointing when sent off favourite at Catterick 16 days ago but he'd been running well in defeat beforehand; not much we don't know about him these days but he's on his lowest ever mark and can't be ignored.

quotes.quote: That was a good performance from Glory Fighter. I tucked in on the rail and got a good run round. I had lots of horse left and he hit the line nicely - Callum Rodriguez, rider.

runners.name: Zola Power
runners.comment: Yet to beat a rival in two runs for current stable; cheekpieces join the tongue-tie
runners.spotlight: AW winner for Mick Appleby last season; big prices and yet to beat a rival in two runs for Robert Cowell; cheekpieces join the tongue-tie today but others look much safer.

runners.name: Sioux Warrior
runners.comment: Yet to shine for this yard but down in the weights and he needs a market check
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden; no better than midfield in two runs for current stable; down in the weights and a more prominent display is likely to be predicted by the betting.

runners.name: Rebel Star
runners.comment: Progressive at a low level this year; unexposed on turf; more appealing than many
runners.spotlight: Progressive at a low level since handicapping, runner-up three times before making her breakthrough at Yarmouth last month (5f, good to firm); only third at Wolverhampton under a penalty one week later; could yet do better back on turf.

runners.name: Hint Of The Jungle
runners.comment: Down in the weights and latest 4th to Rebel Star was better; not discounted
runners.spotlight: Won twice as a 2yo when trained by Ed Dunlop; struggled with the handicapper last season and his stable debut in March was low key too; better when fourth to Rebel Star at Yarmouth last month though and now has something to build on.

quotes.race: At The Races App Form Study EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C And D) (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I wanted to take a lead but Hint Of The Jungle latched on with me and I didn't want to take him back. He battled on and stuck his head out towards the line and he's really professional - Morgan Cole, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: 60 Years Of Porsche 911 EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB Race)(Div II)
quotes.quote: He's got a real high cruising speed. I'd upgrade Hint Of The Jungle as well because I was stuck in the middle of the track for a long way. He saw a lot of daylight the whole time and was just getting a bit lonely in front, but he's got a real good attitude. I think he'll end up being a bit better than a Beverley horse - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Stormy Pearl
runners.comment: Had optimum track position when 3rd at Redcar last week; in the mix with a repeat
runners.spotlight: Back to a good mark and she ran well at Redcar last week (5f, good to firm), albeit she had the benefit of the stand rail; in the mix.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a lot closer than I originally thought, but at least we can call Stormy Pearl a winner again, which is great. I couldn't see anything between them in the photo but if she had kept a little bit straighter she may have been a clear winner, but that's racing and it was great to see her run so well. She's a lovely filly who's usually consistent and seems to really like the place. We'll be back this season we hope, don't you worry about that! - David Thompson, trainer.

runners.name: Desert Master
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.comment: Two AW wins in midwinter; had a wind op since latest effort; fast turf a query
runners.spotlight: Won a couple of 5f handicaps at Southwell around the turn of the year; form cooled after the latest of them and he was given wind surgery in February; showed promise on turf as a 2yo, albeit on slower ground.

stable_tour.quote: Another who is bred to be both fast and early. The dam was a useful black-type two-year-old for us but so far hasn't produced anything. Hopefully by sending her to Blue Point she can enjoy some overdue success. I have him entered this week and again he has done plenty of work. 19-04-23

7:30.race_name: Dr Keith Howard OBE Memorial Handicap

runners.name: Rebel Empire
runners.comment: Lightly raced on turf; 6f suits him best but this looks a stiff task under top weight
runners.spotlight: All three wins have come on the AW and is lightly raced on turf (0-3), albeit he was beaten just over 2l into fifth of nine at Ascot (5f, good to firm) nine days ago; this trip suits him better, but this still looks a stiff task under top weight.

quotes.quote: To be honest, I thought Rebel Empire had a really good chance. I was doing eight-four, which is light for me, but he's the ultimate pro. He's turned himself around in the last month and I'm really pleased for him as he's all heart - Joe Leavy, rider.

runners.name: Fortamour
runners.breeder: D Ryan, D S Ryan & R A Williams

prev_owners.owner: C Barclay, Racing Knights & C Cleevely

runners.comment: 6-21 over C&D and his record in this race reads 124; another big run is likely
runners.spotlight: 6-21 over C&D while his record in this race over the past three years reads 124; beaten just over a length into third of 13 on his return from 180 days off here last month and races off the same mark, so another big run seems likely provided the ground doesn't dry out too much.

quotes.quote: Fortamour broke well and I got a good position; everything just went so smoothly. He was pulling up as soon as he hit the front, but just seems to love this track - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Beyond Borders
runners.comment: Well behind a couple of these on his stable debut/reappearance over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Has dropped 3lb lower than for the last leg of his hat-trick in the autumn of 2023 when with Karl Burke, but having been gelded he finished well behind a couple of these on stable debut/reappearance over C&D last month; much more needed.

runners.name: The Good Biscuit
runners.comment: Made an eyecatching stable debut when fourth over C&D last month; interesting
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced since winning twice for Jack Channon (6f, good to firm) in the summer of 2023, but made an eyecatching stable debut after 174 days off when fourth of 13 over C&D last month (under 2l behind Fortamour); interesting.

quotes.race: In Memory Of Sir Ian Pamphilon Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Band D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Good Biscuit has backed up quite well. He was fresh and well on Monday morning so we thought this looked like a race we could win. He's got a good constitution so it was a straightforward decision after he ate up. One of his main rivals was taken out, but he still did it well. He went unsold so we brought him home, and he's probably had to run to about the same as he did last time, but when we go into nurseries it'll be tougher - Jack Channon, trainer.

quotes.race: Smooth Breakfast With Gareth Evans Selling Stakes (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: The Good Biscuit had every right to go and do that and he did it well. We've always thought he was a nice two-year-old and these sellers have unbelievable prize-money, so it was a no-brainer for us to go there. It was a nice, easy race and he'll have a handicap mark now so we can go into nurseries and hopefully have a lot of fun with him. He's a horse who should improve. Nothing went right for him the first day at Carlisle, and his second start was pretty much like his first run. He was drawn on the wrong side in stall five, but Charlie gave him a nice ride and he finished well - Jack Channon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He came here from the sales in late autumn and it's quite possible the change of scenery and routine here at Mowbray will revitalise him. I'm still finding out about him, but I sense he could shape into a decent sprinter. He makes his debut for us at Redcar on April 17. 09-04-25

runners.name: True Promise
runners.comment: All four wins have come on the AW and has shown little in four goes on turf
runners.spotlight: Favourably treated on his two AW wins last autumn, but all four successes have come on Tapeta and he has shown little in four goes on turf; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: He was just a bit immature last year and we had to mind him a little bit. He progressed after winning on his debut at Newcastle in January and followed up under a penalty, but the handicapper hasn't missed him. He's very laid-back and not until we run him will we know if he can keep progressing off that mark, but we're hopeful he can and looking forward to getting him on turf. 04-04-24

runners.name: Wreck It Ryley

prev_owners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And G Tuer

runners.comment: C&D winner who met trouble when behind Mister Sox at Pontefract last time; could figure
runners.spotlight: C&D winner last August (good to firm) and made a successful return at Thirsk (6f, good) last month; only fifth of seven behind Mister Sox off this mark at Pontefract (6f, good) nine days ago, but ran into traffic; could figure with a clearer run.

quotes.quote: Wreck It Ryley has done it well. I was just waiting for the gap to appear. He's run in blinkers a few times before and they do help him because he's a bit behind the bridle normally. He keeps breaking half a stride too slowly, but he's soon there on the heels of the leaders and he was there when I needed him. I had plenty of horse underneath me to commit and go - Dale Swift, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He has been a busy lad this season with 14 runs and two wins. On his latest start at Ayr they virtually trotted to the three-furlong marker before sprinting. He wasn't best positioned for that but he came home well to win and has gone up only 2lb for it, which I thought was fair. I'm hopeful he can add to his successes again this season [ran at Musselburgh on Tuesday night after the Weekender went to press]. 30-08-23

runners.name: Mister Sox
runners.comment: 2-2 since returning last month; 2lb well in under his penalty, but fast ground a question
runners.spotlight: Has been mainly campaigned over further in his career, but he took his record over 6f to 3-6 with fluent wins on good ground at Catterick and Pontefract since returning last month; still 2lb well in under a penalty for his latest success, but fast ground would pose a question.

runners.name: Late Arrival

prev_owners.owner: A Pollock, S Windle & G Routledge
A Pollock, S Windle & B Padgett

runners.comment: Remains 5lb above his last winning mark so he will need to pull out more
runners.spotlight: Should be all the better for last month's Thirsk reappearance, but remains 5lb above his last winning mark so will need to pull out more.

runners.name: Showtime Mahomes
runners.comment: Back off last winning mark, but others are that bit more convincing
runners.spotlight: Back off the same mark as when winning at Southwell (6f, AW) last November and no problem with the return to turf, but others are that bit more convincing.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: The step up to six furlongs has definitely suited Showtime Mahomes, he was outpaced over five at the Dante meeting here last week and was doing his best work at the end - Grant Tuer, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won as a juvenile over 5f at Musselburgh and did well physically over the close season. First time out he ran a very good race when third to Korker in a valuable 15-runner York handicap, where he could have done even better if the pace had been faster. I was delighted with his second run when, again on the Knavesmire, he won a 21-runner 6f handicap off 77. That was a terrific effort which earned him a 5lb rise in the weights, and despite that I think he is still a well-handicapped horse. I will give him a break now and freshen him up. 22-06-22

runners.name: Marks Choice
runners.comment: Seven course wins, but losing run up to 16 and has been off for five months
runners.spotlight: Formerly a standing dish here (seven wins), but losing run up to 16 despite a sliding mark; looks up against it back from five months off.

quotes.race: William Hill Silver Trophy Handicap (Consolation Race For The William Hill Great St Wilfrid Stakes)
quotes.quote: Mark's Choice's wind was just bothering him and we looked at it last time and got it tightened up again. He's a lovely horse and when he's right, he runs a very good race. He's entered at Ayr and we'll see what the handicapper does - Sam England, trainer.

8:05.race_name: Next Evening Meeting Wednesday 4th June Handicap

runners.name: Mariner

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Marriott
Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Has landed two of his last four; stays this far and a solid contender up 3lb
runners.spotlight: No win in his first 16 starts under rules but has landed two of his last four, the latest at Doncaster (1m, good to firm) 13 days ago; stays this far and a solid contender up 3lb.

stable_tour.quote: He had his first run for us over hurdles at Musselburgh last week and did okay, finishing fourth. He'll go back on the Flat now and is probably very well handicapped. He's the type who'll be winning at the back end of January in a 0-65 over a mile at Wolverhampton. 05-12-24

runners.name: Poets Dawn
runners.breeder: Mrs J K Powell & Catridge Farm Stud
runners.comment: C&D winner who is 1lb below last winning mark; needs to improve on recent efforts
runners.spotlight: Winner of ten races over the years including one over C&D; 1lb lower than when successful at Carlisle (1m1f, soft) last August, but not sure he comes into this race in good enough form to take advantage.

quotes.quote: It felt like the leader was getting away but Poet's Dawn has a big heart and he dug deep. He's a grand horse to have in the yard, he goes on any ground and very versatile - David Allan, jockey.

Poet's Dawn slipped coming out the stalls at Beverley last time and couldn't get in the race. He loves a bit of cut in the ground and David said he seemed to go better left-handed than right - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK In Glorious HD Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: The race that Poet's Dawn ran in at Redcar last time worked out quite well with several winners coming out of it, and this didn't look a particularly good race - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Eeetee
runners.owner: Peter Clarke Racing And John Wainwright
runners.comment: Losing run up to 17 (12 for this yard) despite a falling mark; others more convincing
runners.spotlight: Well treated on his form from this time two years ago, but losing run up to 17 (12 for this yard) despite a falling mark; others more convincing.

runners.name: Steps In Time
runners.comment: Placed in all three starts on the AW late last year; market support would be interesting
runners.spotlight: Placed in all three starts over 1m-9.5f on the AW late last year; makes his handicap/turf debut after five months off, but no reason why he shouldn't act on grass; market support would be interesting.

runners.name: Dubawi Time
runners.owner: R Greenwood & John And Peter Seabrook
runners.comment: Two wins last year; acts on fast ground and worth a market check after seven months off
runners.spotlight: Two wins in 2024, the latest at Yarmouth (1m2f, soft) in October; has run well on good to firm and worth market check back from 206 days off.

runners.name: Stipulation
runners.comment: 0-5; has enough to prove under the conditions after four months off; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: 0-5; ran well a couple of times on the AW late last year, but not so good at Lingfield (1m2f) in January; cheekpieces given a go back from four months off, but he still has enough to prove under the conditions.

runners.name: Rainwater

prev_owners.owner: M & M Racing, Paul Byrne And Partner

runners.comment: 1-19; last two efforts back on turf leave plenty to be desired
runners.spotlight: 1-19, the win coming at Wolverhampton (9.5f, AW) in November; continued to run well afterwards, but his last two efforts back on turf leave plenty to be desired.

runners.name: Bay Dream Believer
runners.comment: Back off the same mark as when winning over C&D last August; major player
runners.spotlight: Won twice last August, the latest over C&D (good) off this mark; has run well in both starts since returning last month and drying ground wouldn't be an issue; major player.

quotes.race: William Hill Betting Done Properly Handicap
quotes.quote: We were unsure as Bay Dream Believer had a 5lb penalty and was only put up 2lb for her last win so it was a bit of a gamble but the prize money was good for the grade and she came out of the race really well. She's only a little pony but she tries hard - trainer Mark Walford.

stable_tour.quote: She's a very small mare but has one of the biggest hearts in training. We expect her to win again this summer - she's been fourth in her last two runs at Nottingham and Pontefract and is knocking on the door. She ran again at Pontefract on Monday, where the draw and a slow start made life very tricky for her. However, she finished powerfully to finish fourth behind Lord Warburton which was a great effort! 14-06-24

runners.name: Wait And Hope
runners.owner: S Rimmer, L Taylor, Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: 0-13 since his successful handicap debut and has shown little lately
runners.spotlight: 0-13 since his successful handicap debut from 12lb higher for Karl Burke at Kempton (1m, AW) early last year; little in three starts since returning in March and drying ground would pose another question.

stable_tour.quote: He came here from Karl Burke's over the summer and I have to say he's been disappointing. The silver lining is that his handicap rating has dropped to 60, which could put him in with a chance at Newcastle on Thursday. 09-04-25

6:55.race_name: Ripon Races Ladies Day 19th June Handicap

runners.name: Reigning Profit
runners.comment: 2lb higher than under the penalty from tomorrow; every chance of making it 2-2 round here
runners.spotlight: Done well in the spring in the past and was back to his best in the reapplied visor at Pontefract last Wednesday; will be 2lb higher than under the penalty from tomorrow and has every chance of making it 2-2 round here.

quotes.quote: Reigning Profit was a bit slower away than we'd hoped but it worked out well in the end. He likes it here - Ruth Carr, trainer.

quotes.race: Ripon Races Ladies Day 22nd June Handicap
quotes.quote: He did it well. Reigning Profit broke very quickly so I travelled strongly through the race and I think he was just getting a little tired near the line - James Sullivan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Go Racing In Yorkshire Future Stars Apprentice Handicap (Round 3)
quotes.quote: Reigning Profit is usually a good eater and he's a solid sprinter so I see no reason why he shouldn't go to Goodwood on Friday - Ruth Carr, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A solid sprinter who had a busy 2024 running 20 times, scoring at Wolverhampton and Hamilton and finishing runner-up four times. A turning track over 5f suits him best. There's a race for him at Pontefract on April 14. 09-04-25

runners.name: High Opinion
runners.comment: Boasts a solid record over C&D but may need some help from the handicapper now
runners.spotlight: Boasts a solid record over C&D and is entitled to have come on for his Beverley comeback following six months off, albeit he didn't show a lot; may need some help from the handicapper now (5lb above his highest winning mark).

quotes.race: Theakston's Beer Festival Saturday 28th September Handicap
quotes.quote: High Opinion was very straightforward and the penny is starting to drop. It was a step up in class but he's a fine, big stamp of a horse. He'll be a sprinter that keeps on improving - Paul Mulrennan, rider.
High Opinion got there cruising but had to knuckle down and has a willing attitude. He's progressing with every run - Harrison Shaw, jockey.

runners.name: Abate

prev_owners.owner: The Never Say No Racing Club
Thirty Three To One Racing Club
The Never Say No Racing Club

runners.comment: Well held latest and such an easy 5f wouldn't appeal as optimal; into the veteran stage
runners.spotlight: The years looked to be catching up last season but he's gone well fresh in the past and returned with a solid effort off 2lb lower at Doncaster in March; didn't build on that latest and such an easy 5f wouldn't appeal as optimal.

stable_tour.quote: A yard favourite who's called “the champ” for a reason. He's been nothing but a superstar, winning ten races. He loves the big tracks, like Newmarket and York, and never seems to run a bad race. Since Mia has been riding him for the last couple of seasons, he's been very consistent as she gets a good tune out of him. I've pitched him into some big handicaps this season and he's run creditably. There's a nice handicap in him and he deserves a big one. He's won on every ground but is probably best on good to firm. I'll probably target him at Newmarket in the next few weeks and then there's the Great St Wilfrid at Ripon. We're in the Racing League this year, and so is Mia, so there could be something there. 26-07-24

runners.name: The Coffee Pod
runners.comment: Things didn't pan out his way at Epsom; 2lb below his last winning mark; easy 5f is ideal
runners.spotlight: Favourite on his Epsom comeback last month, having been gelded over the winter, but things didn't pan out his way; now 2lb below his last winning mark and an easy 5f is ideal, so he's shortlisted from a handy draw.

quotes.race: Ire Incentive, It Pays To Buy Irish EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: The Coffee Pod was third in the Hornblower last time to a couple of good horses, but we thought this would suit him. Richard says he wants 7f, maybe a mile eventually, so we might step him up next time. We've got the job done and hopefully go on from there - Tim Palin, racing director of Middleham Park Racing, owners.

runners.name: Birkenhead
runners.comment: Took his Catterick record to 4-8 when making all 16 days ago; needs more upped 4lb
runners.spotlight: Took his Catterick record to 4-8 when making all in an apprentice handicap 16 days ago; goes well here too and is drawn near the rail but there's little room for manoeuvre off this mark, having been upped 4lb.

quotes.quote: Birkenhead really loves it there and saves his best for the track. We've had him a few seasons now and he's been great. He's a fantastic little horse who pays his way and he's one of them who just loves life and is easy to train. For these older horses, soundness is the key. If they're sound they keep giving and they keep lasting; if they're not then they don't do that. I thought he was big enough [odds], but I thought he was that price because of his draw in stall ten. Between myself and Oisin [McSweeney, jockey], we made the plan to go down the middle of the track and he was always in control - Paul Midgley, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet "Jump Jockeys' Nunthorpe" Handicap (To Be Ridden By Professional Jump Jockeys)
quotes.quote: It took a while for BIRKENHEAD to click but he's not done anything wrong since-Paul Midgley, trainer

stable_tour.quote: We bought him off Les Eyre and he wasn't a lot of money, and if you'd said to me a fortnight after we bought him that he would win the jump jockeys' race at York, I'd have said you were on a different planet. He's a funny little horse; when he's in form, he's in form, and when he isn't in form, he isn't. He's really easy to train and he's been great but he's frustrating at times as he does what he likes. To be fair to him, he's a fast-ground horse but he won on soft at Catterick the time before last. It was soft ground that you could go through and a few of the fancied ones didn't run because the ground changed overnight and we thought we'd got nothing to lose. We'd got an outside stall, where we could get over to the golden highway, and the worst thing we could do was get beat. After about a furlong, he was never going to get beat. We tried to do the same there last time but he just got beat by a progressive one of Bryan Smart's. He's paying his way, whiis great, and hopefully he'll continue to do so. 28-06-24

runners.name: Profiteer
runners.comment: Well held off a career-high mark on his 6f comeback recently; easy 5f is a bare minimum
runners.spotlight: Won over 7f last summer and his two autumn 5f victories came round stiff Pontefract on soft ground, so whether this will be enough of a test is the question; finished well held off a career-high mark on his 6f comeback recently anyway.

runners.name: Betweenthesticks
runners.owner: J A Swinburne & Mrs Ruth A Carr
runners.comment: Stall 2 not ideal for one happiest on the sharp end; Reigning Profit his yard's best shout
runners.spotlight: Beat a couple of subsequent winners off a 2lb lower mark back on turf last month before finishing well held at Doncaster; stall 2 isn't ideal for one happiest on the sharp end and Reigning Profit looks his yard's best shout.

stable_tour.quote: He's a straightforward sprinter who nearly always goes over the minimum trip. He had a busy time last year, running 12 times between May and October and winning twice. He doesn't want extremes of going and I fully expect him to win again soon. 09-04-25

runners.name: Lettuce Leaf
runners.comment: Finished last season on a downswing and isn't obviously fancied from the outside stall
runners.spotlight: Maiden who turned in her best efforts last year on soft ground; finished the season on a downswing and isn't obviously fancied from the outside stall.

5:45.race_name: NHC Educating The Educators EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B-D) (EBF Qual') (GBB/IRE Incentive)

runners.name: Koffee And Kale
runners.comment: Something to like on pedigree and stable had a nice newcomer go in at Newmarket on Sunday
runners.spotlight: April foal by Ardad; 42,000gns yearling, £47,000 breeze-up 2yo; brother to Group-placed 5f winner Crispy Cat (including 2yo/US; RPR 108), half-brother to 6f winner Constanzia (including AW 2yo/Sweden; 67); dam unplaced Czech Republic, half-sister to Group-placed 5f 2yo winner Explosive Lady; something to like on pedigree and stable had a nice newcomer go in at Newmarket on Sunday.

runners.name: Raakeb
runners.comment: Stable has had a few winning 2yo newcomers this season, but is bred to need further
runners.spotlight: February foal by Ten Sovereigns; 50,000euros foal, £58,000 yearling; half-brother to German 1m/1m1f winner Salve's Secret; dam German 1m3f winner, half-sister to German 1m2f Group 3 winner Sea Of Sands; stable has had a few winning 2yo newcomers this season and he holds several sales race entries later in the year, but his pedigree suggests he may not come into his own until tackling further.

runners.name: Ginger Hunter
runners.comment: Stable often gets them ready first time but others appeal more on breeding
runners.spotlight: March foal by Alkumait; £32,000 yearling; half-brother to 4.5f-6f winner What A Business (including 2yo/Bahrain; RPR 77); dam unplaced 6f-1m2f (50), half-sister to winners Rockwell (French 1m4f Flat/2m1f hurdle) and Boucheron (1m4f), is granddaughter of 1m/1m1f winner; stable often gets them ready first time but others appeal more on breeding.

runners.name: Alaskan Light
runners.comment: Something to like on breeding and stable 6-9 with 2yo newcomers last month
runners.spotlight: May foal by Kodiac; 48,000gns yearling; sister to winners Alaskan Gold (Listed-placed 6f 2yo; RPR 102) and Waddat (6f AW including 2yo; 89), closely related to 1m winner Paved With Gold (67), half-sister to five winners including Zifena (6f 2yo; 94); dam 5f/6f winner (80); only just had his second birthday, but something to like on breeding and stable 6-9 with 2yo newcomers last month; holds a Super Sprint entry.

runners.name: Baggot Street
runners.comment: Beautifully bred and stable can get them ready first time
runners.spotlight: March foal by Oasis Dream; 50,000euros yearling; sister to two winners including Naadirr (6f/7f including 2yo/Listed; RPR 114), closely related to three winners including Beach Belle (5f/6f 2yo including Listed; 103), half-sister to four winners including Dubai Mile (1m2f 2yo Group 1; 116); dam 1m1f Listed winner (110); beautifully bred and stable can get them ready first time.

runners.name: Soca Star
runners.comment: Stable does have 2yo winners first time out, but a few of the others make greater appeal
runners.spotlight: February foal by Starman; £40,000 yearling; half-sister to 6f AW winner Jorge Alvares (RPR 90); dam unraced half-sister to winners A Momentofmadness (useful 5f-6f including 2yo), Arc Royal (7f 2yo) and Omniqueen (5f 2yo), is granddaughter of 6f 2yo Group 2 winner; stable does have 2yo winners first time out but a few of the others make greater appeal.

runners.name: Youfillupmysenses
runners.comment: Has weakened quickly in both starts; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Has experience and is bred for speed, but has weakened quickly in both starts; best watched for now.

6:20.race_name: Traditional Family Day Sunday 18th May Handicap

runners.name: Zappata
runners.comment: Has completely taken off since switching to 1m handicaps (2111); another big run expected
runners.spotlight: Has completely taken off since switching to 1m handicaps with cheekpieces added (2111) on ground ranging from good to firm (last two wins have come under Liam Wright); his recent successes have built up 18lb in penalties, but is only 3lb wrong compared to his revised mark; another big run expected.

runners.name: Flamborough Head
runners.comment: Off the mark at Redcar last month, but only fourth there next time; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the sixth attempt at Redcar (1m, good) last month, but only fourth of 12 over the same C&D (good to firm) a fortnight later following a 5lb rise; only 1lb lower now so he needs a bit more in the first-time cheekpieces; stable also runs Eye On The Prize.

runners.name: Nippasso
runners.breeder: Susan E Mason & Mr S A Hollings
runners.comment: Makes handicap debut after seven months off; market should indicate what is expected
runners.spotlight: Huge prices and just a hint of ability in three starts over 6f/7f last autumn; makes her handicap debut after seven months off and the market should indicate what is expected.

runners.name: Treble Winners
runners.comment: Some ability in his first two starts last summer, but hasn't built on it; best watched
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in his first two starts last summer, but hasn't built on it and finished tailed off on his Redcar reappearance (1m, good to firm; first-time cheekpieces) 18 days ago (reportedly received a bump and became unbalanced); best watched for now.

runners.name: Hill O Rue
runners.owner: Gordon Bulloch & S Hardcastle D Szepler
runners.comment: Beaten a length by Flamborough Head at Redcar last month; 4lb better off; may reverse form
runners.spotlight: Little to get excited about in his three starts late last year, but much better when a length second of 11 behind Flamborough Head on handicap debut/reappearance at Redcar (1m, good) last month; 4lb better off and could reverse the form with the run under his belt.

runners.name: Oselton
runners.comment: Makes stable debut after six months off having been gelded; much more needed
runners.spotlight: Well held in four starts over 6f/7f on a soft surface/AW for Mark Walford last autumn; makes stable debut after six months off (same owners) having been gelded in the meantime; much more needed, though Paul Mulrennan is an interesting booking.

runners.name: Mavetheforcebewivu
runners.comment: 8l behind Zappata on her reappearance and 20lb better off; should finish closer
runners.spotlight: Second of 11 in a Beverley nursery (7.5f, good to firm) last August is much her best performance so far; 8l behind Zappata when sixth of 12 on stable debut/reappearance at Wetherby (1m, good to firm) 12 days ago, but is now 20lb better off; should finish closer with the outing under her belt.

stable_tour.quote: She's ready to run and has had a few entries. She was only small when she came to us. The owners had her in a field down the road. She's done nothing wrong whatsoever and she's improved after each gallop, so she's going to be the type to improve after a run or two. She could be okay. 21-06-24

runners.name: Sweet Cicely
runners.comment: 0-11; more needed back on turf for the first time since her debut
runners.spotlight: Often in the frame on the AW but is now 0-11; more needed back on turf for the first time since her debut; visor returns.

runners.name: Eye On The Prize
runners.comment: Well held in four starts last autumn; much more needed back from seven months off
runners.spotlight: Big prices and well held in four starts over 6f-1m on varying ground last autumn; much more needed back from seven months off.

runners.name: Sun Keeper
runners.comment: All seven starts on the AW including a Wolverhampton win; turf debut
runners.spotlight: All seven starts on the AW, getting off the mark at Wolverhampton (6f; first-time tongue-tie) in February and finishing second of seven at Newcastle (5f; first-time cheekpieces) in March; has proved inconsistent, though, and not sure how she will cope with turf at the first time of asking.

runners.name: Novamay
runners.comment: Disappointing in three starts after a promising debut; off 226 days
runners.spotlight: Finished a promising third of 12 on her Beverley debut (5f, good to firm) last summer, but went downhill in three subsequent starts including on handicap debut; probably only of interest if attracting support back from 226 days off.

runners.name: Miakoda
runners.comment: 1-15, the win coming on the AW; needs the return to sprinting to make a difference
runners.spotlight: Mainly seen on the AW and is 1-15, the win coming at Newcastle (7f) in March; twice held back on turf since and needs the return to sprinting to make a difference.

runners.name: Miss Cast
runners.comment: Showed ability on her third start last summer, but out of the frame in all three handicaps
runners.spotlight: Showed ability when third of nine in a Thirsk novice (6f, good to soft; 66-1) last July, but has finished out of the frame in all three handicaps so has something to prove; stable also runs Barmyblade.

runners.name: Queen Dinah
runners.comment: Returns to turf for her handicap debut following wind surgery; may fare better
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in two starts on turf (6f/7f) last summer, but poor in two outings on the AW since returning in February; returns to grass for her handicap debut following wind surgery and not the greatest surprise if she fares better.

runners.name: Lima Sierra
runners.comment: In the frame in three of her five starts since contesting AW handicaps; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: In the frame in three of her five starts since contesting AW handicaps, the latest when fourth of seven behind three subsequent winners at Newcastle (6f) in February; not seen since, but each-way claims if returning in the same form back on turf.

runners.name: Pastoral Way
runners.breeder: J A Knox And Mrs M A Knox
runners.comment: In the frame in last four starts; has shaped as though worth a go at 6f; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: All six starts over 5f, making the frame in his last four as when third of seven behind a subsequent winner at Ayr (5f, good) 11 days ago; has shaped as though worth a go at 6f and it shouldn't be an issue on breeding; cheekpieces are given ago.

runners.name: Barmyblade
runners.comment: Won at Catterick last month but behind Pastoral Way at Ayr last time; has stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the eighth attempt with a narrow success on last month's Catterick reappearance (5f, good; 33-1) last month, but finished just over a length behind Pastoral Way when sixth of seven at Ayr (5f, good) 11 days ago; has something to prove back at 6f.

runners.name: I Got Know How
runners.comment: Not beaten far when fifth of 12 on last month's handicap debut; could play a part
runners.spotlight: Not within 10l of the winner in three starts last year, but was beaten just over 3l when fifth of 12 on her handicap debut/reappearance at Pontefract (6f, good) last month; that form has worked out quite well and she wouldn't need to step up much in order to play a part.

runners.name: Kilo Sunshine
runners.comment: Not shown much in four starts including on handicap debut; look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Not shown much in four starts over 5f-7f on turf/AW including on handicap debut; look elsewhere.

5:05.race_name: Harrington Concrete & Quarries Optional Claiming Race

runners.name: Amavasya
runners.comment: Dundalk handicap debut last month modest enough under forcing tactics; has it to do
runners.spotlight: Dundalk handicap debut last month was modest enough under forcing tactics; seemingly has it to do here.

runners.name: Broadstone
runners.comment: Cheekpieces on and upped in trip; 2yo form on this sort of ground gives him major claims
runners.spotlight: Shaped like he may need further when beaten roughly 5l on debut in good-class Curragh 2yo maiden (good); both runs this term on easier ground not so good; cheekpieces now tried and upped in trip; return to better ground could well see him play a role.

runners.name: Fantazy Man

prev_owners.owner: McPeake Investments(NI) Ltd & JP Murtagh Racing

runners.comment: Handled ground at Bellewstown; cheekpieces fitted and should stay
runners.spotlight: Promise in three maidens over 1m, including on good ground last time at Bellewtown; cheekpieces now fitted and should stay this longer trip; one to consider.

runners.name: Sunriseontheboyne
runners.comment: A 3-time winner over shorter; didn't appear to stay 1m2f on penultimate; stamina concerns
runners.spotlight: Turf win last year came on softish ground but in good form on AW in the spring, winning twice; not so effective back on turf of late though, didn't appear to stay 1m2f on penultimate; stamina concerns.

runners.name: Thakheera
runners.owner: Mohammed Bin Hamad Khalifa Al Attiyah
runners.comment: Maiden form leaves her with a bit to find and untried on ground this quick
runners.spotlight: Fair form in a couple of maidens, latest when beaten 5l at Gowran; has raced only on soft/heavy so quicker ground an unknown; more needed.

runners.name: Voice Of Northeast
runners.comment: Ex Michael Mulvany-trained; ground to suit, fair chance of staying trip; bit to find
runners.spotlight: Mild promise in maidens last month on decent ground, below that form when third to Weegeebear in Gowran claimer on soft last time; has since left Michael Mulvany and upped in trip here for yard debut (good chance of staying).

runners.name: Alishba
runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs
runners.comment: Never sighted on yard debut in Dundalk handicap in January; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Modest enough 2yo form for Johnny Murtagh; bought for 2,000euros by Brian Cawley and never sighted on yard debut in Dundalk handicap in January; hard to fancy.

runners.name: Weegeebear
runners.owner: Mark Devlin & Nigel Ohare & Philip Smith
runners.comment: Slow-starter already two claiming wins this year; steps up in trip and  player if staying
runners.spotlight: Claimed for 5,000Euros after winning Dundalk claimer in March for Cormac Farrell and added Gowran claimer win on second start for this yard last month in first-time visor; habitual slow start in handicap at same track week later from which he never fully recovered when staying on third and again when beaten 10l at Gowran Wednesday; has to be treated with caution given recent starting tendencies.

quotes.race: Golf At Gowran Park Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Weegeebear actually jumped slow and I went to plan B straightaway, down the rail. I was able to scoot up their inside turning the bend and got a really nice position. He travelled into the straight really well and quickened up. He's hit the line strong. He had been slowly away at Bellewstown last time. When you jump slow around Bellewstown it's hard to get into it, we struggled all the way really. I'm glad he's gone and done it today - Adam Caffrey, jockey.

runners.name: Lash Envy
runners.owner: Monmouth Bay Racing Llc & Richie Galway
runners.comment: Cheekpieces worn for belated debut and appears the lesser likely of the Harrington pair
runners.spotlight: Belardo half-sister to winners Macho Pride (5f AW 2yo/6f turf; RPR 84) and Auckland Lodge (5f 2yo; 78); dam unraced half-sister to useful 7f/7.4f winner Peak Princess; cheekpieces worn for belated debut and appears the lesser likely of the Harrington pair.

runners.name: All Told
runners.comment: Held in 3 runs at 1m so far but shown ability and further may help now; respected
runners.spotlight: Well held in three runs at a mile on the all-weather this winter but has shown ability and further may help (dam a 1m2f winner); he warrants respect with a handy draw.

runners.name: Amplitude
runners.comment: Late progress over 7f last month; stamina on dam's side suggests new trip may help
runners.spotlight: Made some late progress over 7f at Gowran last month; stamina on the dam's side of his pedigree suggests this trip may suit; drawn wide though.

runners.name: Cinammon Coco
runners.comment: Best run yet when 8th at Gowran last month; quicker ground here; others achieved more
runners.spotlight: Best run yet when beaten 6.5l at Gowran last month; mixed signs in his pedigree on whether this trip will suit and quicker ground this time; others have achieved more.

runners.name: Faoladh
runners.comment: Relatively consistent but will get better chances in h'caps and drawn wide here
runners.spotlight: Relatively consistent in five runs so far but will get better chances in handicaps and he's drawn wider than ideal.

runners.name: Flying Fortress
runners.comment: Promise in Britain before selling for 15,000gns; needs career best here on return though
runners.spotlight: Some promise in Britain for James Owen last season and bought for 15,000gns since; would need a career best to be a factor here and entitled to need this after 200 days off.

runners.name: Mischief Man

prev_owners.owner: McPeake Investments(NI) Ltd & JP Murtagh Racing

runners.comment: Only minor promise in 2 runs so far inc' here latest and one for h'caps now
runners.spotlight: Only minor promise in two starts so far including a seventh of 11 here (1m) last month; new trip may help but probably one for handicaps at this point and drawn widest.

runners.name: Something Noble
runners.comment: Big prices and well held in 2 maidens last term; off 168 days and gelded; Keane booked
runners.spotlight: Big prices when well held in maidens last season; off 168 days and gelded in the interim; booking of Keane and stall one are positives but others appeal more.

runners.name: Wertpol
runners.comment: Shown very little in two maidens so far; up in trip but qualifies for handicaps after this
runners.spotlight: Has shown very little in two maidens so far; up in trip but qualifies for handicaps after this.

runners.name: Brosna Green
runners.comment: Left debut behind with Dundalk 4th but backwards step here on return; blinkers on
runners.spotlight: Left debut behind with a fourth (beaten roughly 3l) in a fillies' maiden at Dundalk; however, mixed signals on strength of that form and she was well held here (1m) on return; first-time blinkers need to spark revival.

runners.name: Casheldale Lass
runners.comment: Shown nothing in two runs at big odds so far
runners.spotlight: Shown nothing in two runs at big odds so far.

runners.name: Clementines Dream
runners.comment: Outran odds when 6th on debut but failed to build on that over 1m since; off 204 days
runners.spotlight: Outran odds of 125-1 to some extent on Curragh debut (7f) last season when sixth of 14 but failed to build on that over 1m back there when last seen and off 204 days.

runners.name: I Do Believe
runners.comment: Only 17-2 for debut Curragh 4th but beaten 19l and beaten similar distance since
runners.spotlight: Only 17-2 for her debut when fourth of 14 at the Curragh in March but was beaten 19l and beaten a similar distance when a big price for a Navan maiden 13 days ago; this is easier but others have achieved more.

runners.name: Midnight Horizon
runners.comment: Hasn't managed to get competitive thrice so far but has shown ability
runners.spotlight: Hasn't managed to get competitive in a trio of maidens so far but has shown ability including at this trip at Naas last week; quicker ground may help and has fitness on her side; each-way squeak.

runners.name: Stiorra
runners.comment: Promise in Beverley novice; shown little in 3 runs for new yard; ground may help here
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in a Beverley novice for Ollie Sangster but shown little in three runs for her new connections; return to quicker ground needs to spark a revival.

runners.name: Buckle And Bolts
runners.comment: Promise in trio of maidens; didn't give impression further would help latest; blinkers on
runners.spotlight: Promise in a trio of maidens this season but didn't really given the impression he wanted further at Limerick a fortnight ago; needs improvement for first-time blinkers.

runners.name: Captain Hanley
runners.comment: Showed minor promise on last season's belated debut; off 175 days
runners.spotlight: Showed minor promise on last season's belated debut; new yard and probably best watched returning from 175 days off.

runners.name: Dabirsim Flyer
runners.owner: A Culumbarapitiyage Don/T Holmes/C Ferguson/C Ferguson
runners.comment: Showed promise on first 2 runs in 2023 but lost his way and off 483 days
runners.spotlight: Showed promise on his first two starts in 2023 but lost his way subsequently and best watched on return from 483 days off; gelded.

runners.name: Frank Pickle
runners.comment: Son of Free Eagle; dam 9.7f winner (RPR 84); gelded; unlikely to be a factor on debut
runners.spotlight: Son of Free Eagle; dam 9.7f winner (RPR 84), half-sister to 7f-10.6f winner Settle For Red; gelded; unlikely to be a factor on belated debut.

runners.name: Majestic King
runners.comment: Kingman gelding; 320,000eur yearling but 3,000gns 3yo; well bred but best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Kingman gelding; cost 320,000euros as a yearling but bought for 3,000gns as a three-year-old from Godolphin; half-brother to seven winners including Carla Bianca (1m1f-1m2f including Group 3; RPR 108), True Solitaire (7f 2yo; 108) and Joailliere (7f including Listed; 104); dam unraced half-sister to 1m4f-1m6f Group 3 winner; probably best watched on belated debut provided the market doesn't say otherwise.

runners.name: Ozark Daze
runners.comment: Knocking on door on AW at end of last year; didn't get involved from rear on return
runners.spotlight: Was knocking on the door at Dundalk towards the end of last season and placed on his first three turf starts of last season; didn't get involved from rear at Leopardstown on return but should be fitter now; hood now tried; record of 0-12 is a concern.

runners.name: Anjaaline
runners.comment: Anjaal filly; mix of speed and stamina in pedigree; best watched making debut at 4 though
runners.spotlight: Anjaal filly; closely related to Qatari 6f winner Treasure Cay, half-sister to four winners including The Right Choice (6f-7.5f including AW/France/Belgium; RPR 79) and Clenymistra (1m2f-1m4f; 71); dam 1m winner (72), half-sister to 1m 2yo Group 3 winner; mix of speed and stamina in pedigree; concern we haven't seen her before now.

runners.name: Elana Osario
runners.comment: Improving towards end of last term; tuned up after 3rd on AW over insufficient mile
runners.spotlight: Improved with every start towards the end of last term and tuned up after creditable third on AW return over insufficient mile; will relish the step back up in trip and looks like a major player with Keane taking over.

runners.name: Light Up The Dark
runners.comment: Unbeaten in 2 bumper starts and may have pace for drop in trip; interesting on Flat bow
runners.spotlight: Wide margin bumper winner at Naas (2m, heavy) on debut in January and made it 2-2 in a Listed bumper at Limerick in March; pedigree suggests the drop in trip may be okay and interesting recruit to the Flat; one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Navy Waters
runners.comment: Plenty to like about debut when beaten half a length; should relish step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Plenty to like about her debut when only beaten half a length despite meeting interference; shaped like she would relish the step up in trip and one to consider.

runners.name: Radar Ahead
runners.comment: Showed ability on Flat last term but this trip may be too sharp on this ground
runners.spotlight: Struggling over timber recently but showed ability on the Flat last season including a second at this venue over further; however, this trip may be too sharp on this sort of ground.

runners.name: Spring Dance
runners.comment: Subsequent winner behind when beaten 1l on debut; big player but stall 12 is tough
runners.spotlight: Had a subsequent winner just behind when third beaten 1l on debut at Gowran last month; ought to be a big player if she takes a step forward from the run but the widest draw isn't ideal.

runners.name: Academe
runners.comment: Shown little in 3 runs at big odds in maidens; well held at 50s on Wednesday's h'cap bow
runners.spotlight: Showed very little in three runs at big odds in maidens and was 50-1 for her handicap debut at Gowran on Wednesday when a well held 11th of 15 wearing first-time cheekpieces (retained); probably best watched if turned out again quickly.

runners.name: Wasittheway
runners.comment: Left first 2 runs behind with 66-1 4th in Gowran claimer; more to come up in trip
runners.spotlight: Left his first two runs behind when a 66-1 fourth in a Gowran claimer last month; potentially more to come up in trip on handicap debut with stamina on the dam's side of his pedigree.

runners.name: Bungle Lichious
runners.comment: Shown nothing in 3 maidens at huge odds; may do better h'capping up in trip now; blinkers
runners.spotlight: Shown nothing in trio of maidens so far at triple figure odds; should do better now handicapping up in trip; first-time blinkers on.

runners.name: Movin And Groovin

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Mrs Theresa Marnane

runners.comment: More experience than her rivals; 6f AW winners; possibly didn't stay this trip latest
runners.spotlight: More experienced than her rivals and won over 6f at Dundalk over the winter; possibly didn't stay over a similar trip to this at Tipperary latest though.

runners.name: Highway Sixty One
runners.comment: Modest so far; slowly away on h'cap debut latest and won't want to get behind here
runners.spotlight: Modest efforts so far and was slowly away on handicap debut last month when beaten 6l; won't want to get behind at this venue on decent ground; wears first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Coulstys Way
runners.comment: Promising h'cap bow; bounced back from lesser run when placed latest; may come on for that
runners.spotlight: Promising handicap debut last season and bounced back from a lesser effort when third (beaten roughly 3l) at Tipperary last month; had a few of these in behind and entitled to come on for that first run in six months.

runners.name: Let Her Cook
runners.comment: Struggled in maidens and didn't many on h'cap bow when up to this sort of trip; wide draw
runners.spotlight: Struggled in a trio of maidens and didn't beat many when stepped up in trip on handicap bow last month when 100-1; widest draw here won't help.

runners.name: Curroy Lady
runners.comment: Shown very little in a trio of maidens so far but further should suit now h'capping
runners.spotlight: Shown very little in a trio of maidens so far but further should suit now handicapping and sire's progeny get better with age.

runners.name: Vovatia
runners.comment: Modest form so far inc' in 3 h'caps and behind a few of these at Tipperary latest
runners.spotlight: Modest form so far including in three handicaps and was behind a few of these at Tipperary last time; would need a significant career best to reverse the form.

runners.name: Rushes To Riches
