runners.comment: Struggled in AW maidens and no improvement in handicaps, inc' when switched to turf latest
runners.spotlight: Struggled in AW maidens and no improvement in handicaps, including when switched to turf latest.

runners.name: Molto Amichi
runners.comment: Some promising form in maidens and shaped like he wanted step back up in trip latest
runners.spotlight: Some promising efforts in maidens including when runner-up on heavy ground at Leopardstown in October and bounced back from a lesser run when a close up fourth at Dundalk in December having met some interference; looks like a big player on handicap debut from a workable mark.

runners.name: Sylkie
runners.comment: Won 3 of first 6 for this yard last term; tailed off on return and may want it slower
runners.spotlight: Won three of her first six starts for this yard last season; tailed off on reappearance and suspicion she wants slower ground than this but can't be ruled out if she leaves her return run behind.

runners.name: Expound
runners.comment: C&D winner; returned with cracking front-running effort; latest run forgiven; has stall 1
runners.spotlight: C&D maiden winner; returned with a cracking front-running effort under this rider at Leopardstown and may have found his subsequent effort coming too soon; big player from stall one.

quotes.quote: Expound has plenty of ability and it's good the way he can mix it between both [codes]. When he won his [Flat] maiden he made the running and Denis [Hogan, trainer] said to keep it simple, he likes to make the running and let the horses try and catch him. He was very good from the front, jumped really well and travelled and when they came to him he picked up and done it nicely in the end - Daniel King, jockey, speaking to RTV.

runners.name: Bright N Shine
runners.comment: 1m2.5f Down Royal last term and ran well in defeat from revised mark; trip may be sharp
runners.spotlight: Down Royal winner over a bit further last season and ran well in defeat from revised mark on the Flat since; didn't show much over timber when last seen and this trip is probably his bare minimum.

runners.name: Eighty Eight
runners.comment: Won over this trip in 2022, first win since on AW in Dec; h'capper may have caught up
runners.spotlight: Won over this trip at Gowran in 2022 and gained his first win since on AW in December but signs the handicapper has caught up since.

runners.name: The Real Screamer
runners.comment: Won twice on AW towards end of last term; creditable 3rd on return; may want a bit further
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back over a furlong further on the AW towards the end of last season; stayed on for a distant third of 19 in a Navan handicap last month on return; unproven on quicker ground and may want a bit further than this.

runners.name: Church Mountain
runners.comment: 7th career success latest and quicker ground fine but 8lb rise may find him out
runners.spotlight: Gained a seventh career success (5-41 on turf) on soft ground at Limerick a fortnight ago; quicker ground over a bit further won't be an issue but needs his best effort for some time to defy an 8lb higher mark.

quotes.race: William Hill Lengthen Your Odds Handicap
quotes.quote: Church Mountain has taken a while to come around to our way of thinking but we got him started at Leopardstown a couple of weeks ago and ran a lovely race. It gave us confidence to drop him in because he's won his other races for Denis Hogan making it. He looked like he won snug enough at the line so hopefully he'll be able to go to Galway and be competitive - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

You'd call stall 18 a bad draw usually, but not with Church Mountain because he doesn't like traffic around him. If he's drawn low and misses the break, it can be hard for him to get going, but Dan is super value for his 7lb claim off those weights. This horse has won twice at Galway and hopefully will go back there. Even though he's a big horse, he seems to like good ground - Denis Hogan, trainer
Church Mountain picked up well and did everything for me today. I'd say he's going to make a lovely dual purpose horse, he won't be a horse until next year - Joey Sheridan, jockey.

Church Mountain is one we always liked, but he's a massive horse and still not the finished article. He was green in front but he needed to be there because he is a 1m2f horse. Making the running was the making of him - Denis Hogan, trainer.

runners.name: Mooretown Lad
runners.comment: Shown nothing over timber for this yard but sole win on Flat came under similar conditions
runners.spotlight: Shown nothing over hurdles for this yard but sole success on the Flat for Michael O'Callaghan came over 1m1f on good ground from this handicap mark; hard to put a line through with a handy draw.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Lengthen The Odds Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Mooretown Lad is a work in progress. He is a brother to I Am Superman but he is a slow learner and more like his half-brother Fastnet Crown. He has taken time and he will be a better horse next year - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

runners.name: Pearl Of Australia
runners.owner: Tony Carey & Martin W Walsh & Conor Brett
runners.comment: Ran out over timber when last seen; didn't threaten in 3 Flat runs last year; new yard
runners.spotlight: Ran out over timber when last seen and didn't threaten in three runs on the Flat last year; new yard and probably best watched after six months off.

runners.name: Daddy Long Legs
runners.comment: Very smart hurdler returns to flat with Keane booked; likely the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Touched off on sole Flat run (1m4f, soft) in France at three and has developed into very smart hurdler for current connections, four wins including last year at Punchestown festival and Tipperary Grade 3; showed current well being when second in recent valuable Plumpton handicap on good ground; very interesting returning to Flat here with Keane booked.

quotes.quote: Daddy Long Legs being back to a flat track and quick ground suited him. He's in graded territory now. I don't know if he's good enough for those good Grade 1s but that's the sea he is swimming in now - David Casey, assistant trainer.

Daddy Long Legs wasn't up to soft ground in the winter and looks in a different league on this ground. He is a good horse I think. With the pace he showed he could easily go back on the Flat - Willie Mullins, trainer

His last two runs, Daddy Long Legs just struggled on the really heavy ground. He'll be one to go through the summer and could be a high-class Flat handicapper. He possibly could be a Galway Hurdle horse - Patrick Mullins, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.
Daddy Long Legs is smart, he quickened well. He had been working well, he felt a natural from the first time I schooled him. He won as we hoped he won - Paul Townend, rider

stable_tour.quote: He's been busy this year and was fifth in the Morgiana on Saturday. We'll see how he comes out of that before making a plan for him. 25-11-24

runners.name: Extrapolation
runners.comment: Jumper likes it around here but will do well to feature on only second Flat outing
runners.spotlight: Does well at this track, having won maiden hurdle, landed a beginners chase on this card last year and last month finished a decent second in 2m1f handicap hurdle; earlier same month never counted after slow start in Gowran Flat maiden; will do well to feature.

quotes.quote: Coming here today it looked a hot beginners', but then the favourite came out. I still thought it would be tough task against a 137-rated chaser in Mighty Tom, but Extrapolation loves good ground like that and it's terrific to get the win - Richard O'Brien, trainer.
Extrapolation grasped a nice opportunity here and he did it well. He moved up into it well and he ran on nicely - Danny Mullins, rider

I thought Extrapolation had run two very good races on testing ground and this was lesser opposition. He did it well and could go for a Flat race, maybe the amateurs' race in Galway. He won't go on very deep winter ground - Richard O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: The Tiger Man
runners.comment: 4yo tongue-tied for belated debut, seems best watched
runners.spotlight: Calyx half-brother to winners Mushtaq (6f-1m inc 2yo AW/Bahrain; RPR 94) and Ponte De Ruda (Spanish 7f 2yo/1m); dam unraced sister to French 1m/1m1f winner Spirit Danon; tongue-tied for belated debut, seems best watched.

runners.name: Carmers
runners.comment: Well-related Wootton Bassett colt; blinkered for belated debut and greatly respected
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett colt is third foal of a 1m-1m2f winner (inc AW; RPR 88), a half-sister to Group 1 winners Lord Shanakill (1m), Forever Together (1m4f) and Together Forever (1m 2yo); blinkered for belated debut and has to be greatly respected from this yard.

runners.name: Crooked Path
runners.comment: Promise in Tipperary maiden over this trip latest; cheekpieces added but this no easier
runners.spotlight: Solid efforts in three maidens this spring, most recently over this trip at Tipperary, staying on; cheekpieces now added but this no easier.

runners.name: God The Highness
runners.comment: Slow to break and took a keen hold when last of 11 on Navan debut; hood now fitted
runners.spotlight: Slow to break and took a keen hold when last of 11 on Navan debut last month; hood now fitted.

runners.name: Kilmeaden
runners.comment: Cork debut promise last month; cheekpieces fitted and upped in trip so potential improver
runners.spotlight: Closely related to 1m/8.7f AW winner More Than A Feelin (RPR 82); dam unraced half-sister to 6f Group 3 winner Lightning Moon; easy to back, definite debut promise last month when staying on third in Cork maiden over 1m2f; cheekpieces now fitted and upped in trip so potential improver.

runners.name: No Mo Cash
runners.comment: Looked a suspect stayer over this trip at Tipperary when nearly 5l behind Crooked Path
runners.spotlight: Something to take from both maiden runs although looked a suspect stayer over this trip at Tipperary last time when nearly 5l behind Crooked Path; cheekpieces tried and better ground could suit but others preferred.

runners.name: Tashir
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Soft may not have suited at Cork; better ground and longer trip could see him feature here
runners.spotlight: Ran a blinder on only start last season when splitting two market principals in 7f Gowran maiden on good; soft ground may have been his undoing on last month's Cork comeback run but return to good ground and step up in trip could well see him in a different light.

runners.name: Matrice
runners.comment: Recent Limerick second over this trip; hood fitted and back on better ground; chance
runners.spotlight: Frankel filly shaped well in Dundalk fillies' maiden last autumn and again on seasonal return in recent Limerick fillies maiden over this trip, rallying well in testing conditions when second (having hung left); hood now fitted and back on better ground; definite chance.

runners.name: Nostra Casa
runners.comment: Shaped like he needed return; not sure to be suited by drop in trip here; career high mark
runners.spotlight: Shaped like he needed last month's return but not sure to be suited by this sort of trip on decent ground and remains on a career high mark.

quotes.quote: Nostra Casa doesn't like being boxed in and obviously with the draw it was hard to get out. He probably likes a bit heavier ground. We will try and get into Galway this year, we missed the cut last year - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Ehteyat
runners.comment: Progressive in 2023 but off nearly 2 years and best watched for new yard
runners.spotlight: Progressive for George Boughey in 2023 but has been off nearly two years and can only be watched on debut for new yard.

runners.name: Teed Up
runners.comment: Best form has come on softer ground and he struggled last season; off 200 days
runners.spotlight: Best Flat form has come on softer ground than what he'll get here and he struggled last season; off 200 days.

quotes.quote: Teed Up just seems to grow another leg when he meets the rising ground around here. They went a good gallop and Conor was good and cool on him. He'll get a little holiday now - Emmet Mullins, trainer.

The trip was a slight concern but Ray gave Teed Up a fantastic ride. He slotted in and had the pace to travel, and he handled the ground, which is a great advantage today. It was a funny race as I think the early pace collapsed coming down into the dip, but he showed guts to tough it out on his own. He was a bit wayward but he kept his head down - Emmet Mullins, trainer.
Teed Up is a horse that loves this track. He was a bit lairy in front but he loves that hill. He might mix it with the Flat - Emmet Mullins, trainer.

He's a horse on the up the whole time. We were positioned in mid-division and he was on and off the bridle a little, he ran in snatches a bit but I think that was due to the ground more than anything. To be fair to him, when I picked him up in the dip he kept finding for pressure. He's won cosily, I put my whip down in the last 100yds and he was pulling up a little late on. The ground is very testing - Billy Lee, rider of Teed Up

runners.name: Gangster Granny
runners.comment: Limerick maiden winner last summer; back to form 2nd latest and only up 1lb; big player
runners.spotlight: Limerick maiden winner last summer over similar trip and back to form when runner-up to Molly Hall at Gowran last month; only up 1lb and won't mind the quicker ground; player.

runners.name: Migdam

prev_owners.owner: Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley
Dooley T'breds & Shamrock T'breds & B T O'Sullivan
Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley
Dooley T'breds & Shamrock T'breds & B T O'Sullivan
Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley

runners.comment: Encouraging return to turf in March; lesser efforts twice since; stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Encouraging run back on turf at Leopardstown in March but hasn't built on that twice since; needs to prove he's as effective back at this sort of trip; can race prominently so stall one helps at least.

runners.name: Molly Hall
runners.owner: P R Dowling & Ms L R Dowling
runners.comment: Has won 3 of her 6 starts for this yard; beat Gangster Granny latest; front-runner
runners.spotlight: Has won three of her six starts since joining this yard including when getting the better of Gangster Granny on her return at Gowran; shorter trip shouldn't be an issue for this front-runner and may get an uncontested lead in this field.

runners.name: Solar Drive
runners.comment: In good form last summer; not seen since Fred Winter but not ruled out with more to come
runners.spotlight: Was in good form on the Flat last summer including a win at Cork when last seen on the level; off since down the field run in the Fred Winter but not ruled out despite career high Flat mark with more to come on the level.

quotes.quote: Solar Drive did it well and jumps hurdles as well. There's a 1m4f handicap at the Galway festival so hopefully he can get into that - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Duke Of Leggagh
runners.comment: Below his best back on Flat recently; trip too short latest but may want slower ground
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back over timber this winter but below his best in trio of runs back on the Flat; trip too short latest but probably wants slower ground than this and has stall 11 to contend with.

quotes.race: William Hill Keep Your Raceday Positive Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was ideal conditions for Duke Of Leggagh. He jumped a lot better today. I knew he had improved from the last day, but I didn't think he had improved that much. We'll probably go back to the Flat with him now and he really does like that ground - Mick Mulvany, trainer.
Duke Of Leggagh ran well last day and on his Flat form he was entitled to win that. Guts won it for him. We'll mix it between this and the Flat but he wants ground like that - Mick Mulvany, trainer

Duke Of Leggagh had to win today, trying to win going up 12lb was going to be hard, but he's a lovely horse in the making. It took a while for the penny to drop last year, but it did on his last run at Galway and he is improving all the time. Gary said he had a bit left - Mick Mulvany, trainer

runners.name: Tuba
runners.comment: Promising maiden form but has struggled in handicaps so far this season; bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Promising maiden form but has struggled in handicaps so far this season; bit to prove at present; back up in trip.

runners.name: Keilah
runners.comment: Off the mark in September before narrow defeat; career high mark for return
runners.spotlight: Off the mark on the Flat at Punchestown last September before a narrow defeat at Navan but only fifth from career high mark on Flat when last seen and may need this; drawn wide.

quotes.race: William Hill Proper Betting Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Keilah was just nabbed on the line in Navan. She tries every time. I thought Nathan gave her a lovely ride there, a very patient ride. She quickened up and put it to bed quick - Willie McCreery, trainer.

runners.name: Desert Friend
runners.comment: C&D winner from 1lb lower last term; not at best this season but quicker ground may help
runners.spotlight: C&D winner last season from 1lb lower; hasn't been at his best this term but return to quicker ground should help.

quotes.race: John B. Keane (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Desert Friend likes it around here. There wasn't much pace on, I was happy enough. He travelled and he jumped well, and he done it really well in the end. We didn't go much of a gallop which suited him down to the ground and he galloped all the way up the straight - Donagh Meyler, jockey.

runners.name: Captain P
runners.comment: Point' winner hasn't counted yet in maiden hurdles; more one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Won a point-to-point at Tyrella in January (good-to-yielding) but hasn't counted in two maiden hurdles; perhaps more one for handicaps in due course.

runners.name: Firstupbestdressed
runners.comment: Always behind on Fairyhouse debut last month when a 150-1 shot; can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Always behind on Fairyhouse debut last month when a 150-1 shot; can only be watched.

runners.name: Fool Me Once
runners.comment: Place claims on recent handicap efforts but longer trip a concern
runners.spotlight: Some maiden promise and latest two 2m2f handicap runs on better ground his best yet, chasing home a clear winner here and at Kilbeggan didn't appear to quite get home when fourth of 14; place claims back in maiden company but not sure this step up in trip is what he wants.

runners.name: Game On
runners.comment: C&D third on similar ground last time makes him a major player
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point second (for Warren Ewing) and has appreciated return to better ground on both recent maiden hurdle runs, chasing home a 7l winner at Thurles and over C&D in late March when made much of running in finishing third to an odds-on shot in a much stronger race; ground remains in his favour, big player.

runners.name: Mister Frostie
runners.comment: Place prospects on best form but unproven on ground this quick
runners.spotlight: Bumper form modest but some promise on second attempt hurdling in 2m6f Navan maiden in March on heavy; not too far off that form at Fairyhouse latest but more needed and quicker ground an unknown.

runners.name: Penny Express
runners.comment: Creditable enough debut in 2m Tramore maiden last month, more expected now upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Creditable enough debut in 2m Tramore maiden last month, more expected now upped to a more suitable trip.

runners.name: Aisling Rose
runners.comment: Well held both starts at Down Royal; cheekpieces tried now
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in Down Royal bumper in March and again there following month in 2m4f maiden hurdle; cheekpieces now fitted.

runners.name: Lets Do This Buddy
runners.comment: Chased home a 25l winner at Down Royal; much more required here though
runners.spotlight: Improvement on second maiden run within eight days in April when chasing home a 25l winner over 2m4f at Down Royal; much more required here though.

runners.name: Shake The Bag
runners.comment: Well beaten in bumpers and on hurdles debut at Clonmel; likely to need more time
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three bumpers and didn't count on hurdles debut at Clonmel; likely to need more time.

runners.name: Our Zebo
runners.comment: Much improved of late on better ground; 12lb higher but remains in this grade so respected
runners.spotlight: Fitting of blinkers (replacing cheekpieces) and better ground has brought about an upturn in form of late in handicaps over this trip, second to a clear winner here and ran away with 11-runner Tramore contest (beating Mother Ship 11l); up 12lb for that win but remains in this grade and greatly respected given the form he's in.

runners.name: Shell Be Kept
runners.comment: Maiden form gives her claims if handling quicker ground on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Chased home a clear all-the-way winner in 2m5f Limerick claiming hurdle in January (heavy) on final start for Sean Allen and not far off that level on latest when beaten 15l in stronger 2m3f Cork mares maiden last month; upped slightly in trip for handicap debut, yet to race on ground this quick.

runners.name: Butchers Bill
runners.comment: Didn't quite see out 3m at Naas last time so this slight drop in trip could suit
runners.spotlight: Brother to Romeo Coolio and half-brother to recent Punchestown festival winner Ascending Lark isn't anywhere near their level but respected in this grade; didn't quite see out 3m at Naas last time so this slight drop in trip could suit.

runners.name: Chefs Kiss
runners.comment: Limerick third likes this ground; not a definite stayer, definite player if doing so
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner on heavy; ran well in a good ground bumper here a year ago and best run yet over hurdles when back on similar ground at Limerick last month (well-backed favourite) in 2m3f handicap when third; not certain to stay this longer trip but definite claims if doing so.

runners.name: Sights Unseen
runners.comment: Good winter form at 2m; likely improver for this step up in trip and handles ground
runners.spotlight: Twice runner-up in point-to-points on decent ground and two good runs on returning to track for current yard in 2m handicap hurdles over the winter at Down Royal and Clonmel; every chance she'll improve for this step up in trip and seems to handle this ground.

runners.name: Technology
runners.comment: Cheekpieces added and needs to return to last summer's Wexford form
runners.spotlight: Pick of form for current yard when runner-up in 2m5f Wexford handicap last summer on decent ground; recent runs below that level however and cheekpieces now added.

stable_tour.quote: He wasn't a natural when we schooled him over fences so he went to Marcus Foley for some intensive work and jumped well. He's another for handicap chases, probably over 2m4f-plus. 10-11-23

runners.name: Go Avel
runners.owner: A G Beatty & P Mcbride & Mrs Peter Casey & Mrs Paula Casey
runners.comment: Entitled to come on for recent comeback run, big step up in trip here
runners.spotlight: Never sighted on recent handicap debut at Kilbeggan after a break; entitled to come on for it and big step up in trip here.

runners.name: Mother Ship
runners.comment: Tramore second to Our Zebo; big turn around in weights now and yard in fine form
runners.spotlight: Mare's best run came on return from 177-day break when coming off pace to chase home easy 11l winner Our Zebo under lady amateur rider over this trip at Tramore last month, having taken a wide course; 12lb better off with that rival here with rider's additional 7lb claim and yard in fine form at Down Royal on Monday.

runners.name: Bishbashbosh
runners.comment: Best form over shorter; begins second stint with yard, well beaten previous C&D run
runners.spotlight: Ran well in handicaps at shorter trips over the winter for Ross O'Sullivan, notably Punchestown second, tame enough effort last time at Carlisle; begins second stint with current yard here, well beaten previous C&D attempt.

runners.name: Earlofbrackenstown
runners.comment: Not much to take from light campaign with Gavin Cromwell over 2m; big step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Not much to take from light campaign with Gavin Cromwell over 2m; big step up in trip for new yard and probably best watched after 15 month's absence.

runners.name: Sallap
runners.comment: Nothing in maidens over shorter; potential improver upped in trip for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Nothing to take from bumper run and three attempts hurdling over shorter trips; step up in trip could suit for handicap debut and worth a market watch.

runners.name: Im For Home
runners.comment: Best form on heavy, legitimate ground concerns here
runners.spotlight: Second over 2m3f at Limerick last season (heavy) and ran well on similar at Punchestown over the winter; well held on quicker ground (2m2f) here latest however so ground concerns remain.

runners.name: Getaway Erin
runners.comment: Absent since pulled up over C&D in October, final start for Shark Hanlon; best watched
runners.spotlight: Formerly with Shark Hanlon, including well held in handicaps, final occasion pulled up over C&D in October; can only be watched on yard debut.

5:57.race_name: SIS, Supporting Irish Racing Maiden Hurdle

runners.name: Jazz De Cotte
runners.comment: Recent Naas second sure to appreciate this longer trip; respected
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point second won Ayr winners' bumper last season (soft) and much the better of two maiden hurdle runs (coughing first occasion) this term on latest when staying on to chase home an easy winner over 2m at Naas last month and deprive Youlita of second late on; seems sure to relish this longer trip and one to consider but carries bumper penalty here.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at the Scottish Grand National meeting at Ayr. He's got a lot stronger since then, too, and he's one we're looking forward to sending over hurdles. 28-10-24

runners.name: Dramatic License
runners.comment: Bumper form on similar ground makes him a contender on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to winners Top Dog (Listed bumper) and Ben Solo (point); dam useful 2m hurdler, closely related to top-class 2m jumper Altior; sound runs in good-ground bumpers last summer, at Roscommon and when hampered by winner throughout straight here over 2m3f (third won subsequently); comeback run at Newcastle in February on easier ground not nearly as good (hung left) but has to be respected on hurdles debut with ground to suit.

runners.name: Killians Garden
runners.comment: Staying-on Ballinrobe fourth augurs well and handles the ground
runners.spotlight: Showed nice bit of improvement at Ballinrobe last month, staying on strongly into fourth in a decent 2m1f maiden for the venue (good); stiffer test here will suit and could well play a role.

runners.name: Youlita
runners.comment: Naas third a step in right direction but nearly 3l to find with 2nd-placed Jazz De Cote
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner and placed in Fairyhouse bumper (good) for Paul Cashman; Naas maiden hurdle third represented an improvement on debut run for this yard but has nearly 3l to find with second-placed Jazz De Cote on that run but 8lb better off so has his chance.

runners.name: Coolboy Christy
runners.comment: Twice-raced pointer; a surprise if 4yo made an immediate impression over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Feel Like Dancing 4yo showed a little on second point-to-point run but would be a surprise if 4yo made an immediate impression over hurdles.

runners.name: Sea Of Doubt
runners.comment: Clear with winner at Tramore last time; definite player but may need to improve again
runners.spotlight: Decent efforts in two of four bumper starts and improved from her hurdles debut to be beaten only 1l at Tramore last time (25l clear of remainder); definite player but may need to improve again.

runners.name: Ladys Choice
runners.comment: Fell in both point-to-points and two maiden hurdle runs leave her with lots to find
runners.spotlight: Affinisea filly fell in both point-to-points and two maiden hurdle runs leave her with lots to find.

6:32.race_name: Download the Tote App Mares Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Rockview Consort
runners.comment: Dual-purpose winner has been regressive on the Flat lately; first hurdle run in a while
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose winner has been regressive on the Flat lately; first hurdle run since she ran respectably in a Listed novice in December 2023.

quotes.quote: Rockview Consort  jumped well. John (McConnell) does a good job schooling his horses at home, he doesn't like to miss with these nice ones first-time out. I kept it simple, it was a nice even gallop and you can do that around here on good ground. It was a pretty good performance and she's one we'll look forward to - Ben Harvey, jockey, talking to Racing TV
Rockview Consort probably wants further but we said we would have another crack at this trip. It is great to get the win and she will go on turf as well - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She took a while to win her maiden but did so nicely at Dundalk last time over 1m2½f. She has a 3lb higher rating on the turf and, having given her a break after that success, she'll be brought back for 1m4f handicaps on the grass. She also jumps well and is a possible for some hurdling this summer. 06-04-23

runners.name: Billie Frechette
runners.comment: In good form on Flat recently and has run well in three maiden hurdles; a major player
runners.spotlight: In good form on Flat recently, winning on AW and a solid fourth at Navan; has run well in defeat in three maiden hurdles; looks a major player on handicap debut.

runners.name: Queenofthelodge
runners.comment: Runner-up in three handicaps including on comeback; needs to eke out a bit more
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in three handicaps including on comeback at Clonmel; however, is also creeping up the handicap so needs to eke out a bit more.

runners.name: Keep It Cool
runners.comment: Has shown some ability in bumpers and three maiden hurdles; can do better now in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Has shown some ability without winning in bumpers and three maiden hurdles; can do better now in handicaps but lacks a recent run.

runners.name: Letters To Juliet
runners.comment: Got off the mark when winning nicely at Bellewstown; up 5lb but go well with a repeat
runners.spotlight: Has had jumping issues but put them to one side when getting off the mark nicely at Bellewstown last time; up 5lb but can go well with a repeat.

runners.name: Gortmore Lady
runners.comment: Beaten 50l on stable/handicap debut recently and enormous improvement required
runners.spotlight: Showed a glimpse of ability in three maidens last year; however, was beaten 50l on stable/handicap debut recently and enormous improvement required.

runners.name: Doyen Magic
runners.comment: Regressive in handicaps last season and has to get back to best on debut for a new yard
runners.spotlight: Point winner but was regressive in handicaps last season and has to get back to best on debut for a new yard.

runners.name: Tasmanian Girl
runners.comment: Surprise winner of a Thurles handicap last time; has a chance if repeating that up 7lb
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose mare was a surprise winner of a 2m Thurles handicap last time, her first win; has a chance if repeating that up 7lb.

runners.name: Miss Gitana
runners.comment: Third at Down Royal last hurdle run; not a bad Flat effort recently; needs to do more
runners.spotlight: Was third at Down Royal last hurdle run/handicap debut, beaten 13l ; not a bad Flat effort recently; needs to do more but considered.

runners.name: Chartwells Lady
runners.breeder: Mrs A Cantillon & Mrs E McStay
runners.comment: Has been poor in two handicaps lately and isn't easy to fancy
runners.spotlight: Maiden has been poor in two handicap hurdles plus on the Flat lately and isn't easy to fancy.

runners.name: Fire Coral
runners.comment: Maiden has run well over C&D but has to do more from 4lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Maiden has run well over C&D in the past but has to do more from 4lb out of the handicap; good claimer helps; cheekpieces tried.

runners.name: Person Of Interest
runners.owner: Anthony N Durkan & B M Durkan
runners.comment: Not a bad hurdle effort last time; tongue-tie added and considered on chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a point and maiden hurdle last year; didn't match that in handicaps since but not a bad effort at Clonmel last time; tongue-tie added and considered on chasing debut.

runners.name: Dees Getaway
runners.comment: Not at best in two beginners' chases; can do better in this grade with a tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: Tramore maiden hurdle winner last autumn hasn't been near that level three times since, including two beginners' chase starts; has to jump better but can do better in this grade with a tongue-tie on.

runners.name: Calahill
runners.comment: Won over C&D last August but was below form at Tramore next time; needs to be ready
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark when winning over C&D last August but was below form at Tramore next time; needs to be ready after a long absence.

runners.name: Party Pack
runners.comment: Poor on last two completed hurdle starts; needs to do much better on chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Has been poor on last two completed hurdle starts; yard does well with chasers but needs to do much better on debut in this sphere.

runners.name: La Tulipe Noire

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Magette Meagher & Thomas P Meagher

runners.comment: Poor in six hurdle starts and needs to do much better on chasing debut
runners.spotlight: A 2yo maiden winner but was regressive in that sphere; has been poor in six hurdle starts and needs to do much better on chasing debut.

quotes.quote: La Tulipe Noire jumped okay, there wasn't much pace on and I was able to dictate. The blinkers helped her. She was tough and always doing enough, Declan McDonogh, rider.

runners.name: Roman Parish
runners.comment: Maiden needs to improve a fair bit from his return at Tramore
runners.spotlight: Has yet to score after 31 starts between hurdles and fences but has run well at times; needs to improve a fair bit from his return at Tramore.

runners.name: Jollie Cosmos
runners.comment: Third over hurdles off this mark at Kilbeggan last time; has to reproduce that chasing
runners.spotlight: Maiden in points and under rules but did run well when third over hurdles off this mark at Kilbeggan last time; has to reproduce that back to chasing.

runners.name: Well Loved
runners.comment: Fourth over this trip at Wexford in March but was below that form there next time
runners.spotlight: Won maiden point in February and was fourth over this trip at Wexford in March but was below that form there next time; down 2lb but needs more.

runners.name: Robin De Roost
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner lost his form last autumn and needs to be ready on stable/seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Two of his four chase wins have come over C&D; lost his form last autumn and veteran needs to be ready on stable/seasonal debut.

quotes.race: Download The New Tote App Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: This is just amazing. I rode Robin De Roost last year but the ground was never right - he needs good, good to firm.  They didn't go overly quick, which suited him, as he needs to be up there or he loses interest. Thomas [Gibney, trainer] had him spot on - Aileen O'Sullivan, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Michael Moore Mercedes-Benz & Volkswagen, Portarlington & Athlone Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: He battled really well, which he showed last time too, and we weren't sure about his battling qualities before that. He was under pressure a long way out and I wasn't too confident coming down to the last bend. We'll keep tipping away and look for something similar again. I'd say he'll get further than that again - Tom Gibney, trainer

quotes.race: Download And Bet With The Ladbrokes App Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Robin De Roost gave me a nice feel for a long way at Fairyhouse and I managed to get him out in front here, and he jumped and travelled beautifully. The stable is in much better form now and it makes the world of difference - Jonathan Moore, jockey.

runners.name: Tankardstown Diva
runners.comment: The best of four chase runs was when fourth on heavy ground at Punchestown; handles good
runners.spotlight: Best recent run came when third over hurdles at Bellewstown; the best of four chase runs was when fourth on heavy ground at Punchestown; handles good ground but ran poorly over hurdles last time.

quotes.quote: I was a bit worried about stepping up in trip with Tankardstown Diva as she can be hard on herself but she's learning - Ian Donoghue, trainer.

runners.name: General Hubble
runners.breeder: K H Allisat & H J Ames
runners.comment: Not as good off this mark when last seen but can be a player if ready after a break
runners.spotlight: Has improved since joining this yard, winning handicap chases at Fairyhouse and Punchestown over the winter; not as good off this mark when last seen but can be a player if ready after a break.

quotes.race: Lorna Brooke Ireland V Britain (Q.R.) Challenge Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: General Hubble had a good run last week and won with a bit in hand here. There's a ladies' race back here in a couple of weeks and he might go for that - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.name: Robyndeglory
runners.comment: Five hurdle wins; has run well in defeat at times in five chase starts; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Five-time hurdle winner ran well in that sphere last time at Cork; has run well in defeat at times in five chase starts; one to consider.

runners.name: Riggs
runners.owner: Paul M Butler & James Patrick Byrne
runners.comment: Solid fourth over 3m2f at Down Royal; won't be far away with a repeat down 2lb
runners.spotlight: Has a record of 1-25 over hurdles and 0-7 over fences with latest effort a solid fourth over 3m2f at Down Royal; won't be far away with a repeat down 2lb.

stable_tour.quote: He ran nicely at Aintree and for quite a while I've had the £100,000 long-distance hurdle in mind for him at Haydock on Saturday. The time has come to go up in trip to 3m. He was second in the EBF Final at Sandown last season and that's always a good race. 16-11-21

runners.name: Jimlis Cave
runners.comment: Course winner over hurdles; poor twice since; will have to jump well on chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over hurdles (2m6f) at this track last year; poor twice since including on comeback run back here; will have to jump well on chasing debut.

runners.name: Game And Glory
runners.comment: Has run well in defeat several times over fences including here; pulled-up last twice
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner is yet to score over fences but has run well in defeat several times including at this track; pulled-up last twice, though.

runners.name: College Causeway
runners.comment: Ran a fine race over 3m2f at Down Royal last time; cheekpieces may help him travel better
runners.spotlight: Maiden ran a fine race over 3m2f at Down Royal last time though came under pressure early; needs to travel a bit better over this trip but cheekpieces could help.

runners.name: Hit The Frame
runners.comment: Poor over hurdles; yard does well with chasers, though, and cheekpieces are added
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in points but has been poor over hurdles; yard does well with chasers, though, and cheekpieces are added; needs major improvement.

runners.name: Cullenwaine
runners.comment: Course hurdle winner has been poor the last twice and has to rebound
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner at this track last year added a chase win at Thurles over the winter; however, has been poor the last twice and has to rebound.

runners.name: Rust To Riches
runners.comment: Third over 3m2f at Down Royal; this shorter trip might suit better
runners.spotlight: Point winner is a maiden under rules but ran his best race for some time when third over 3m2f at Down Royal; shorter trip might suit better.

runners.name: Greenway Machine
runners.comment: Beaten a long way on return at Tramore; can be competitive off this mark if back to form
runners.spotlight: Two wins over fences includes over C&D; beaten a long way on return at Tramore but can be competitive off this mark if back to form.

8:17.race_name: Joe Rea Memorial Mares INH Flat Race

runners.name: Bearami Creek
runners.comment: Beaten 4l in a Ballinrobe maiden hurdle last time; a player if as effective in a bumper
runners.spotlight: Failed to get around in two of her point starts and well beaten in the other; however, she was much-improved when third, beaten 4l in a Ballinrobe maiden hurdle last time; can be a player if as effective in a bumper.

runners.name: Boldplay
runners.comment: Beaten 33l in a Down Royal bumper last December and can't be fancied on that evidence
runners.spotlight: Beaten 33l in a Down Royal bumper last December and can't be fancied on that evidence.

runners.name: Broomfield Aderra
runners.comment: Point winner was 3rd in a bumper; a player if handling the livelier ground today
runners.spotlight: Won a point on her fourth start in that sphere before a fine effort in a Fairyhouse bumper on rules debut; improvement is likely and she can be a player if handling the livelier ground today.

runners.name: Derryville
runners.comment: Not at best after a break when 5l behind Broomfield Aderra at Fairyhouse; needs more
runners.spotlight: Has put up several solid efforts in bumpers, with the best a 5l defeat by dual Grade 1 winner Bambino Fever at Punchestown; not as good after a break when 5l behind Broomfield Aderra in a Fairyhouse bumper last time; needs more.

runners.name: Kenisa Sport
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De L'Etoile & P Matzinger
runners.comment: Poor on soft ground in a Gowran bumper but then much better on good ground at Down Royal
runners.spotlight: Was runner-up on second point start, 7.5l ahead of Broomfield Aderra and sold for 85,000GBP since; poor on soft ground in a Gowran bumper on debut but then much better back on good ground at Down Royal (2.75l ahead of Oh Janey); a major player.

runners.name: Mighty Rosa
runners.comment: Has a decent pedigree and is one to keep an eye on in the betting
runners.spotlight: Thirteenth foal; sister to useful 2m/2m1f hurdle winner for this yard Mighty Tom, half-sister to other winners including Lucky Phil (2m hurdle) and Our Pollyanna (bumper); dam 1m4f Flat (RPR 72)/2m hurdle winner; decent pedigree and one to keep an eye on in the betting.

runners.name: Oh Janey
runners.comment: Third at Down Royal, 2.75l behind Kenisa Sport; out of her depth in Listed company since
runners.spotlight: The best of three bumper starts was when third at Down Royal, 2.75l behind Kenisa Sport; out of her depth in Listed company since; needs to find improvement.

runners.name: Ringcreevy Diamond
runners.comment: Beaten 37l and 33l in maiden hurdles and has to do much better reverting to a bumper
runners.spotlight: Beaten 37l and 33l in maiden hurdles last month and has to do much better reverting to a bumper.

runners.name: Rushes And Whins
runners.breeder: Margaret Treacy On His Own Stables
runners.comment: Beaten 21l in a Down Royal maiden hurdle in March and has to find plenty of improvement
runners.spotlight: Beaten 21l in a Down Royal maiden hurdle in March and has to find plenty of improvement reverting to a bumper.

runners.name: Silver Lafanta
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in a bumper last summer and maiden hurdle on comeback; can't be fancied
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in a bumper last summer and a maiden hurdle on comeback; can't be fancied on that evidence.

runners.name: Stella Court
runners.comment: Always in rear in a Bellewstown bumper on debut, beaten 26l; lots of improvement needed
runners.spotlight: Always in rear in a Bellewstown bumper on debut, beaten 26l; lots of improvement needed.

runners.name: Tricksofthetrade
runners.comment: Third in a Cork bumper on rules debut; the hood worn then is left off; can get involved
runners.spotlight: Placed on all three point starts and another solid effort when third in a Cork bumper on rules debut; the hood worn then is left off and she can get involved with improvement to come.

runners.name: Walk Out The Dor
runners.comment: Pulled-up in two points and well beaten in a bumper so can't be fancied on that evidence
runners.spotlight: Pulled-up in two points and well beaten in a bumper so can't be fancied on that evidence.

runners.name: Midak
runners.breeder: Haras De S A Aga Khan Scea

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan

runners.comment: Yet to be beaten and won well from front last time; likely candidate for top stable
runners.spotlight: Unraced as a 2yo and followed his debut win in a 1m3f Fibresand maiden at Lyon-La Soie with success in a conditions event at Chantilly over the same distance (good to soft ground) from the front, when Piquoiseau came in fourth; not entered in the Prix du Jockey Club like some of these but lots of potential for further improvement despite the slight drop in distance; likely candidate.

runners.name: Aidans Phone
runners.comment: Beaten and been beaten by Uther this year; respected but others less exposed
runners.spotlight: Won three in a row earlier this year, including a head success over Uther in a C&D Listed event here (very soft ground), but that form got readily reversed 26 days ago in a Group 3 at Longchamp, although the son of Prince Gibraltar did get stuck behind a wall of horses for a while; can go closer this time but others have more scope for better.

runners.name: Piquoiseau
runners.comment: Was behind Midak 25 days ago but did shape with promise; has more to offer
runners.spotlight: Stablemate of Uther; won his sole start as a 2yo in a Bordeaux Le Bouscat maiden for unraced horses over 1m1.5f (heavy ground) but was then comfortably held, although showing some promise, by Midak 25 days ago at Chantilly, albeit that rival had one run this year under his belt; couldn't be dismissed but need to step forward from that recent run.

runners.name: Dioptase
runners.breeder: Scea Marmion Vauville, Ecurie Skymarc Farm & Nightchill Llc
runners.owner: Le Marais Sas, Ecuries Serge Stempniak, Guy Pariente Holding

prev_owners.owner: Le Marais Sas, Ecuries Serge Stempniak Et Al

runners.comment: Bit to find on the figures and others easier to like for win purposes
runners.spotlight: Knows how to win as he showed when landing a conditions event at Salon-de-Provence last time over 1m2f but this is a step up in class and he's only raced on very soft or heavy ground to this point; bit to find on the figures and others easier to like for win purposes.

runners.name: Uther
runners.comment: Last win has been boosted already; well bred and sets a good standard
runners.spotlight: Notably a half-brother to dual Group 1 winner Sosie among other smart sorts; beaten a head by Aidan's Phone in a Listed event over C&D on his 3yo return, but turned that form around when landing the 1m2f 110yd Group 3 Prix Noailles almost a month ago at Longchamp (good to soft), form already boosted by the second; holds a couple of Group 1 entries and sets a good standard to overturn.

quotes.quote: Uther has a long acceleration rather than a real turn of foot and, talking to Mickael [Barzalona], he became a little disorganised, but once he was balanced he picked up well. He's still a big baby but he has quality, and I don't think he'll have any problem staying a mile and a half in time. Next he could go to the Prix Greffulhe - Christophe Ferland, trainer.
